label: Refuted

claim: Professor Tasuku Honjo worked in the Wuhan laboratory in China for four years.
evi:
Where does Professor Honjo currently work?		
Professor Honjo works as a Deputy Director-General and Distinguished Professor at the Kyoto University Institute for Advanced Study (KUIAS).		

Has Professor Honjo ever worked in the Wuhan laboratory in China?		
No, There is no evidence to suggest that Professor Honjo worked at the Wuhan laboratory in China.
label: Refuted

claim: The CDC does not Recommend That People Who Are Healthy Wear Facemasks
evi:
What is the CDC recommendation on Covid 19		
We now know from recent studies that a significant portion of individuals with coronavirus lack symptoms ("asymptomatic") and that even those who eventually develop symptoms ("pre-symptomatic") can transmit the virus to others before showing symptoms. This means that the virus can spread between people interacting in close proximity--for example, speaking, coughing, or sneezing--even if those people are not exhibiting symptoms. In light of this new evidence, CDC recommends wearing cloth face coverings in public settings where other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain (e.g., grocery stores and pharmacies) especially in areas of significant community-based transmission.		

Did the CDC advice on facemasks change over the course of the pandemic?		
Yes, It was updated on April 3 2020 to recommend the use of facemasks
label: Refuted

claim: In Pennsylvania, US, if you're refused service at a store for not wearing a mask you can call the Department of Health and report the store.
evi:
What do the Pennsylvanias Department of health say about mask wearing in stores and business areas?		
The following measures apply to businesses, other than
health care providers, that serve the public within a building or a defined area: Require all customers to wear masks while on premises, and deny entry to
individuals not wearing masks, unless the business is providing medication,
medical supplies, or food, in which case the business must provide
alternative methods of pick-up or delivery of such goods; however,
individuals who cannot wear a mask due to a medical condition (including
children under the age of 2 years per CDC guidance) may enter the premises
and are not required to provide documentation of such medical condition;
label: Refuted

claim: Trader Joe's are giving away a chance to get a $250 coupon.
evi:
Does Trader Joe's give out coupon to customers ?		
The news around the COVID-19 outbreak is constantly changing, but information about food safety and how to keep yourself healthy is crucial right now. Here is a comprehensive list on the foods you should be stocking up on during this period of social distancing, as well as information about your local grocery stores’ changing hours, an explanation of “no-contact delivery,” and a guide on how to help your community and its businesses throughout closures.

The coronavirus has shown us the good in one another, with countless Americans donating time and funds to support nonprofits dedicated to feeding those in need. At the same time, many scams have popped up as criminals seek to take advantage of unsuspecting strangers by stealing items of value like personal information or money.

Trader Joe's this week warned customers about fake $250 coupons being circulated on Facebook. The grocery chain is NOT giving away free groceries because of the "Corona Pandemic."
More From Delish
Cherry Pie
Video Player is loading.
Current Time 0:00
Remaining Time -12:27

"It has been brought to our attention that organizations may be appropriating the Trader Joe's name in association with coupon, discount, or gift card offerings online," the grocer wrote on its website. "Trader Joe's has NO association with these organizations. We do not offer any Trader Joe's coupons, discounts, or gift cards online."

According to the Associated Press, social media users were pushed to "hurry up" and click on a link to "collect your FREE voucher." The link redirected unassuming customers to a survey about Trader Joe's, which promised a fake coupon would arrive.

"When alerted to the existence of misleading promotions of this nature, Trader Joe's says it actively attempts to remove its name from any misleading promotions," the company said. "We protect the privacy of the information our customers share with us, and we will never ask for our customers to provide any personal or financial details in our com		

How many customers got the Trader Joe's coupon giveaways?		
Trader Joe's has gathered a cult-like following over the years, earning the title of America's favorite market more than once. Dedicated shoppers love the friendly staff, localized offerings, and unbeatably low prices. But there's more to the seafaring-themed supermarket than meets the eye. Several current and former employees divulged some helpful insider secrets about the famous chain. Here's everything you need to know before grabbing a shopping cart.
1. Don't expect additional discounts or sales.

Trader Joe's iconic newsletter, the Fearless Flyer, only comes out eight times a year. It highlights the newest products hitting shelves for that time of year, so customers can get a heads up on all the seasonal offerings. However, it's devoid of any coupons or discount offers—because the store already sells all of its products at the lowest possible price point.
2. Yes, coupons are accepted.

As mentioned, Trader Joe's does not offer any store coupons. But the chain does accept all manufacturer coupons, according to one personal finance blogger. It's worth a try to save a few extra bucks!
label: Refuted

Did 100 Indian nurses in Jhalawar resigned because Jamaatis spit at them?

evi:
What is the H.R. 5717 bill?		
To end the epidemic of gun violence and build safer communities by strengthening Federal firearms laws and supporting gun violence research, intervention, and prevention initiatives.		

How much would taxes on gun sales rise under the H.R. 5717 bill?		
(1) Articles taxable at 30 percent:

“(A) Pistols.

“(B) Revolvers.

“(C) Firearms (other than pistols and revolvers).

claim: The CDC has stopped reporting flu deaths because they are so low
evi:
Did the CDC continue recording flu deaths after April 2020 (when the claim was made)?

Were flu deaths reported by the CDC before May 2020?		
Yes, See CDC website showing graphs during that time.

claim: Children in the U.S. don't seem to be getting COVID-19.
evi:
How many kids have had COVID-19 cases to date?		
Of the more than 1 million coronavirus cases reported in the country, 40,457 affected patients were 17 or younger.		

Have children in the U.S. died due to COVID-19?		
Yes, There have been news reports on children's deaths caused by COVID-19.		

How does COVID-19 affect children?		
Children, including very young children, can develop COVID-19. Many of them have no symptoms. Those that do get sick tend to experience milder symptoms such as low-grade fever, fatigue, and cough.		

Are children at a high risk for severe illness due to COVID-19?		
While fewer children have been sick with COVID-19 compared to adults, children can be infected with the virus that causes COVID-19, can get sick from COVID-19, and can spread the virus that causes COVID-19 to others. Children, like adults, who have COVID-19 but have no symptoms (“asymptomatic”) can still spread the virus to others.

Most children with COVID-19 have mild symptoms or have no symptoms at all. However, some children can get severely ill from COVID-19. They might require hospitalization, intensive care, or a ventilator to help them breathe. In rare cases, they might die.
label: Refuted

claim: A virus simply does not exist.
evi:
What is a virus?		
A virus is an infectious agent of small size and simple composition that can multiply only in living cells of animals, plants, or bacteria.		

When were viruses discovered?		
The earliest indications of the biological nature of viruses came from studies in 1892 by the Russian scientist Dmitry I. Ivanovsky and in 1898 by the Dutch scientist Martinus W. Beijerinck.
label: Refuted

and "written by Jennifer Saunders".

As gas prices continue to push cheaper across the country, only one dozen states carry an average of $2/gallon or more.

New York is one of only 12 states where the average gallon of gas costs more than $2.00, according to numbers provided by the AAA of Western and Central New York.

Only four states in the region (Mid-Atlantic and Northeast) carry gas prices above $2/gallon: Washington, D.C. ($2.17), New York ($2.15), Pennsylvania ($2.02) and New Jersey ($1.99).
(May 04, 2020)

claim: Over 100 nurses in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar (India) resigned because of misconduct by members of the Tablighi Jamaat (non-political organisation) and claim that they were spitting on them.
evi:
What is Tablighi Jamaat ?		
Tablighi Jamaat, which means 'the Society for Spreading Faith', is an Islamic missionary movement which aims to encourage Muslims to return to practising their religion during the lifetime of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, and particularly in matters of ritual, dress, and personal behavior. The teachings of Tabligh Jamaat are expressed in "Six Principles" - Kalimah (Declaration of faith), Salah (Prayer), Ilm-o-zikr (Knowledge), Ikraam-e-Muslim (Respect of Muslim), Ikhlas-e-Niyyat (Sincerity of intention), Dawat-o-Tableegh (Proselytizaton).		

Who founded The Tablighi ?		
The Tablighi Jama’at was founded in 1926 in Mewat, India, by Maulana Muhammad Ilyas, an Islamic scholar and teacher. The movement began as an effort to counteract the activities of Hindu revivalists in India, who at the time were attempting to convert Muslims to Hinduism. Worried that existing Islamic educational institutions were not capable of fending off the Hindu challenge, Ilyas envisioned a movement that would send missionaries to villages to instill Muslims with core Islamic values.		

Why did the nurses resign from Jhalawar hospital?		
the reports mentioned that the nurses had resigned due to administration issues and to rebel against low wages. The nurses also mentioned in their resignation letter that the healthcare workers weren't being given proper protection gear or PPE kits; they also mentioned how they were willing to come back to work if the conditions improved and if PPE kits were provided.
label: Refuted

claim: Australia's COVIDsafe app traces and monitors the location of a user.
evi:
Can COVIDsafe app traces and monitors the location of a user ?		
The federal government has announced plans to introduce a contact tracing mobile app to help curb COVID-19’s spread in Australia. However, rather than collecting location data directly from mobile operators, the proposed TraceTogether app will use Bluetooth technology to sense whether users who have voluntarily opted-in have come within nine metres of one another.

Contact tracing apps generally store 14-21 days of interaction data between participating devices to help monitor the spread of a disease. The tracking is usually done by government agencies. This form of health surveillance could help the Australian government respond to the coronavirus crisis by proactively placing confirmed and suspected cases in quarantine.		

Does  COVIDsafe app use Bluetooth tracking  technology ?		
In a scramble to track, and thereby stem the flow of, new cases of the Coronavirus, Governments around the world are rushing to track the locations of their populace. One way to do this is to write a smartphone app which uses Bluetooth technology, and encourage (or mandate) that individuals download and use the app. The aim of this piece is to provide more detail on the technology itself, rather than a deep dive into the risks and whether or not Bluetooth technology should be used.		

Can COVIDsafe app traces and monitors the location of the users ?		
The COVIDsafe app doesn’t have any geolocation capability, it does not track your location, only the proximity of your phone to other people’s phones that have downloaded the app and cannot monitor a person’s location at any time.Experts at the University of Sydney have also stated the app cannot track location.
label: Refuted

claim: The CARES Act was introduced Jan. 24, 2019.
evi:
When was the CARES Act introduced?		
Sen. Mitch McConnell introduced the CARES Act on March 25 2020.		

When did Donald Trump sign the CARES Act into law?		
The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, also known as the CARES Act, is a $2.2 trillion economic stimulus bill passed by the 116th U.S. Congress and signed into law by President Donald Trump on March 27, 2020, in response to the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.		

When was the CARES Act in its current form, which Donald Trump signed into law on March 27 2020, introduced in Congress?		
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., introduced legislation on Thursday (March 19, 2020) to address the economic impact of the coronavirus. This is the third legislative package to deal with the outbreak.

The 247-page bill, dubbed the CARES Act — the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act — provides direct cash payments, loan guarantees for impacted businesses and more resources for testing and development of vaccines.
label: Refuted

Did President Trump try to defund the NIH?		
Yes, Trumps budget proposal for fiscal 2020 included reduced funding of NIH.

Is there any data that gives a percentage figure for the efficacy of masks?

claim: Indian government is giving all willing citizens Rs 1000 under a 'Corona Aid Scheme'
evi:
What financial aid did the Indian government announce prior to the date the claim was made (25/4/2020)?		
On 26th March 2020 the Indian Finance Minister announced a Rs 1.7 trillion relief package under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana scheme for the poor to help them fight the battle against Coronavirus. This included:

- Insurance cover of Rs 50 Lakh per health worker fighting COVID-19 to be provided under Insurance Scheme
- 80 crore poor people will to get 5 kg wheat or rice and 1 kg of preferred pulses for free every month for the next three months
- 20 crore women Jan Dhan account holders to get Rs 500 per month for next three months
- Increase in MNREGA wage to Rs 202 a day from Rs 182 to benefit 13.62 crore families
- An ex-gratia of Rs 1,000 to 3 crore poor senior citizen, poor widows and poor disabled
- Government to front-load Rs 2,000 paid to farmers in first week of April under existing PM Kisan Yojana to benefit 8.7 crore farmers
- Central Government has given orders to State Governments to use Building and Construction Workers Welfare Fund to provide relief to Construction Workers		

Did the financial aid package include transferring Rs 1000 to all “willing citizens” as per the claim?		
No, Cash transfer measures are set to benefit farmers, rural workers, poor pensioners, construction workers, low-income widowers and more.
label: Refuted

claim: Presidents Lincoln and Kennedy were Assasinated for trying to end Federal reserve banking system.
evi:
Was President Lincoln And Kennedy Assassinated  for trying  to End Federal Reserve banking system ?		
There is a meme circulating on Facebook that seems to be based on the conspiracy theory that Abraham Lincoln and John F. Kennedy were assassinated by the Rothschilds because they wanted to “end the federal reserve banking system.” Let’s pick this meme apart to see how historically accurate it is.

1. There was no federal reserve system when Lincoln was president. The Federal Reserve System was not established until 1913.

2. Prior to the Federal Reserve System, there had been a national bank*, and Andrew Jackson had made its end one of his key second-term goals.

3. Two assassins attempted to kill Jackson, but no evidence suggests that they were sent by the Bank.**

4. Some people have emphasized the eerie similarities between Lincoln and Kennedy, which are easily explainable.

* There were two national banks, in fact: The 1st Bank of the U.S., which was chartered from 1791-1811 and the 2nd Bank of the U.S., chartered from 1816-1836.

** There is that pesky Booth letter, though.
label: Refuted

claim: Without Donald Trump's China travel ban, millions would have died of coronavirus
evi:
Did Donald Trump ban travel to China on January 31st 2020?		
No, Trump introduced restrictions and limitations to travel but not an outright ban.		

Did the restrictions to travel announced on January 31st 2020, save millions of lives in USA?		
There is no evidence to show that millions of lives were saved.

After hearing from Iowans and seeing the overwhelming response of small businesses across the country, it’s clear we need to bolster the Paycheck Protection Program. Workers and employers in Iowa and across the country need this relief now more than ever, so let’s put aside the politics and swiftly get this specific additional support for small businesses approved so money can keep flowing, Iowa workers can continue to collect a paycheck, and our state’s small businesses can stay afloat,” said Senator Ernst

claim: Wisconsin is clearly seeing a decline in COVID infections
evi:
How many confirmed cases in Wisconsin during this time period?		
Zooming in to the last six days (April 15 to 20), Wisconsin had between 147 and 170 new confirmed cases per day. The tally was lower the days before that due to a lower number of tests being performed.

The most recent tally released prior to the statement from Vos and Fitzgerald was April 20, with 153 cases, up six from the day before. That’s on par with the April average of 157 new cases per day.		

What about hospitalizations?		
This is the lone metric that shows a decline over the last couple weeks.

After rising to start the month, the daily tally leveled off around 440 per day from April 9 to 14.

The number then dropped for two days before holding steady between 357 and 361 from April 17 to 21.		

Does this show a clear decline in COVID infections?		
There are a lot of ways to slice the coronavirus data, but this is an exaggeration.

New cases and deaths in the week before this claim were roughly in line with both the preceding week and the averages for the month of April. Hospitalizations had dropped somewhat from the week prior, but were holding steady for the five preceding days.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

evi:
What is novel coronavirus?		
The novel coronavirus was similar to other coronaviruses known to have originated in bats and was thought to be passed from bats to other animals before being transmitted to humans.		

What Novel coronavirus does the claim refer to?		
A novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV,
also referred to as SARS-CoV-2/Covid-19), which has resulted in millions of confirmed human infections globally.
Cases of asymptomatic infection, mild illness, severe illness, and deaths have been reported.		

When was the novel coronavirus Covid 19 first detected in the U.S ?		
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s data on COVID-19 cases in the United States lists the earliest date of illness onset as January 14, 2020.

claim: Coronavirus started spreading in the US in November 2019.
evi:
What is coronavirus?		
Coronaviruses (CoVs) are the largest group of viruses belonging to the Nidovirales order, which includes Coronaviridae, Arteriviridae, Mesoniviridae, and Roniviridae families. The Coronavirinae comprise one of two subfamilies in the Coronaviridae family, with the other being the Torovirinae. The Coronavirinae are further subdivided into four genera, the alpha, beta, gamma, and delta coronaviruses.		

Which strain of coronavirus does the claim refer to?		
COVID-19, the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus.		

When was Covid 19 first reported in the U.S?		
data for COVID-19 cases in the U.S lists the earliest date of illness onset as January 14, 2020.		

Are there any reports of Covid 19 illnesses in the U.S before January 2020?		
No, The outbreak only began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019

yes, The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention stated in a report published on April 6 that among 149,082 (99.6%) reported COVID-19 cases for which age was known, 2,572 (1.7%) were among children younger than 18 years.

Yes, It’s not easy for people who are unemployed to find a job.

DID 44 SENATORS VOTE AGAINST SENDING AMERICANS CORONAVIRUS STIMULUS PAYMENTS?

Did Nigeria's First Lady claim that her husband was dead?

claim: Convalescent plasma therapy showing promise against COVID-19
evi:
What is Convalescent plasma therapy?		
Using convalescent plasma -- a component of blood -- as a treatment is a decades-old idea, and has been used to treat other diseases like influenza and measles. When a patient recovers from a disease, they produce antibodies to fight the presence of the antigen that caused the disease, and those proteins will remain in the blood for a few months.		

What proof is there that Convalescent plasma therapy is working for coronavirus patients?		
Results  All 5 patients (age range, 36-65 years; 2 women) were receiving mechanical ventilation at the time of treatment and all had received antiviral agents and methylprednisolone. Following plasma transfusion, body temperature normalized within 3 days in 4 of 5 patients, the SOFA score decreased, and Pao2/Fio2 increased within 12 days (range, 172-276 before and 284-366 after). Viral loads also decreased and became negative within 12 days after the transfusion, and SARS-CoV-2–specific ELISA and neutralizing antibody titers increased following the transfusion (range, 40-60 before and 80-320 on day 7). ARDS resolved in 4 patients at 12 days after transfusion, and 3 patients were weaned from mechanical ventilation within 2 weeks of treatment. Of the 5 patients, 3 have been discharged from the hospital (length of stay: 53, 51, and 55 days), and 2 are in stable condition at 37 days after transfusion.

Conclusions and Relevance  In this preliminary uncontrolled case series of 5 critically ill patients with COVID-19 and ARDS, administration of convalescent plasma containing neutralizing antibody was followed by improvement in their clinical status. The limited sample size and study design preclude a definitive statement about the potential effectiveness of this treatment, and these observations require evaluation in clinical trials.		

What proof is there that Convalescent plasma therapy is working for coronavirus patients?		
COVID-19 is currently a big threat to global health. However, no specific antiviral agents are available for its treatment. In this work, we explored the feasibility of convalescent plasma (CP) transfusion to rescue severe patients. The results from 10 severe adult cases showed that one dose (200 mL) of CP was welltolerated and could significantly increase or maintain the neutralizing antibodies at a high level, leading to disappearance of viremia in 7 days. Meanwhile, clinical symptoms and paraclinical criteria rapidly improved within 3 days. Radiological examination showed varying degrees of absorption of lung lesions within 7 days. These results indicate that CP can serve as a promising rescue option for severe COVID-19 while the randomized trial is warranted.		

What proof is there that Convalescent plasma therapy is working for coronavirus patients?		
In order to evaluate the efficacy of convalescent plasma therapy in the treatment of patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), 80 SARS patients were given convalescent plasma at Prince of Wales Hospital, Hong Kong, between 20 March and 26 May 2003. Good outcome was defined as discharge by day 22 following the onset of SARS symptoms. Poor outcome was defined as death or hospitalization beyond 22 days. A higher day-22 discharge rate was observed among patients who were given convalescent plasma before day 14 of illness (58.3% vs 15.6%; P<0.001) and among those who were PCR positive and seronegative for coronavirus at the time of plasma infusion (66.7% vs 20%; P=0.001).

Protect yourself and those around you:

Keep physical distance of at least 1 metre from others, even if they don’t appear to be sick. Avoid crowds and close contact.
Wear a properly fitted mask when physical distancing is not possible and in poorly ventilated settings.
Clean your hands frequently with alcohol-based hand rub or soap and water.
Cover your mouth and nose with a bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Dispose of used tissues immediately and clean hands regularly. 
If you develop symptoms or test positive for COVID-19, self-isolate until you recover.

claim: Drinking milk with honey on an empty stomach is the antidote to COVID-19.
evi:
What is the role of diet and nutrition during the COVID-19 pandemic?		
nutrition is intricately linked to immunity and to the risk and severity of infections. Poorly nourished individuals are at a greater risk of various bacterial, viral, and other infections. 
Conversely, chronic or severe infections lead to nutritional disorders or worsen the nutritional status of affected people. Therefore, it is imperative for all of us to pay attention to our diet and nutritional status during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.		

What recommendations are given?		
Indeed, consuming good quality diets is always desirable, and this is particularly important during the COVID-19 pandemic. A healthy diet, as depicted by the Healthy Eating Plate, emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, legumes, and nuts, moderate consumption of fish, dairy foods, and poultry, and limited intake of red and processed meat, refined carbohydrates, and sugar. Added fats should be primarily liquid oils such as olive, canola, or soybean oil.		

What research supports drinking milk with honey on an empty stomach as the antidote to COVID-19?

claim: Drinking ash of Phyllostachys nigra (black bamboo) mixed with honey and cow’s milk is a potent treatment for COVID-19.
evi:
Is black bamboo used in alternative medicine?		
Yes, 2.1.2 Phyllostachys nigra (Lodd.) Munro Commonly known as “black bamboo”, this is another major species in the genus Phyllostachys. Flavonoids extracted from black bamboo leaves have potent antioxidant activities (Hu et al., 2000; Zhang et al., 2002). Among these flavonoids, flavone c-glucosides and p-coumaric acid reportedly have long retention time in the colon and may contribute to free radical scavenging (Zhang et al., 2007). Luteolin 6-C-(6″-O-trans-caffeoylglucoside), an antioxidant isolated from the leaves, has been reported to protect against oxidative stress-induced cytotoxicity in retinal ganglion cells (Lee et al., 2010). It also enhances the activity of aldose reductase and inhibits the formation of advanced glycation end products, and therefore may potentially have a role in the prevention of diabetic complications (Jung et al., 2007).
Orientin, another antioxidant obtained from the leaves of black bamboo, exerts vaso-relaxant activity through the inhibition of intracellular Ca2+ release and extracellular Ca2+ influx (Fu et al., 2005). Orientin also prevents apoptosis induced by hypoxia and reoxygenation in myocardium and cardiomyocytes. The mechanism for this effect is inhibition of the activation of mitochondrial apoptotic pathway (Fu et al., 2006). These studies suggest potential for cardio-protective effects.

The acetone fraction of the leaves of Phyllostachys nigra (Lodd.) Munro has been shown to enhance leukemia cell differentiation (Kim et al., 2007b), and inhibit interleukin-12 (IL-12) production in lipopolysaccharide-activated macrophages via decreasing NF-kappaB binding activity (Kim et al., 2007a). These preliminary findings suggest potential anti-leukemia and anti-inflammation effects of the acetone extract.		

Can alternative medicines be used to effectively treat Covid-19?		
No, It's a myth		

Can alternative medicines be used to effectively treat Covid-19?		
No, there is no evidence to support the use of herbal supplements as a preventive measure/cure for COVID-19
label: Refuted

claim: China halted exports of face masks to US during the coronavirus pandemic
evi:
Did China stop exporting masks to other countries ?		
China stopped exporting masks and imported 56 million masks in the first week of January;		

Why did they stop exports?		
China had a greater need. Masks were donated to China by some countries. In the midst of the crisis, Chinese demand was estimated at 240 million masks per day (more than ten times its manufacturing capacity).		

Were there some exports of masks get sent from China to USA?		
On Sunday, March 29th, Atlas Air operated the first flight for Project Airbridge from Shanghai, China into New York City’s John F. Kennedy International Airport.  The flight carried 130,000 N-95 masks; nearly 1.8 million surgical masks and gowns; more than 10.3 million gloves; and more than 70,000 thermometers.		

How much did China's exports of PPE including masks decline during January to February of 2020?		
China’s exports to the world of personal protective equipment (PPE) worn by medical professionals when treating coronavirus (COVID-19) declined by only 15 percent in January and February of 2020 compared with the same two-month period in 2019.		

Did China at any point during the COVID-19 pandemic halt exports of masks to the United States?		
No, China never stopped exports of facemasks. Instead, export restrictions were implemented meaning less facemasks were delivered to the United States but nevertheless implemented: "Chinese officials have said they are intended to ensure the quality of exported medical products and to make sure needed goods aren’t being shipped out of China."		

How many masks did China export to the United States in March 2020?		
On Sunday, March 29th, Atlas Air operated the first flight for Project Airbridge from Shanghai, China into New York City’s John F. Kennedy International Airport.  The flight carried 130,000 N-95 masks; nearly 1.8 million surgical masks.

Where did Abba Kyari die

Wellington hospital in London.		

Did Wellington hospital treat covid patients?		
No, “Please do not attend an HCA UK facility for any reason if you have a high temperature (more than 37.8 degrees) or have a new continuous cough or streaming nose or flu-like symptoms. If you do have these symptoms or anyone in your household does, please follow Public Health England guidance,” the company warns. 

“We are not accepting direct admissions of patients that have coronavirus. If you believe you have coronavirus symptoms, please follow guidance from the NHS [National Health Service].”		

Is it standard policy in the UK for COVID-19 victims who pass away to be cremated?		
This means COVID-19 fatalities cannot be cremated against their wish and may be buried normally. The regulation accords with that of the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) which states that “decedents [deceased persons] with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 can be buried or cremated as usual.”

No, The prefix indicates the country where it was obtained from, but does not determine the country in which the product was manufactured

claim: The seasonal flu killed 80,000 people in the United States in 2018-2019
evi:
What was the mortality rate of the seasonal flu in 2018-2019 in the United States ?		
2018-2019 Estimates

Influenza activity in the United States during the 2018–2019 season began to increase in November and remained at high levels for several weeks during January–February5. Influenza A viruses were the predominant circulating viruses last year. While influenza A(H1N1pdm09) viruses predominated from October 2018 – mid February 2019, influenza A(H3N2) viruses were more commonly reported starting in late February 2019. Influenza B viruses were not commonly reported among circulating viruses during the 2018–2019 season. The season had moderate severity based on levels of outpatient influenza-like illness, hospitalizations rates, and proportions of pneumonia and influenza-associated deaths.

CDC estimates that the burden of illness during the 2018–2019 season included an estimated 35.5 million people getting sick with influenza, 16.5 million people going to a health care provider for their illness, 490,600 hospitalizations, and 34,200 deaths from influenza (Table 1). The number of influenza-associated illnesses that occurred last season was similar to the estimated number of influenza-associated illnesses during the 2012–2013 influenza season when an estimated 34 million people had symptomatic influenza illness6.

Peak activity during the 2018–2019 influenza season was classified as having moderate severity across ages in the population. Compared with the 2017–2018 season , which was classified as high severity, the overall rates and burden of influenza were much lower during the 2018–2019 season (Table 2). Among children, however, rates of influenza during the 2018–2019 season were similar to the 2017–2018 season. In addition, the 2018–2019 season had two waves of activity, including a wave predominated by influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 viruses and another wave of similar magnitude attributable to influenza A(H3N2) viruses5. The dual waves resulted in a protracted season during 2018–2019 that was less severe when compared with peak activity in 2017–2018, but r		

How many people got infected with the seasonal flu in 2018-2019 in the United States ?		
The overall burden of influenza (flu) for the 2018-2019 season was an estimated 29 million flu illnesses, 13 million flu-related medical visits, 380,000 flu-related hospitalizations, and 28,000 flu deaths (Table 1).

For the past several years, CDC has estimated the numbers of flu illnesses, medical visits, hospitalizations, and deaths1–4. More information on How CDC Estimates Flu Burden and Why CDC Estimates Flu Burden is available.

label: Refuted

claim: All vaccines contain MRC-5 cells, which are aborted fetal cells.
evi:
What is MRC-5?		
Human Cell Strains.
Two main human cell strains have been used to develop currently available vaccines, in each case with the original fetal cells in question obtained in the 1960s. The WI-38 cell strain was developed in 1962 in the United States, and the MRC-5 cell strain (also started with fetal lung cells) was developed, using Hayflick's technology, in 1970 at the Medical Research Center in the United Kingdom.		

What vaccines has MRC-5 been used to develop?		
The vaccines below were developed using either the WI-38 or the MRC-5 cell strains.

Hepatitis A vaccines [VAQTA/Merck, Havrix/GlaxoSmithKline, and part of Twinrix/GlaxoSmithKline]
Rubella vaccine [MERUVAX II/Merck, part of MMR II/Merck, and ProQuad/Merck]
Varicella (chickenpox) vaccine [Varivax/Merck, and part of ProQuad/Merck]
Zoster (shingles) vaccine [Zostavax/Merck]
Adenovirus Type 4 and Type 7 oral vaccine [Barr Labs] *
Rabies vaccine [IMOVAX/Sanofi Pasteur] *		

Is there a Code of Ethics about using human fetal tissue for research?		
Yes, Code of Medical Ethics Opinion 7.3.5		

How many vaccines have been developed using human fetus?		
In total only two fetuses, both obtained from abortions done by maternal choice, have given rise to the human cell strains used in vaccine development. Neither abortion was performed for the purpose of vaccine development.		

How many authorised vaccines contain MRC-5?		
USA 9		

How many authorised vaccines contain MRC-5?		
Canada 14		

How many authorised vaccines contain MRC-5?		
Australia 6
label: Refuted

claim: Chinese products can be identified by the first three digits of a barcode
evi:
Does the GS1 Prefix (first 2 or 3 digits of the EAN-13 barcode number) show the country of origin?		
​​​No, The GS1 Prefix does not show the country of origin.
An EAN-13 barcode number always starts with the GS1 Prefix of the GS1 Member Organisation that allocated the barcode number. The GS1 Prefix does not indicate that the product was manufactured in a specific country or by a specific manufacturer; it may have been produced anywhere in the world.
label: Refuted

claim: There is always the possibility of an iatrogenic reaction to a vaccine.
evi:
Can vaccines cause an iatrogenic reaction?		
Yes, Vaccines can cause a risk of side effects or complications.		

What is a Iatrogenic reaction?		
Iatrogenic disease is the result of diagnostic and therapeutic procedures undertaken on a patient. With the multitude of drugs prescribed to a single patient adverse drug reactions are bound to occur. The Physician should take suitable steps to detect and manage them.

Iatrogenic (of a disease or symptoms) induced in a patient by the treatment or comments of a physician.

Chambers English Dictionary		

Are vaccines safe despite the risk of side effects or complications?		
Any vaccine can cause side effects. For the most part these are minor (for example, a sore arm or low-grade fever) and go away within a few days. 

Remember, vaccines are continually monitored for safety, and like any medication, vaccines can cause side effects. However, a decision not to immunize a child also involves risk and could put the child and others who come into contact with him or her at risk of contracting a potentially deadly disease.
label: Supported

claim: Immunization is compulsory in Canada
evi:
Is Immunization compulsory in Canada?		
Vaccination in Canada is only mandatory for students in Ontario and in the Atlantic province of New Brunswick. Nationwide, it is highly recommended.		

Are there any circumstances where exemptions of mandatory vaccinations in those provinces for students are made?		
While vaccination is generally required to attend school in Ontario and New Brunswick, there are exemptions given to those who are opposed.		

Are there any circumstances where exemptions of mandatory vaccinations in those provinces for students are made?		
As might be expected in Canada, vaccination policies are as diverse as the geogra-high immunization rates by educating their populations about the benefits of vaccines. Just three have legislated vaccination policies, applying strictly to children about to enrol in school. Ontario and New Brunswick require immunization for diphtheria, tetanus, polio, measles, mumps, and rubella immunization, while Manitoba requires a measles vaccination.

In each case, though, the legislation includes an exemption clause. Essentially, each of the three provinces allows parents to request that their child be exempted from the vaccination requirement on medical or religious grounds, or simply out of conscience. In such instances, in the event of a disease outbreak, unvaccinated children can be excluded from entering a school.		

Other than the students in Ontario and New Brunswick are the greater population of Canada subject to mandatory immunization?		
No, Vaccination in Canada is voluntary.
label: Refuted

claim: 26 members of one family in Jahangirpuri, Delhi, tested positive for coronavirus on April 17 2020.
evi:
Who was the woman who contracted the illness initially		
Her name was Ajiman Bibi		

How many people got infected through her		
31 people got infected through her		

Out of the 31 people, how many people were members of her family		
She had 14 family members		

Out of the 31 people, how many people were members of her family		
She had 14 family members. Alt News spoke with three people (identity concealed at request) from the list of 31 patients. Each of them confirmed that the people listed on the document do not belong to one family. They also informed at least one of the names and the addresses has been inaccurately recorded.
label: Refuted

claim: Immunization is mandatory in the United States
evi:
Does the claim refer to a single vaccine immunisation?		
No, It refers to any enforced mandatory vaccination.		

Is is law in the U.S to accept any and all vaccines?		
No, All 50 states have legislation requiring specified vaccines for students. Although exemptions vary from state to state, all school immunization laws grant exemptions to children for medical reasons. There are 44 states and Washington D.C. that grant religious exemptions for people who have religious objections to immunizations. Currently, 15 states allow philosophical exemptions for children whose parents object to immunizations because of personal, moral or other beliefs. Many states align their vaccine requirements with recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. At this time, no state requires children to receive the COVID-19 vaccine for school entry.		

is it lawful to impose mandatory immuisation		
The 14th Amendment asserts that no state shall make or enforce any law abridging the privileges or immunities of citizens of the United States or deprive anY their rights

3,960* fatal unintentional drownings, including boating-related drowning—that is an average of 11 drowning deaths per day.
8,080† nonfatal drownings—that is an average of 22 nonfatal drownings per day.

In 2009, first lady Michelle Obama created a White House music series that has celebrated jazz, country, classical, Motown and Latin music.		

Has Michelle Obama ever celebrated country music?		
The Obama's hosted a 'Country Music: In Performance at the White House', paying tribute to the genre.
label: Refuted

claim: COVID-19 is sparing essential workers, so it's not so deadly.
evi:
Have essential workers died due to COVID-19?		
Yes, ...at least 79 of the New York Metropolitan Transit Authority's approximately 74,000 transit workers have died from COVID-19, nearly 3,000 have tested positive and more than 4,000 were out on quarantine as of April 20.		

Have essential workers died due to COVID-19?		
Yes, 79 New York Metropolitan Transportation Authority workers have died of COVID-19.		

What age range has the highest COVID-19 death rate?		
As of April 14, 72.3 percent of the 6,839 COVID-19 deaths in New York City had occurred among people over the age of 65, according to the New York City Department of Health.		

What age range has the highest COVID-19 death rate?		
As of April 14 data from New York City Health shows that 72.3% of deaths are among people over the age of 65.		

Who is most at risk from death due to covid?		
Older people and young people with pre existing health conditions are most at risk.		

Are any organisations keeping data on how many essential workers are ding of covid?		
Both the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the World Health Organization said they are not keeping track of whether those infected or killed by COVID-19 are essential workers
label: Refuted

claim: Joe Biden said that OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Administration) was not enforcing coronavirus guidelines when Donald Trump was US president.
evi:
When was Trump President of the US?		
January 20, 2017 – January 20, 2021		

Was OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Administration) in charge of enforcing Covid guidelines?		
Yes, It is within their remit, as stated in their Guidance on Preparing
Workplaces for COVID-19....
To assure safe and healthful working conditions for
working men and women; by authorizing enforcement
of the standards developed under the Act; by assisting
and encouraging the States in their efforts to assure
safe and healthful working conditions; by providing
for research, information, education, and training in
the field of occupational safety and health.”		

Were OSHA accused of failing to protect workers during the covid 19 pandemic?		
Yes, The National Employment Law Project, outlined complaints in a Hearing before the U.S. Senate
Committee on the Judiciary		

were the guidelines relseased by OSHA enforceable		
OSHA released coronavirus guidelines in early March, but they function as suggestions or recommendations and are not enforceable.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention lied about the number of deaths caused by COVID-19 by combining the count with pneumonia and influenza fatalities.
evi:
How many COVID deaths were recorded by the CDC in May 2020?		
37,308.		

How many Pneumonia deaths were recorded by the CDC in May 2020?		
64,382.		

How many Flu deaths were recorded by the CDC in May 2020?		
5,846.		

What was the total deaths from all causes in May 2020?		
719,438.		

Where do the statistics for compiling the death data for the CDC report originate from?		
Provisional death counts are based on death records received and processed by NCHS as of a specified cutoff date.		

Where is the information for cause of death taken from for the CDC reports?		
Death Certificates.
label: Refuted

claim: The drug Diamox, often used as treatment for high-altitude sickness, can cure the Coronavirus.
evi:
what is the drug Diamox used for?		
DIAMOX is a potent carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, effective in the control of fluid secretion (e.g.,
some types of glaucoma), in the treatment of certain convulsive disorders (e.g., epilepsy) and in the
promotion of diuresis in instances of abnormal fluid retention		

Is a symptom of Covid 19 glaucoma?		
No, Covid 19 symptoms are, Fever
Cough
Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
Diarrhea
Chills
Repeated shaking with chills
Muscle pain
Headache
Sore throat
New loss of taste or smell		

Is a symptom of Covid 19 convulsions?		
No, Covid 19 symptoms are, Fever
Cough
Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
Diarrhea
Chills
Repeated shaking with chills
Muscle pain
Headache
Sore throat
New loss of taste or smell		

Is a symptom of Covid 19 Fluid retention?		
No, Covid 19 symptoms are, Fever
Cough
Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
Diarrhea
Chills
Repeated shaking with chills
Muscle pain
Headache
Sore throat
New loss of taste or smell
label: Refuted

claim: Other countries that reopened saw an increase in coronavirus infections.
evi:
Did Hong Kong cases surge when it started to reopen?		
Yes, Hong Kong saw a COVID-19 surge which meant the government ordered facilities that had reopened to close again and for people to go back home.		

Did Japan cases surge when it started to reopen?		
The island of Hokkaido in the Japan region relaxed social distancing measures only for there to be a sudden increase in new coronavirus cases. All relaxation rules were reversed.		

What other Asian countries had to impose stricter measures?		
Singapore had to impose stricter measures to contain the virus from spreading.		

What have experts said regarding Andrew Cuomo's claim?		
"We are definitely seeing rises in cases in those places," said Stephen Kissler, Ph.D., a research fellow in the Department of Immunology and Infectious Diseases. Kissler is a co-author of a paper that stated that "prolonged or intermittent social distancing may be necessary into 2022." He said he is hesitant to link the increase solely to lifting social distancing measures, because there are a lot of reasons cases could rise after a period of sustained low transmission. 

"But on the whole I would say that the statement is correct," Kissler said.
label: Supported

claim: Alcohol plays a major role in killing the coronavirus because it is a “throat sanitizer”.
evi:
What is the basis of this claim?		
The claim asserts that because alcohol is used in hand sanitizer and cleaning products to kill the virus that causes COVID-19 on hands and surfaces, drinking it will have the same effect inside the body and sanitize the throat. This is definitely not the case. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) notes that, while certain types of alcohol can be used to disinfect surfaces and your skin, they are poisonous when ingested. Alcohol-based hand sanitizers require an alcohol concentration of 60% to 80% by volume		

Will drinking alcohol disinfect your throat or kill COVID-19 in your body?		
No, Drinking alcohol actually increased health risks when one is infected with COVID and increases susceptibility to catching COVID and other illnesses.
label: Refuted

claim: An employee at a funeral home in New York City was accidentally cremated while taking a nap during the 2020 COVID-19 crisis
evi:
what kind of website published the news		
This story was first published by “Weekly Inquirer”, which was replicated by many other websites, says an India Today report.

But the India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a hoax.

This is a satire article published by the website “Weekly Inquirer”, the AFWA said.
label: Refuted

claim: 150 health workers quarantined at Max Hospital Saket.
evi:
Why were health workers quarantined at Max Hospital in Saket, India?		
According to a press statement from Max Hospital, two patients admitted for cardiac treatment tested positive for COVID-19. A total of 39 healthcare workers, who were contact traced, have been quarantined...		

How many employers are working in the COVID ward of Max Hospital, Saket?		
There are 154 employees deployed in shifts in the COVID ward of Max Hospital, Saket.		

How many of these employees have had exposure to the virus?		
None of these employees has had any exposure to the virus. ... None of them is quarantined.		

What was the time of the tweet which stated the claim on April 13, 2020?		
The time recorded on the relevant tweet was 2:05 pm on April 13 2020.
label: Refuted

claim: "The 1st Amendment comes before the 13th and 14th, and the Bible clearly approves of owning slaves" stated David Green on Fox News this morning.

Where did the story originate?		
american-buffoon.com		

Is american-buffoon.com  a credible source?		
it is a satire news website.

claim: Trump Claims ‘Ultimate Authority’ to Override States’ Virus Measures
evi:
What did Trump actually say?		
Reporter: “There’s a debate over what authority you have to order the country reopened. What authority do you have on this one?”
Mr. Trump: “Well, I have the ultimate authority.”		

Does Trump have the authority to override stay-at-home or shelter-in-place orders from governors, or “total” authority in general?		
No, “The President has no formal legal authority to categorically override local or state shelter-in-place orders or to reopen schools and small businesses,” Stephen I. Vladeck, a professor at the University of Texas School of Law, said on Twitter. “No statute delegates to him such power; no constitutional provision invests him with such authority.”		

What authority does he have?		
While the federal government has authority over interstate and foreign quarantine measures, states have the primary authority to impose and enforce quarantine and isolation measures within their own borders, as part of the police powers conferred to states by the 10th Amendment of the Constitution, according to the Congressional Research Service and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
label: Refuted

claim: The US media minimized the risk of the new coronavirus from the start,
evi:
How did the US media first react to/report on the new coronavirus?		
16/01/2020
CNN
 — 
Fears are mounting across Asia over the cross-border spread of a new coronavirus identified in China that has killed one patient and sickened dozens, as health authorities race to identify the source of the pathogen.

The new strain of coronavirus, in the same family as the deadly severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS), originated in Wuhan, the largest city in central China. It was confirmed Thursday to have been detected in Japan, a few days after Thailand confirmed its first case of infection.		

How did the US media first react to/report on the new coronavirus?		
18/01/2020 NYT
Deadly Mystery Virus Reported in 2 New Chinese Cities and South Korea		

How did the US media first react to/report on the new coronavirus?		
20/01/2020 NBC
Coronavirus cases surge in China as virus spreads
The World Health Organization has warned the virus is a new strain that had not been previously identified in humans.

No, The claim is from a satire news site.

4 congresswomen known as 'The Squad'
Reps. Ilhan Omar of Minnesota, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York, Rashida Tlaib of Michigan and Ayanna Pressley of Massachusetts

No, It describes itelf as...
part of the "America's Last Line of Defense" network of satire websites

claim: In June 2017, Conservative MPs voted against a pay rise for nurses.
evi:
Did Conservative MPs vote against a pay rise for nurses in June 2017?		
On 28 June 2017 MPs voted on whether or not to lift that 1 per cent cap, meaning workers including nurses might get a pay rise. And the majority voted against it.		

Did Conservative MPs vote against a pay rise for nurses in June 2017?		
On 28 June 2017 MPs voted on whether or not to lift that 1 per cent cap, meaning workers including nurses might get a pay rise. And the majority of conservative voted against it.		

Did Conservative MPs lift the 1 percent cap?		
In September of 2017 Theresa May began to show flexibility, allowing pay rises for police officers and prison workers. 

Then in March 2018 she lifted the cap on pay rises for NHS workers. 

This cap was eventually lifted was largely owing to pressure on Theresa May's government from worker's unions and the Labour Party who gained 30 seats in parliament less than a month before the vote in 2017.		

Did nurses receive a pay raise after the cap was lifted?		
Unions including Unison and the Royal College of Nursing agreed on a pay rise of 6.5 per cent over three years for nurses, paramedics, midwives and healthcare assistants.

This would take starting pay for nurses from around £22,000 in 2018 to £25,000 next year.		

what was the date for the vote in the claim?		
june 2017		

When did conservatives vote against the pay rise?		
june 2017
label: Supported

claim: Some states, like Montana and Nebraska, are getting more than $300,000 in federal stimulus money per reported COVID-19 case. New York is the hardest-hit state and yet we are getting only about $12,000 per case.

How much stimulus money did New york receive per covid case in 2020		
$12,000 per coronavirus case at the time		

How much did Montana receive in stimulus payments per Covid case in 2020		
over $300,000 per case		

How much did Nebraska receive in stimulus payments per Covid case in 2020		
over $300,000 per case		

Are the states mentioned in the claim due more stimulus funding that is not mentioned in the claim?		
Yes, $100 billion is still to go out after the 30 in the claim.		

How much did Nebraska receive in stimulus payments per Covid case in 2020?		
over $300,000 per case

What was the name of the man who was mistakenly cremated		
Michael Jones		

Why did Facebook flag the post		
Facebook flagged the post as false because the original story came from a site that publishes fiction		

Have there been other similar claims		
Yes, There was also a claim that funeral home worker was mistakenly cremated and the Deputy Sheriff office was asked they said there was no crematorium facility in the location and that the image of the person in question was a mug shot of another man		

Was an exhausted funeral home employee  cremated by mistake while taking a nap in New York ?		
No, this is a fake news that is satirical nature

claim: The coronavirus originated outside China.

Where is the Covid-19 Virus believed to have started?		
Wuhan city, Hubei province.

claim: In November 2019 the Pirbirght Institute, funded by Bill Gates, was granted European patent number EP 317-2319B1 for a coronavirus vaccine that may be used to treat humans.
evi:
Does Bill Gates fund the Pirbright Institute?		
Major stakeholders include

International funding and disease control agencies, such as OIE, WHO, the European Commission, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation		

Does the Pirbright Institute carry out coronavirus research?		
The Pirbright Institute carries out research on infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus that infects poultry, and porcine deltacoronavirus that infects pigs. Pirbright does not currently work with human coronaviruses.		

What is European patent number EP 317-2319B1?		
No answer could be found.

claim: In the United States, the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) admitted in federal court that it does not have studies to support the claim that vaccines do not cause autism.
evi:
What does the CDC say about vaccines causing autism?		
studies have shown that there is no link between receiving vaccines and developing ASD.		

Has the CDC said in federal court that it des not have the studies to support the claim that vaccines do not cause autism?		
No answer could be found.		

Has the CDC submitted studies that show vaccines do not cause autism?		
Yes, 20 studies submitted in a legal case.
label: Refuted

claim: In October 2019, Bill Gates sponsored Event 201, a simulation that estimated 65 million people would be killed by coronavirus.
evi:
What was the event that Bill gates funded?		
Event 201		

What was the event and did they predict covid-19 ?		
It was an exercise and not a prediction. 
The Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security in partnership with the World Economic Forum and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation hosted Event 201, a high-level pandemic exercise on October 18, 2019, in New York, NY. The exercise illustrated areas where public/private partnerships will be necessary during the response to a severe pandemic in order to diminish large-scale economic and societal consequences.		

Did they predict 65 million people would die?		
No, there is no mention of this.
label: Refuted

claim: Aadhaar Enabled Payments Will Not Work Till April 14 in India
evi:
Can any verification can be found of this claim?		
No, A search of the web through  supplied browser reveals no information to confirm or otherwise this claim. The only confirmation that this claim is false is via the fact checking agency PIB information: No ! State Bank of India's Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AePS) server has not been shut down by RBI. (Translated from Hindi)

claim: Former President Barack Obama gave $3.8 million to a lab in Wuhan, China.
evi:
Did President Barack Obama allocate money to a laboratory in China?		
No answer could be found.		

Was money given to any health related research under Obama in 2015?		
Yes, Table shows money allocated to the National Institutes of Health.		

How much money was given?		
$3.4 million grant.		

Was any of that money given to a lab in Wuhan?		
Of that money, only $600,000 (from the first grant) was given to the Wuhan Institute of Virology, Kessler said. The Wuhan lab was a collaborator that was pre-approved by NIH and the State Department, he added, and one that researchers used to conduct genetic analyses of the viruses.
label: Refuted

claim: The U.S. government is planning to force Americans to take vaccinations during the coronavirus pandemic with the help of Bill Gates.
evi:
Did the U.S government intend to force  Americans to take the Covid-19 Vaccine in connivance  with Bill Gates ?		
NEW YORK -- The World Health Organization (WHO), UNICEF, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation have announced a collaboration to increase coordination across the international vaccine community and create a Global Vaccine Action Plan.  This plan will build on the successes of current work to achieve key milestones in the discovery, development and delivery of lifesaving vaccines to the most vulnerable populations in the poorest countries over the next decade.

The collaboration follows the January 2010 call by Bill and Melinda Gates for the next ten years to be the Decade of Vaccines.  The Global Vaccine Action Plan will enable greater coordination across all stakeholder groups – national governments, multilateral organizations, civil society, the private sector and philanthropic organizations -- and will identify critical policy, resource, and other gaps that must be addressed to realize the life-saving potential of vaccines. 

The structure of the Decade of Vaccines Collaboration includes a Leadership Council to provide oversight for the planning effort, a Steering Committee that holds the primary responsibility for developing the action plan, an International Advisory Committee to assist the Leadership Council in evaluating the action plan, and a Secretariat for administrative support. 

Prof. Pedro Alonso, Director for the Institute for Global Health of Barcelona and Dr. Christopher Elias, President and CEO of PATH, have been appointed co-chairs of the Steering Committee and the Secretariat. 

“Vaccines are miracles,” said Prof. Alonso, “For just a few dollars per child, vaccines prevent disease and disability for a lifetime. We must make sure that people understand that vaccines are one of the best investments in health.”                                                             

The Leadership Council is comprised of:

    Dr. Mar		

Did the U.S government intend to force Americans to take the Covid-19 Vaccination in connivance  with Bill Gates?		
NEW YORK -- The World Health Organization (WHO), UNICEF, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation have announced a collaboration to increase coordination across the international vaccine community and create a Global Vaccine Action Plan.  This plan will build on the successes of current work to achieve key milestones in the discovery, development and delivery of lifesaving vaccines to the most vulnerable populations in the poorest countries over the next decade.

The collaboration follows the January 2010 call by Bill and Melinda Gates for the next ten years to be the Decade of Vaccines.  The Global Vaccine Action Plan will enable greater coordination across all stakeholder groups – national governments, multilateral organizations, civil society, the private sector and philanthropic organizations -- and will identify critical policy, resource, and other gaps that must be addressed to realize the life-saving potential of vaccines. 

The structure of the Decade of Vaccines Collaboration includes a Leadership Council to provide oversight for the planning effort, a Steering Committee that holds the primary responsibility for developing the action plan, an International Advisory Committee to assist the Leadership Council in evaluating the action plan, and a Secretariat for administrative support. 

Prof. Pedro Alonso, Director for the Institute for Global Health of Barcelona and Dr. Christopher Elias, President and CEO of PATH, have been appointed co-chairs of the Steering Committee and the Secretariat. 

“Vaccines are miracles,” said Prof. Alonso, “For just a few dollars per child, vaccines prevent disease and disability for a lifetime. We must make sure that people understand that vaccines are one of the best investments in health.”                                                             

The Leadership Council is comprised of:

    Dr. Mar		

Is it mandatory for Americans to take the COVID-19 vaccinations?		
No, Employees at Montgomery County (in the United States) are not required to be vaccinated. Their sites states: "while COVID-19 vaccines are encouraged, the choice to receive a vaccine is voluntary". Therefore, COVID-19 vaccinations are not mandatory.		

Where did the claim originate from?		
InfoWars		

What is InfoWars?		
US radio show host, multimedia businessman, political pundit and ‘most paranoid man in America’, Alex Jones, and his Infowars have been followed and commented on by media in the US and, especially since 2016, across the globe. In scholarly analyses, Jones/Infowars tend to be mentioned only in passing in the growth of populism and the Alt Right in the US, in the role of (social) media in 21st century populist nationalism and as fake news generator. At the height of his popularity (2017–2018), Jones and his message attracted 2 million weekly listeners to his syndicated and streamed radio show and up to 1.3 billion views to his YouTube channels, while Infowars.com had 20 million monthly visits – 80% from the US.2 These numbers alone warrant closer scrutiny.
label: Refuted

claim: Kalonji or black cumin seeds contain 100% Hydroxychloroquine which can cure Coronavirus.
evi:
Do Kalonji seeds contain 100% Hydroxychloroquine?		
No, Hydroxychloroquine is not listed as part of the seeds components.		

Has a COVID-19 cure been found from the date of this claim?		
While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and
alleviate symptoms of mild COVID-19, there are no medicines that have been
shown to prevent or cure the disease.		

When was the claimed made?		
10 April 20
label: Refuted

claim: Bill Gates owns the patent and vaccine for coronavirus.
evi:
Is there a patent for the COVID-19 virus?		
No, There is no patent for the new coronovirus		

Can you patent a virus?		
Yes, A patent does exist for a different coronovirus, called avian infectious bronchitis.		

Does Bill Gates own this patent?		
No, This patent is not owned by Bill Gates nor by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, but by the Pirbright Institute in the UK, which aimed to develop a vaccine against IBV.		

At the time of this claim did an effective vaccine against COVID-19 exist?		
No, COVID19 vaccines were still in trial status during this time
label: Refuted

claim: All Las Vegas hotels have donated food and rooms for emergency personnel except for one: Trump International Hotel Las Vegas.
evi:
How many hotels are in Las Vegas		
No answer could be found.		

During the pandemic, what contributions were made by the Trump hotel in Las Vegas		
The Trump hotel alongside several other of his properties did not participate in releasing rooms for the COVID effort
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Bill Gates is a partner in the lab in Wuhan, China.
evi:
What is the definition of business partner?		
According to Collins English Dictionary:

The partners in a firm or business are the people who share the ownership of it.		

What is the Gate Foundation's mission statement?		
Our mission is to create a world where every person has the opportunity to live a healthy, productive life.

We are a non profit fighting poverty, disease, and inequity around the world.		

How does the Gates Foundation declare they fulfil that role?		
Spurring innovations
that improve the human condition by stepping in where governments and businesses leave gaps.

Strengthening global cooperation
by bringing together governments, businesses, philanthropies, and communities to save and transform lives around the world.

Creating market incentives
for lifesaving products by supporting the development and delivery of vaccines, treatments, diagnostics, and other tools for those most in need.

Generating high-quality data and evidence
that drive progress by showing what’s working and what isn’t.		

What are the Governing Principles of the Foundation, according to the website?		
Governing Principles
The foundation is governed by a board of trustees, co-chaired by Bill Gates and Melinda French Gates. The board provides strategic oversight and expertise to the foundation and steers the organization in furtherance of its mission to create a world where every person has the opportunity to live a healthy, productive life.		

How many grants have been issued by the Foundation to China between 1997  and 2022?		
497 grants to China are listed under Committed Grants on the Foundation website.		

What grants were specifically linked to Wuhan, China?		
Two grants were given to Wuhan University under the topic: 
Global Health and Development Public Awareness and Analysis.

One in January 2021, and the other in 2018.

A third grant was given to Union Hospital in April 2011 for Discovery and Translational Sciences		

What grants for The Wuhan Center for Disease Control and Prevention are listed on the Foundation's website?		
Five committed grants are listed:
Four under the topic, HIV (November 2014, October 2009, July 2008, September 2007), and one topic listed as: 
Global Health and Development Public Awareness and Analysis (November 2021).
label: Refuted

claim: 5G radiation is harmful to human health
evi:
Is 5G radiation harmful to human health?		
the World Health Organization's International EMF Project, which investigates the health effects of electromagnetic fields on humans, argues there are "no major public health risks [that] have emerged from several decades of EMF research."		

What are the potential health risks from 5G?		
To date, and after much research performed, no adverse health effect has been causally linked with exposure to wireless technologies. Health-related conclusions are drawn from studies performed across the entire radio spectrum but, so far, only a few studies have been carried out at the frequencies to be used by 5G.

Tissue heating is the main mechanism of interaction between radiofrequency fields and the human body. Radiofrequency exposure levels from current technologies result in negligible temperature rise in the human body.

As the frequency increases, there is less penetration into the body tissues and absorption of the energy becomes more confined to the surface of the body (skin and eye). Provided that the overall exposure remains below international guidelines, no consequences for public health are anticipated.
label: Refuted

claim: North Carolina is "in the small minority of states that requires an absentee ballot to be signed by two witnesses or a notary public."
evi:
What states require an absentee ballot to be sent in without excuses but can be signed by two witnesses		
The following 34 states and Washington, D.C., offer "no-excuse" absentee/mailed ballot voting: Alaska, Arizona, California, Colorado*, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii*, Idaho, Illinois, Iowa, Kansas, Maine, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Jersey, New Mexico, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon*, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island**, South Dakota, Utah*, Vermont, Virginia, Washington*, Wisconsin and Wyoming		

Is it required that an absentee ballot be signed by two witnesses or a notary public in North Carolina?		
Yes, Voting On Absentee Ballot

In the presence of two witnesses (or one witness if the witness is a notary-public), the voter should mark the ballot, or cause it to be marked according to his or her instructions.
label: Supported

Did an image shared on Facebook show someone biting a young girl on the cheek?		
No. The man pictured is Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, not Biden. The photo appears to be a screen grab of Obrador kissing the child’s cheek from a video of him greeting people.		

Did an image shared on Facebook show Joe Biden ?		
The man pictured is Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, not Biden.

Al-Qaeda was added to the State Department’s list in 1999.

It first appeared in 10/08/1999 and then 17/12/2004 under the name  - Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (formerly al-Qa’ida in Iraq)

claim: N13 billion was devoted to the State House clinic in the last five years.

N2,825,597,363

N331,730,211		

What was the budget allocation to the State House Clinic facility in the 2018?

The flu virus is very variable and changes over time. Each year there are different strains around, and a new vaccine has to be prepared to deal with them. Vaccination from previous years is not likely to protect people against current strains of flu.

claim: The state of California admitted in a court settlement that a million people voted improperly in the US elections in 2019.
evi:
What happens to an inactive voter?		
a State may remove a registrant who "(i) has failed to
respond to a notice" and "(ii) has not voted or appeared to vote ...
during the period beginning on the date of the notice and ending on
the day after the date of the second general election for Federal office
that occurs after the date of the notice" (about four years). 52 U. S. C.
§20507(d)(l)(B). Not only are States allowed to remove registrants
who satisfy these requirements, but federal law makes this removal
mandatory.		

What is the US Federal law regarding inactive voters?		
The National Voter Registration Act (NVRA) is a federal law requiring the removal of inactive registrations from the voter rolls after two general federal elections (encompassing from 2 to 4 years).		

What are the main reasons that voters become inactive?		
Inactive voter registrations belong, for the most part, to voters who have moved to another county or state or have passed away.		

What was the situation regarding registered voters in the County of Los Angeles  in January 2019?		
Los Angeles County had the highest number of inactive registrations of any single county in the US, with more voter registrations on its voter rolls than it had citizens old enough to register. This means that more than one out of every five LA County registrations likely belongs to a voter who has moved or is deceased.		

What was the situation regarding registered voters in the County of Los Angeles  in January 2019?		
Los Angeles County had on its rolls more than 1.5 million potentially ineligible voters.		

What was the federal lawsuit filed by Judicial Watch against California in the 2019 US elections about?		
In its lawsuit, Judicial Watch alleged:

Los Angeles County has more voter registrations on its voter rolls than it has citizens who are old enough to register.  Specifically, according to data provided to and published by the U.S. Election Assistance Commission, Los Angeles County has a registration rate of 112 percent of its adult citizen population.

The entire State of California has a registration rate of about 101 percent of its age-eligible citizenry.

Eleven of California’s 58 counties have registration rates exceeding 100 percent of the age-eligible citizenry.		

What did the federal lawsuit filed by Judicial Watch against California in the 2019 US elections confirm?		
The lawsuit confirmed that Los Angeles County has on its rolls more than 1.5 million potentially ineligible voters. This means that more than one out of every five LA County registrations likely belongs to a voter who has moved or is deceased. Judicial Watch notes that “Los Angeles County has the highest number of inactive registrations of any single county in the country.”

The Judicial Watch lawsuit also uncovered that neither the State of California nor Los Angeles County had been removing inactive voters from the voter registration rolls for the past 20 years. The Supreme Court affirmed last year in Husted v. A. Philip Randolph Inst., 138 S. Ct. 1833 (2018) that the NVRA “makes this removal mandatory.”		

Do inactive voter registrations count as a vote?		
No, These voters do not automatically receive a mail ballot in each election. They are still eligible to vote by visiting a Voter Service and Polling Center during election time, or they can contact the Elections Division to find out more information about how to reactivate their record.		

Do inactive voter registrations count as a vote?		
No, Your inactive status will revert to active status, if you update your voter registration record, go to the polls to vote, or request an absentee ballot. However, if you do not take any of these actions after two general (federal) elections from the date you were first made inactive, your name will be removed from the registration system. You will have to re-register again in order to vote.
label: Refuted

claim: Consuming ewedu will cure COVID-19.
evi:
What is Ewedu?		
Ewedu leaves, (Corchorus olitorius) Jute leaf, popularly called ewedu among the Yoruba, ahinghara in Igbo and rama in Hausa, is a popular vegetable in West Africa.		

What does it contain that is claimed to help coronovirus?		
the ewedu leaves, botanically called ‘corchorus olitorius’, contain flavonoid that helps zinc to enter into the virus-infected cell and prevents the reproduction mechanism of its RNA genetic material to stop the virus from reproducing inside the body”.		

Is this special to Ewedu?		
zinc, as a micronutrient, is not peculiar to Ewedu alone, there are other leaves or food with zinc. So, Coronavirus disease cure is not just by the micronutrient, rather, it has to do with claims that have been scientifically proven. 

Miss Ugochukwu noted that other sources of zinc are meat, whole grains and nuts; adding that “Whatever nutrients you can find in ewedu can also be found in other foods; not that Ewedu has whatever special properties.”
label: Refuted

claim: British author David Icke claimed that the Covid-19 pandemic was orchestrated by supernatural forces attempting to “dismantle” the world economic system and “control” the population using new technologies like 5G.
evi:
Is David Icke a conspiracy theorist?		
Icke spent the rest of the decade fleshing out his prophecies, becoming a one-stop global clearinghouse for any and all fringe theories, from UFOlogy to the Illuminati to Matrix-style media critique to Occupy Wall Street (about which he made a documentary after traveling to New York). His cosmology is voracious and wide-ranging, absorbing all conspiracy theories into a single, massive omni-theory.		

Can viruses spread through new technologies?		
Experts have also concluded that there was no proof that mobile phone technologies could cause cancer or be harmful. “Health-related conclusions are drawn from studies performed across the entire radio spectrum but, so far, only a few studies have been carried out at the frequencies to be used by 5G.”

The CDC 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel is a real-time RT-PCR
test intended for the qualitative detection of nucleic acid from SARS-CoV-2 in upper and lower
respiratory specimens (such as nasopharyngeal or oropharyngeal swabs, sputum, lower respiratory tract
aspirates, bronchoalveolar lavage, and nasopharyngeal wash/aspirate or nasal aspirate) collected from
individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider

An exosome is an extracellular vesicle which is a particle with a lipid bilayer and cytoplasmic contents that cannot replicate like a cell and an exosome is an EV, usually a small one, that is released from an internal compartment of the cell”		

Are there differences in the microscopic images of both exosomes and the SARS-CoV-2		
The exosomes is a sphere surrounded by a uniform membrane without the presence of spikes nor the shape of a crown but the coronavirus has “small peaks” (growths) formed by the protein “spike”, which gives it its characteristic crown shape

claim: There is a link between the launch of 5G and the Covid-19 outbreak in 2019.
evi:
When was 5G launched?		
14 May 2018 Qatar
Ooredoo CEO Launches 5G at Ceremony in West Bay

Doha, Qatar

Ooredoo has today announced that the company is the first operator in the world to launch a live 5G network on the 3.5GHz spectrum band.

The breakthrough announcement was made in an event attended by Ooredoo senior management at the Ooredoo Tower in West Bay. Attendees were also briefed on the first Ooredoo 5G site which was accomplished just days after Ooredoo’s new 5G Commercial Core Network was activated.

Ooredoo’s 5G network is the first commercially available 5G network in the world and is an important technological breakthrough for the telecommunications industry worldwide.		

Was 5G available worldwide in 2020?		
It was only commercially available in 33 countries.		

How many countries had been affected by Covid-19 in 2020?		
Much more than 33.
