claim: There is no vaccine for tuberculosis.
evi:
Is there a vaccine for tuberculosis?		
BCG, or bacille Calmette-Guerin, is a vaccine for tuberculosis (TB) disease. Many foreign-born persons have been BCG-vaccinated. BCG is used in many countries with a high prevalence of TB to prevent childhood tuberculous meningitis and miliary disease. However, BCG is not generally recommended for use in the United States because of the low risk of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the variable effectiveness of the vaccine against adult pulmonary TB, and the vaccine’s potential interference with tuberculin skin test reactivity. The BCG vaccine should be considered only for very select persons who meet specific criteria and in consultation with a TB expert.
label: Refuted

he described the coronavirus outbreak as a "new hoax" perpetuated by Democrats

He insisted he was not describing the virus as a "hoax" but that he was referring to his belief that Democrats are using the outbreak to try to hurt him politically		

Was Donald Trump referring to the virus itself as a hoax when he made the statement ?		
No, he was not describing the virus as a "hoax" but that he was referring to his belief that Democrats are using the outbreak to try to hurt him politically

claim: Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweet that his endless joy turned into endless grief after Devendra Fadnavis resigned as chief minister of Maharashtra on Tuesday
evi:

Did Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweet that his endless joy turned into endless grief after Devendra Fadnavis resigned'' on the date of the claim?		
The tweet was actually put out on 13 July 2016, where PM Modi condoles the death of Praful Bhai Doshi, a senior RSS Leader from Gujarat.		

Did Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweet that his endless joy turned into endless grief after Devendra Fadnavis resigned'' on the date of the claim?		
No, The tweet was actually put out on 13 July 2016, where PM Modi condoles the death of Praful Bhai Doshi, a senior RSS Leader from Gujarat.		

Did Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweet anything in regards to the resignation of Devendra Fadnavis		
Yes, he had indeed posted a congratulatory message for Devendra Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar on November 23, after they were sworn in as CM and deputy CM of Maharashtra by the Governor BS Koshyari.

claim: President Donald Trump refused World Health Organization (WHO) tests.
evi:
Did the U.S. refuse World Health Organization (WHO) tests?		
Yes, The United States did decline WHO tests.

By the end of February, the World Health Organization had shipped tests to nearly 60 countries.The United States was not among them.		

Why did the U.S. decline to use the WHO test?		
Why the United States declined to use the WHO test, even temporarily as a bridge until the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention could produce its own test, remains a perplexing question and the key to the Trump administration’s failure to provide enough tests to identify the coronavirus infections before they could be passed on, according to POLITICO interviews with dozens of viral-disease experts, former officials and some officials within the administration’s health agencies.		

Who made the decision to decline WHO tests for the United States?		
...neither the CDC nor the coronavirus task force chaired by Vice President Mike Pence would say who made the decision to forgo the WHO test and instead begin a protracted process of producing an American test, one that got delayed by manufacturing problems, possible lab contamination and logistical delays.		

Why did the U.S. decline to use World Health Organization (WHO) tests?		
Why the United States declined to use the WHO test, even temporarily as a bridge until the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention could produce its own test, remains a perplexing question and the key to the Trump administration’s failure to provide enough tests to identify the coronavirus infections before they could be passed on, according to POLITICO interviews with dozens of viral-disease experts, former officials and some officials within the administration’s health agencies.		

Who made the decision to decline World Health Organization (WHO) tests for the United States?		
...neither the CDC nor the coronavirus task force chaired by Vice President Mike Pence would say who made the decision to forgo the WHO test and instead begin a protracted process of producing an American test, one that got delayed by manufacturing problems, possible lab contamination and logistical delays.

Donald Trump,

an NBA player began exhibiting symptoms, that figure was surpassed. The state of Oklahoma completed 58 COVID-19 tests within a matter of hours on Thursday, all to ensure that the virus didn’t spread any further than necessary.

where are the places most affected by covid-19?

As of March 13, data from Santé publique France, national public health agency, revealed that the Grand Est. an administrative region in northeastern France, had the highest number of cases reported.

Similarly, Bergamo, a city in the Lombardy region, is the worst affected as per Ministero della salute, Italy’s Ministry of Health.

On the same date, an infographic published by the Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA), the official news agency of the Islamic Republic of Iran, illustrated the national capital Tehran as the most severely affected.

It seems that while area can affect the spread of covid (humid and high temperature), there is no current evidence on latitude playing a big factor. Therefore, the claim is refuted

Hello, folks. Rita and I are down here in Australia,” the 63-year-old Hanks wrote in a statement via Instagram. “We felt a bit tired, like we had colds, and some body aches. Hanks, who is with wife Rita Wilson in Australia preparing to work on Baz Luhrmann's Elvis Presley biopic (the actor is playing Elvis' manager, Colonel Tom Parker), wrote on Instagram that they'd both been suffering cold and flu-like symptoms and that they've now been tested positive for the virus.

However, the public’s views were more divided when protest caused only minor inconvenience to people locally, with little support for police use of force when protesters were not violent.

eyes, nose or mouth. From there, the virus can enter your body and infect you.

claim: A study published in the journal Antiviral Research claims that coronavirus was "genetically engineered for efficient spread in humans"
evi:
Did the Daily express publish a story saying A study's research paper says coronavirus was "genetically engineered for efficient spread in humans'?		
Yes, They have since issued a correction stating that, ...The research paper did not amplify how the 'gain of function' for Coronavirus 2019 had occurred. It was therefore incorrect when our article claimed "the paper suggested COVID-19 has been tampered with."
We are happy to set the record straight.		

What is ''genetic engineering'?		
Genetic engineering involves the direct manipulation of one or more genes. Most often, a gene from another species is added to an organism's genome to give it a desired phenotype.		

Does the the study's paper make any mention of genetic engineering of the coronavirus?		
The study itself makes absolutely no suggestion that the virus has been “genetically engineered”

claim: Pennsylvania Governor Tom Wolf mandated closures for schools and workplaces to curb the spread of coronavirus.
evi:
What action did the state of Pennsylvania take up to 10th March 2020 in response to the novel coronavirus?		
February 26, 2020—Pennsylvania activated its Department of Health’s Emergency Operations Center to allow for enhanced response coordination. 
March 5, 2020—State officials have updated their travel guidance for residents. Anyone who has arrived from China or Iran, and anyone who has returned from Italy or South Korea, within the last 14 days, are required to contact the public health department and practice social distancing for 14 days post travel.  
March 5, 2020—The state updated their interim guidance for healthcare professionals responding to potential coronavirus cases.
March 7, 2020—Governor Wolf is coordinating with legislative leaders on a package that would aim to allocate resources towards supporting county and municipal health departments, secure equipment and personnel, disseminate public health messaging, and support care for the senior population and those most at risk for infection.  
March 10, 2020—The Department of Insurance issued a notice regarding preparedness plans and information for educating enrollees on their benefits for COIVD treatment and testing.		

Do any of these actions require schools or workplaces to close?		
No.

claim: Harry Potter actor Daniel Radcliffe has tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
evi:
Did Daniel Radcliffe contracted The Novel Coronavirus?		
Daniel Radcliffe hit out at false claims he had become the first celebrity to contract coronavirus on Tuesday, after a hoax report quickly spread across Twitter.

The Harry Potter star, 30, found himself at the centre of a social media storm after the bogus report was shared via fake BBC account @BBC NewsTonight.

'BREAKING: Daniel Radcliffe tests positive for coronavirus,' the tweet in question read. 'The actor is said to be the first famous person to be publicly confirmed.'		

Did Daniel Radcliffe contracted The Novel Coronavirus?		
No, After the false information spread across the micro-blogging platform, a representative for the British actor simply stated that the claims were 'not true' when approached for comment.		

Where did the claim originate from?		
The Twitter account @BBCNewsTonight spread the claim in a viral March 10 tweet that was later retweeted by multiple verified handles. Inspection of the account revealed it had no affiliation with the British outlet, despite closely resembling the verified BBC Breaking News account.

The handle, which lacked a blue verification check mark and had less than 200 followers, has since been suspended
label: Refuted

Towns and cities have been locked down and large gatherings banned.
Restrictions have been imposed on travellers from hard-hit areas, such as China, Italy and Iran.
Major sporting events, carnivals and events have been postponed or cancelled.

There were an estimated 726 deaths of homeless people in England and Wales registered in 2018, which is the latest estimate available at 08/03/2020		

What definition of homeless was used in collating this estimate?		
The definition of homelessness used in this release follows from what is available in death registrations data to identify affected individuals. Our statistics mainly include people sleeping rough or using emergency accommodation such as homeless shelters and direct access hostels, at or around the time of death. An upper age limit of 74 years is applied to avoid accidental inclusion of elderly people who died in some institutional settings. This means that a small number of genuine deaths of homeless people aged 75 years or over might have been excluded.

claim: COLLOIDAL SILVER KILLS CORONAVIRUS
evi:
What is Colloidal Silver?		
Colloidal silver is a solution that consists of very small silver particles suspended in a liquid. A “colloid” is a liquid that evenly distributes certain particles within it.

Some people take colloidal silver by mouth as a dietary supplement. Many internet-based sources claim that colloidal silver has a range of health benefits.

However, there is little scientific evidence to support these claims, and ingesting silver may have mild to severe health consequences.		

What has the FDA said about Colloidal Silver?		
In the Federal Register of October 15,
1996 (61 FR 53685), FDA published a
proposed rule to declare that all OTC
drug products containing colloidal
silver ingredients or silver salts are not
generally recognized as safe and
effective, and are new drugs and
misbranded within the meaning of
section 201(p) of the Federal Food,
Drug, and Cosmetic Act (the act) (21
U.S.C. 321(p)). Colloidal silver is a
suspension of silver particles in a
colloidal base. In recent years, colloidal
silver preparations of unknown
formulation have been appearing in
retail outlets. These products are labeled
for numerous disease conditions, many
of which are serious diseases. The
dosage form of these colloidal silver
products is usually oral, but product
labeling also contains directions for
topical and, occasionally, intravenous
use.
FDA has not approved a new drug
application (NDA) for any colloidal
silver product. None of the silver salts
evaluated as part of FDA’s OTC drug
review was found to be generally
recognized as safe and effective for its
intended use(s). FDA is not aware of any
substantial scientific evidence that
supports the use of OTC colloidal silver
ingredients or silver salts for disease
conditions.		

Is there any evidence of Colloidal silver curing coronavirus?		
“There are no complementary products, such as colloidal silver or herbal remedies, that have been proven effective in preventing or treating this disease (COVID-19), and colloidal silver can have serious side effects,” Dr. Helene Langevin, National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health director, said in a statement.
label: Refuted

claim: Extensive research by Saint Luke’s Hospital of Kansas City in the U.S revealed that consuming alcoholic beverages may help reduce the risk of COVID-19 infection, and that vodka is most recommended for drinking, cleaning and sanitizing.
evi:
What is the advice for avoiding COVID 19 infection?		
-Practice good hand hygiene
-Wash for at least 20 seconds, especially after using the restroom, before eating, after blowing your nose or coughing.
-If soap and water aren’t available, use a hand sanitizer with at least 60 percent alcohol
-Avoid close contact with people who are sick and stay home when you are sick
-Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth
-Cover coughs and sneezes with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash
-Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using regular household cleaning spray or wipe		

Is Vodka a good sanitizer?		
With its high alcohol content, and lack of smell, vodka makes a great disinfecting cleaner		

Have St Lukes hospital commented on this claim?		
False reports are circulating that say drinking alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19. THIS IS NOT TRUE.

claim: Bernard Sanders, United States senator is a communist.
evi:
Has Bernie Sanders ever addressed the claims that he is a communist?		
Yes, "obviously, I am not a communist"
"The difference between my socialism and Trump's socialism is, I believe the government should help working families, not billionaires. So I believe that health care is a human right. I believe we should raise the minimum wage to a living wage of $15 an hour. I believe, in fact, that the rich must start paying their fair share of taxes when you have massive levels of income and wealth inequality."		

What is communism?		
political and economic doctrine that aims to replace private property and a profit-based economy with public ownership and communal control of at least the major means of production (e.g., mines, mills, and factories) and the natural resources of a society. Communism is thus a form of socialism—a higher and more advanced form, according to its advocates. Exactly how communism differs from socialism has long been a matter of debate, but the distinction rests largely on the communists’ adherence to the revolutionary socialism of Karl Marx.		

What is socialism?		
social and economic doctrine that calls for public rather than private ownership or control of property and natural resources. According to the socialist view, individuals do not live or work in isolation but live in cooperation with one another.		

What is democratic socialism?		
political ideology that supports the establishment of a democratically run and decentralized form of socialist economy. Modern democratic socialists vary widely in their views of how a proper socialist economy should function, but all share the goal of abolishing capitalism rather than improving it through state regulation (as preferred by social democrats). They also prioritize democracy as an end over democracy as a means, and some democratic socialists see revolution as an acceptable method of achieving the democracy they desire.
label: Refuted

claim: US has many health care plans which are 60 to 65 percent less expensive than Obamacare.
evi:
Does the US have health care plans other than Obamacare?		
Yes, In the Affordable Care Act marketplace		

Are these alternative health care plans governed?		
Yes, The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) [1] added title XXVII to the Public Health Service Act (PHS Act), part 7 to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA), and Chapter 100 to the Internal Revenue Code (the Code), providing portability and nondiscrimination rules with respect to health coverage. These provisions of the PHS Act, ERISA, and the Code were later augmented by other laws, including the Mental Health Parity Act of 1996,[2] the Paul Wellstone and Pete Domenici Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act of 2008,[3] the Newborns' and Mothers' Health Protection Act,[4] the Women's Health and Cancer Rights Act,[5] the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act of 2008,[6] the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009,[7] Michelle's Law,[8] and the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, as amended by the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 (PPACA).[9]		

Are these alternative health care plans cheaper than Obamacare?		
Estimating the actuarial value of such products is challenging because the scope of coverage is so varied and
because coverage generally completely excludes services
for any preexisting condition
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Kim Jong Un, Supreme Leader of North Korea, rejected calls from the Obama administration
evi:
Did Obama's administration make calls to the North Korean President, Kim Jong Un		
Several Obama administration officials promptly and vehemently contradicted Trump’s account.

“At the risk of stating the obvious, this is horse-sh*t,” tweeted Susan Rice, who served as the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations from 2009 to 2013 and as Obama’s national security adviser from 2013 to 2017.

“Yes. It’s horseshit,” added Gen. Michael Hayden, via Twitter. Hayden served as director of the CIA from 2006 to Feb. 12, 2009, shortly after Obama took office.

Ben Rhodes, former deputy national security adviser to Obama, added his voice on Twitter as well: “Trump is lying. I was there for all 8 years. Obama never sought a meeting with Kim Jong Un. Foreign policy isn’t reality television it’s reality.”

Rhodes told CNN that Obama “never even considered” seeking a meeting with Kim. “There’s no mystery here: It’s just a lie with no supporting evidence and no basis in anything. It’s not even an exaggeration, it’s just not true.”

And on CNN’s “State of the Union,” James Clapper, who served as director of national intelligence for most of Obama’s presidency, said he was puzzled by Trump’s claim. “In all the deliberations that I have participated in on North Korea during the Obama administration, I can recall no instance whatever where President Obama ever indicated any interest whatsoever in meeting with the — Chairman Kim,” Clapper said.

We reached out to the Trump press office, but it did not provide any further information.

It’s true that during a debate in the run-up to the 2008 presidential election, Obama famously said that he would be willing to meet with leaders in North Korea and other enemy nations without any preconditions.
label: Refuted

In June, 2013, Li, Archer, and other business partners signed a memorandum of understanding to create the fund, which they named BHR Partners.

No, Hunter became an unpaid member of BHR’s board but did not take an equity stake in BHR Partners until after his father left the White House.

No, According to a Wall Street Journal article on July 10th 2014, it was reported that BHR Partners were "aiming to raise about $1.5 billion to invest abroad". This was only an aim for the fund, not a confirmed number.

851,508

396,579		

Were there policies in place by the Trump administration to reduce the number of aliens entering America from the Mexican ports illegally		
Yes, The Migrant Protection Protocols (MPP) are a U.S. Government action whereby certain foreign individuals entering or seeking admission to the U.S. from Mexico – illegally or without proper documentation – may be returned to Mexico and wait outside of the U.S. for the duration of their immigration proceedings, where Mexico will provide them with all appropriate humanitarian protections for the duration of their stay		

Are the increased number of apprehensions relatable to lesser number of illegal immigrants into the United States		
Yes, The higher apprehensions resulted in expulsion of illegal immigrants back to their country and therefore a decrease in the number of admitted immigrants which resulted in lower overall values of aliens in the country

From the context of the article when there is talk of illegal immigration in US politics it is generally referring to migration across the US/Mexico border. So in that context it is OK to conflate the two

evidence from previous health crises demonstrates that travel bans don’t work, and may even be more harmful than the problem they intend to address.

Not only are travel bans likely to be ineffective with a disease like the novel coronavirus, but there are also likely to be widespread economic, social, and public health impacts from the ban."

travel bans have to be highly restrictive (i.e. discontinuation of over 90% of air travel) to have any impact.

His ban only applied to  no refugee admissions for 120 days, and blocked citizens of only seven countries from entering the US for at least 90 days

claim: Children can’t get COVID-19.
evi:

Yes, There has been confirmed cases of COVID-19 in children. The 'A familial cluster of pneumonia associated with the 2019 novel coronavirus indicating person-to-person transmission: a study of a family cluster' focuses on two asymptomatic children (patients 5 and 6).		

Have there been confirmed cases of COVID-19 in children?		
Yes, As diagnostic methods improving, 416 children under 10 years old have been reported in China4, in which 134 cases had the clinical records.		

Have there been confirmed cases of COVID-19 in children?		
Yes, There has been confirmed cases of COVID-19 in children.		

Is COVID-19 less likely to be seen in children?		
"In 2% of reported cases, the #coronavirus is fatal, and the risk of death increases the older a patient is, and with underlying health conditions. 

We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why"-@DrTedros #COVID19		

Do children get milder symptoms of COVID-19 than adults?		
Compared to infected adults, the condition of infected children is significantly milder, with faster recovery, shorter virus shedding time and better prognosis. By far, only 2 critical cases have been reported, of which one was a child of 7 months old with congenital heart disease. The other patient was 13 months old with bilateral hydronephrosis and calculus of left kidney. Both cases progressed rapidly to respiratory failure after onset, requiring support of invasive mechanical ventilation. It demonstrates that children with underlying diseases are tended to progress to severe and critical cases, so we should pay high attention to such group and strengthen supervision for them.		

What constitutes a child?		
children are under the age of 18		

Can those under 18 catch covid?		
In China, 416 cases (1%)  were aged nine years or younger early in the pandemic.

In early February 2020, before deaths and community spread in the United States.

The result of 77% confidence, was higher than the past four outbreaks, but was taken too early in the outbreak, before community spread.

Trump was referring to Gallup poll in which 77% of respondents said they were confident in the government’s ability to handle a coronavirus outbreak which was higher than in the past four outbreaks. But that poll was conducted in early February, before deaths and community spread were reported in the United States. So this claim is false as it was prior to the outbreak.

claim: In Texas the Republican side gets 25 machines, the Democratic side gets 5 machines.
evi:

In some areas the number and set up machines caused delays. Every county was different.  

Travis and some other counties set up their machines to handle voters in either primary. But in Tarrant County, the two parties decided “over our strong objections” to devote machines to one primary or the other, but not both, said Tarrant County Judge Glen Whitley.

"We told them exactly what was going to happen and they still said they wanted it that way and what happened, happened," he said.

The county assigned 1,767 machines to the Republican primary and 1,015 to Democrats, with input from the county parties.

To get a [true] rate, you need the deaths — which you can more reliably pick up — and you need cases, which you can less reliably pick up,” Lawrence Gostin, a global health law professor at Georgetown University.

But the visit and other tests aren’t free. How much you’ll owe depends on several factors, including what insurance you have, where you seek treatment and what tests providers give you. hand rub. Wearing a face mask CORRECTLY, in addition to good hand hygiene practices and physical distancing can help prevent the spread of COVID-19 to others. To protect yourself and others, take the COVID-19 vaccine when it becomes available to you.

Spraying and introducing bleach or another disinfectant into your body WILL NOT protect you against COVID-19 and can be dangerous

the government’s analysis said that “in all scenarios the economy would be expected to grow”, albeit slower than if we had not left the EU.

No answer could be found.

claim: The coronavirus outbreak is US Democrats new hoax.

US President Donald Trump

Trump made the assertion during a rally in South Carolina, US.		

What was President Trump's reaction to this claim?		
On April 13, the Trump campaign sued WJFW-NBC of Rhinelander, Wisconsin, US for defamation for running the ad.		

What was President Trump's reaction to this claim?		
President Trump’s reelection campaign is threatening legal action against television stations in key battleground states if they continue airing an ad cut by the liberal super PAC Priorities USA alleging that the president called the coronavirus a “hoax.”		

What did media quote President Trump as saying at the political rally?		
President Donald Trump accused Democrats of "politicizing" the coronavirus, calling their criticism of how he has responded to the disease their "new hoax."		

What did media quote President Trump as saying at the political rally?		
The president defended his administration's response to the coronavirus threat, blasting Democrats for "politicizing" the issue and calling it "their new hoax"		

Did President Trump make this comment in speech made on February 28th 2020 in South Carolina?		
No, President Donald Trump accused Democrats of "politicizing" the coronavirus, calling their criticism of how he has responded to the disease their "new hoax."

claim: 38 Percent of Americans are avoiding Corona Beer because of the Coronavirus.
evi:
What question did the survey ask from beer drinkers?		
Would you buy Corona under any circumstances now? (38% of “beer-drinking Americans” said they would not.)		

Did the survey ask about stopping to drink Corona beer specifically due to the coronavirus pandemic?		
The survey also asked: In light of the coronavirus, do you plan to stop drinking Corona? (4% who “usually drink Corona” said they planned to stop.)		

Did the survey ask about stopping to drink Corona beer specifically due to the coronavirus pandemic?		
The survey asked: In light of the coronavirus, do you plan to stop drinking Corona? Only 4% who “usually drink Corona” said they planned to stop.		

Of the 38% shown in the claim what percent of the people would normally drink corona beer and wouldn't now?		
Only 4% of those who usually drink Corona would stop drinking it
label: Refuted

claim: Japan issued a health advisory listing drinking water as a prevention method for COVID-19.
evi:
What are the prevention methods for COVID-19?		
get vaccinated against COVID-19 – book vaccination appointments now

meet people outside if possible

open doors and windows to let in fresh air if meeting people inside

limit the number of people you meet and avoid crowded places

wear a face covering when it's hard to stay away from other people – particularly indoors or in crowded places

wash your hands with soap and water or use hand sanitiser regularly throughout the day		

Does drinking water prevent you from catching covid?		
While staying hydrated by drinking water is important for overall health, it does not prevent coronavirus infection.		

Has Japan issued a health advisory listing drinking water as a prevention method for COVID-19?		
No, The Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor, and Welfare has not listed drinking water as a prevention method for COVID-19.
label: Refuted

claim: Mike Pence moved decisively when confronted with a disturbing HIV outbreak in a rural Indiana county in 2014-15 when he was governor of the state.
evi:
When did health authorities first notice an unusually high number of HIV cases in Scott County, Indiana during the outbreak in 2014-15?		
November 2014		

After health authorities first noticed an unusually high number of HIV cases in Scott County, Indiana, how long did it take for Mike Pence to declare a public health emergency and authorize a needle exchange program for the county?		
4 months - the Governor of Indiana declared a public health emergency on March 26, 2015 after health authorities first noticed the unusually high number of HIV infections in November 2014.		

Could the scale of the HIV outbreak in Scott County, Indiana in 2014-15 have been reduced by an earlier public health response?		
Yes, Yale University researchers concluded that “an earlier public health response could have substantially reduced the total number of HIV infections.”
label: Refuted

Shahrukh Mohammad is in police custody

Mr. SHO

Anurag

claim: Holding your breathe for 10 seconds, without any discomfort or coughing, proves there is no infection in the lungs from COVID19
evi:
Can you have Covid-10 without having any symptoms?		
Yes. Most people with coronavirus have at least 1 symptom but it is possible to still be positive for Covid-19 without having any symptoms.		

Can you have Covid-19 if you have no coughing or discomfort?		
yes. It is possible to have Covid-19 with no symptoms and no coughing or discomfort,		

Can you hold your breath for 10 seconds if you have Covid-19?		
It is possible to have no symptoms but still be positive for Covid-19. Therefore if a person could hold their breath for ten seconds before contracting covid 19, it is possible that they would still be able to do so even with Covid 19.

the Russian academy's concerns are shared by colleagues from the European Space Agency and it will take them to the U.N.

claim: the Canadian government will welcome three million immigrants in 2020.
evi:
How many new immigrants has Canada welcomed in 2020 ?		
Canada will welcome nearly one million immigrants over the next three years, according to the multi-year strategy tabled by the Liberal government today in what it calls "the most ambitious immigration levels in recent history. The number of economic migrants, family reunifications and refugees will climb to 310,000 in 2018, up from 300,000 this year. That number will rise to 330,000 in 2019 then 340,000 in 2020. The targets for economic migrants, refugees and family members was tabled in the House of Commons Wednesday afternoon. Hussen said the new targets will bring Canada's immigration to nearly one per cent of the population by 2020, which will help offset an aging demographic. He called it a historic and responsible plan and "the most ambitious" in recent history. "Our government believes that newcomers play a vital role in our society," Hussen said. "Five million Canadians are set to retire by 2035 and we have fewer people working to support seniors and retirees."		

Does the Canadian government had plan of welcome three million immigrants in 2020 ?		
November 1, 2017 – Ottawa plans to welcome 980,000 new immigrants over the next three years under an ambitious three-year immigration plan announced by the federal government on Nov. 1. Annual immigration levels could rise to as high as 360,000 by 2020 under the multi-year plan. This would be first time in more than a century that our immigration rate is 1% of our population.

Immigration Minister Ahmed Hussen described the announcement as ‘historic’, as the government outlines its plan for the next three years, featuring managed increases across all categories.

In 2018, the immigration target will rise to 310,000, from the current 300,000 set for 2017. This target could rise to as much as 330,000 under the latest announcement. In 2019, the target will be 330,000, with an upper limit of 350,000 new immigrants. In 2020, the target figure will be 340,000, and the upper limit 360,000.

The latest plan will drive up immigration numbers to historic levels as the government pushes the annual number of newcomers towards 1 per cent of Canada’s population a target first used by the Liberals in the early 1990’s. The current levels of 300,000 correspond into an immigration rate near .82 per cent.
label: Refuted

claim: Getting drugs in Britain almost easier than ordering pizza.
evi:
Has there been a survey done on this claim in the Britain?		
The only survey done was a global survey and was not specific to Britain.		

What data does the claim use for the statement?		
The first part of Dame Carol Black's independent review of drugs.		

What was the independent review about?		
About what more can be done to tackle the harm that drugs cause.		

Does the report mention how easy it is to obtain drugs in Britain?		
It does state users will likely accessed drugs through a friend, rather than directly from a dealer,		

Is there any mention of 'Pizza' in the document?		
No, A search of the document returns no results for the word 'Pizza'		

Has any report compared getting drugs is as easy as getting pizza?		
Yes, A global drug survey did say Cocaine can be delivered faster than pizza, but it  does not show the UK's specific figures in the study

claim: Dettol products can kill Coronavirus.
evi:
What does dettol bottles say?		
Kills E.Coli, Sammonella [sic], MRSA, Rotavirus, Flu virus, Cold viruses (Human Coronavirus and RSV).		

What does the dettol website say?		
“Specific Dettol products have demonstrated effectiveness (>99.9% inactivation) against coronavirus strains from the same family as the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in third party laboratory testing, when used in accordance with the directions for use. These products are: Dettol Antibacterial Surface Cleanser Spray, Dettol Antibacterial Surface Cleanser Wipes, Dettol All-In-One Disinfectant Spray, and Dettol Disinfectant Liquid.		

How can a bottle from 2019 refer to coronovirus?		
Corona virus is a broad category of viruses which includes a number of different respiratory illnesses. One is the common cold, but the category also includes SARS, a acute respiratory disorder which broke out in 2002 and 2004 and the new coronavirus identified in Wuhan. The Human Corona virus mentioned on the label is NOT actually new Corona Virus or COVID 2019.		

What does dettol say about what viruses it can kill?		
Kills E.Coli, Sammonella [sic], MRSA, Rotavirus, Flu virus, Cold viruses (Human Coronavirus and RSV).		

Is covid one of the viruses it says it can kill?		
Dettol products have demonstrated effectiveness against coronavirus strains from the same family as the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

The NHS advises against touching your eyes, nose or mouth if your hands are not clean. It does not mention shaking hands.		

What is the date of the claim?		
27th February 2020.		

Did the NHS guidelines include details around handshakes and spread of Covid?		
The NHS did not specifically suggest avoiding handshaking to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus at the time of the claim.		

Did any NHS advice concern Hands?		
Yes, Wash your hands

Donald J. Trump’s own account, he saw higher education as a means to an end. To become the real-estate mogul he envisioned, he needed these institutions — but in the same dispassionate way that a mechanic, say, needs a socket wrench.

claim: US Senator Amy Klobuchar said While we are all sitting here debating, Wisconsin has kicked hundreds of thousands of people off of their voting rolls
evi:
Did the US state of Wisconsin purge hundreds of thousands of people off of their voting rolls in 2020		
Wisconsin appeals court rules voters targeted for purge will remain on the rolls		

Why did the Wisconsin Election Commission send letters to 234,000 voters warning them they may be removed from polls in 2021?		
The Wisconsin Elections Commission last month sent letters to voters who it believes may have moved. The letters told the recipients to update their voter registrations with their new addresses if they have moved or to notify the commission if they have not moved.

Those who don't act on the letters will have their voter registrations suspended after April 2021, according to the commission.		

What did the Wisconsin court rule about the election commission?		
A Wisconsin appeals court Friday struck down an Ozaukee County judge's ruling that thousands of people had to be quickly removed from the state's voter rolls because they are believed to have moved.

The appeals judges also unanimously overturned a finding that state election officials were in contempt of court for not taking people off the rolls.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Russian Cops Don’t Beat People For No Reason.
evi:
Are there any documented cases of Russian police beating for no reason?		
Russian national guardsman beat a young man sitting on a bench while a riot policeman holds the victim down.		

Are there any documented cases of Russian police beating for no reason?		
The beating of Daria Sosnovskaya occurred in Moscow on Aug. 10, 2019. After participating in a sanctioned protest, she and other demonstrators began an impromptu walk around the city. Some of them were approached by riot police, who picked up and dragged a disabled person to a waiting police vehicle. In the process, the man was dropped, after which Sosnovskaya said she began shouting “Shame on you!” to the policemen.		

Had the protesting woman in relation to this specific claim been confronting police before being beaten?		
No, The woman was retreating.		

Was the protestor beaten after being restrained by police?		
Yes, footage shows  police grabbed her and started to drag her away. before one of them, as the video shows, punched her in the stomach.

claim: US President Trump called for reduced funding for the Centre for Disease Control and Prevention.

Did US President Trump propose budget cuts in the funding for the Centre for Disease Control and Prevention?		
Yes, The White House wants to slash more than $1.2 billion from the CDC’s budget, with the largest cuts coming from public-health preparedness programmes.

claim: Bernie Sanders has said things like women get cancer from having too many orgasms, or toddlers should run around naked and touch each others' genitals to insulate themselves from porn … He's written about women's rape fantasies.
evi:
Has Bernie Sanders said women get cancer due to orgasms?		
No, In a 1969 essay, Bernie Sanders made the claim that a woman's inability to achieve an orgasm is what causes cervical cancer.		

Has Bernie Sanders written on women’s fantasies of rape?		
Yes, Bernie Sanders wrote a 1972 essay in which he wrote – among other things – that a woman "fantasizes being raped by three men simultaneously."		

Has the Bernie Sanders campaign commented on his 1972 essay, which includes women's fantasies of rape?		
Yes, Michael Briggs, Sanders’ newly minted campaign spokesman, said the article was a “dumb attempt at dark satire in an alternative publication” that “in no way reflects his views or record on women.”

“It was intended to attack gender stereotypes of the ‘70s, but it looks as stupid today as it was then,” Briggs told CNN.		

Has the Bernie Sanders  commented on his 1972 essay, which includes women's fantasies of rape?		
Yes, Bernie Sanders Talks 1972 'Rape Fantasy' Essay: 

“No, it was bad fiction. I learned my lesson. I think I could make a good president, but I write fiction pretty poorly,” he said to laughter and applause from the crowd.		

Has Bernie Sanders spoken on toddlers, nudity and porn?		
Yes, Bernie Sanders said in a 1969 article, "In Vermont, at a state beach, a mother is reprimanded by Authority for allowing her 6-month-old daughter to go about without her diapers on. Now, if children go around naked, they are liable to see each others sexual organs, and maybe even touch them. Terrible thing! If we (raise) children up like this it will probably ruin the whole pornography business, not to mention the large segment of the general economy which makes its money by playing on peoples sexual frustrations."
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Congress files charges against speaker of the U.S House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi, for tearing up her copy of the State of the Union speech.
evi:
Did Nancy Pelosi tear up her copy of the State of Union speech		
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi ripped up her copy of President Donald Trump’s State of the Union speech and told reporters that tearing up the address was “the courteous thing to do considering the alternatives.”		

Did the Congress file charges against Nancy Pelosi		
No, First of all, Pelosi didn’t break the law when she tore up a copy of President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address on Feb. 4. Trump, among others, wrongly claimed it was illegal. 

And while some people have signed a Change.org petition calling for her arrest after she ripped up her copy of the president’s speech, no arrest has happened. We found no news coverage online about Pelosi being taken into custody. If she had been arrested, it would have drawn plenty of media attention.
label: Refuted

claim: US President Donald Trump got rid of a pandemic response position on the National Security Council.
evi:
Did Trump administration get rid of a pandemic response position on the National Security Council?		
Yes, The NSC’s Office of Global Health Security and Bio-defense was disbanded in 2018 under the Trump Administration.		

Who was responsible for the disbandment of the NSC’s Office of Global Health Security and Bio-defense?		
National security adviser John Bolton disbanded the NSC’s Office of Global Health Security and Biodefense in May 2018.		

Did President Trump fire the entire pandemic response team in 2018 ?		
Based on our research, the claim that President Trump fired the "entire" pandemic response team is PARTLY FALSE. The Directorate of Global Health Security and Biodefense was disbanded under Trump's then-national security adviser John Bolton. But Trump didn't fire its members. Some resigned, and others moved to different units on the National Security Council.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: U.S. representatives Donna Shalala and Debbie Mucarsel-Powell were supporting candidates other than Bernie Sanders in the US elections.

cancer vaccines don’t block disease; their purpose is to shrink existing tumors, and failing that, slow them down.

claim: The majority of hunters and the majority of Trump voters now want universal background checks on gun buyers.
evi:
Do Trump voters support universal background checks on gun buyers in 2020?		
An August 14 2019 Fox News poll found support for proposals requiring criminal background checks on all gun buyers, including those buying at gun shows and private sales from 90% of Trump voters, with 8% signaling opposition and 2% saying they didn’t know.		

Do Trump voters support universal background checks on gun buyers in 2020?		
A 2019 mid July Marist poll conducted in partnership with NPR and PBS NewsHour asked 1,346 respondents about "background checks for gun purchases at gun shows or other private sales." 82% of "2016 Trump supporters" said the checks were a "good idea."		

Do hunters support universal background checks on all gun buyers in 2020?		
No answer could be found.		

Have hunters supported universal background checks on gun buyers in the past?		
72 percent of hunters support criminal background checks with some exceptions, with just 26 percent opposing and the remainder undecided, according to a Bull Moose poll conducted between March 9 and March 12 2013.
label: Supported

claim: One offender carried out 93 crimes last year before going to jail for the first time.

what was the highest number of crimes commited by someone resulting in a conviction in 2019?		
93 by a female criminal.		

Did she commit the 93 crimes in 2019?		
No answer could be found.

claim: Former vice President Joe Biden attacks President Donald Trump over a food stamp policy supported by Mayor Michael Bloomberg
evi:
What is a food stamp policy		
Food and Nutrition Services also known as food stamps is a federal food assistance program that provides low-income families the food they need for a nutritionally adequate diet.		

What food stamps policy did Joe Biden attack Trump over		
No answer could be found.		

What is President Trump's food stamp policy?		
The Trump administration said on Wednesday it will make it harder for states to keep residents in the U.S. food stamp program in a move that is projected to end benefits for nearly 700,000 people.

President Donald Trump has argued that many Americans receiving food stamps through the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, known as SNAP, do not need it given the strong economy and low unemployment. The program provides free food to 36 million Americans.

The administration has now finalized a rule that tightens guidelines on when and where states can waive limits on how long certain residents can receive benefits. The changes will move more “able-bodied” adults into the workplace, U.S. Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue said.		

Does President Trump intend to bring in fingerprinting for those wanting to access food stamps?		
Trump has sought to tighten eligibility, but no mention of fingerprinting is made.		

Does Bloomberg support fingerprinting to access food stamps?		
Yes, In an interview with International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagarde, Bloomberg said, "What we found was that there were a handful of people who signed up under different names, and they were getting four or five times the amount that they were supposed to get, which meant that we couldn’t take care of some of the people who really deserved it. … So what we did is we fingerprinted people so you could only register once. Now, there was a lot of yelling and screaming and saying we’re invading your personal space by looking at your fingerprints. Well that may be, but you can’t come to work for New York City unless we fingerprint you first, so it is not unreasonable to think the beneficiaries of our program would get fingerprinted, too, and we’re just stopping people from breaking the law, which is hurting other people."		

What is the correct format for this claim?		
First of all, what the U.S. is doing is immoral. I know that’s not a phrase they often use in politics, but it’s immoral. Look what President Donald Trump is doing right—look what this president’s doing right now. Look at what people have done before. They’re going to fingerprint food stamp recipients.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Mayor Bloomberg blamed African Americans & Latinos for the housing crash of 2008.

was there a housing crash in the U.S in 2008?		
The financial crisis of 2008 created the biggest disruption to the U.S. housing market since the Great Depression.		

What were the causes of the 2008 Housing crises in the U.S?		
- Borrowers were encouraged to take out
imprudent loans

encouraged to make risky loans they
never would have made if they could not
have been bundled into securities and

- . Investment
banks were permitted to leverage their
capital irresponsibly because regulations treated housing loans more favorably than other loans		

Did a single thing cause the 2008 U.S housing crises?		
the crisis was caused by a "perfect storm" of economic factors with lots of blame to go around, both in the private sector and government quarters.

claim: Amy Klobuchar’s health plan is just two paragraphs long.

claim: Former mayor of New York, US, Mike Bloomberg owns more wealth than the bottom 125 million Americans.

$54.9 Billion

claim: Under the government’s new immigration rules anyone earning less than £25,600 is regarded as an unskilled worker.
evi:
What is considered an unskilled worker in the U.K?		
Unskilled work involves simple tasks and doesn't usually require one to exercise judgment. It typically requires only a month or less to learn. Many, but not all, unskilled jobs require physical strength or coordination.		

Do U.K immigration regulations state minimum wage's for an immigrant		
The U.K government accepted The Migration Advisory Committee (MAC) recommendation on salary thresholds, including to lower the general salary threshold from £30,000 to £25,600.		

Does only a skilled worker need to be paid a minimum under the governments immigration rules?		
No, All workers must earn the same minimum, However, if they earn less than the required minimum salary threshold, but no less than £20,480, they may still be able to come if they can demonstrate that they have a job offer in a specific shortage occupation,		

Do U.K immigration regulations state minimum wage's for an immigrant?		
The U.K government accepted The Migration Advisory Committee (MAC) recommendation on salary thresholds, including to lower the general salary threshold from £30,000 to £25,600.		

Does the definition of "unskilled worker" include reference to the salary earned?		
No, Whether a job is skilled or unskilled is not determined by the level of pay.
label: Refuted

claim: While he was mayor of NYC, Bloomberg cut stop-and-frisk by 95% because they were doing too many.
evi:
When was Bloomberg mayor of NYC?		
He was the 108th Mayor of New York City for three terms from 2002 to 2013		

What are the stop-and frisk stats for 2002-2013?		
The NYPD stopped and interrogated people 684,330 times in 2011, by far the highest total since the Police Department began collecting data on its troubling stop-and-frisk program in 2002. This represents a 603 percent increase in stop-and-frisks since that year, the first year of the Bloomberg administration, when there were only 97,296 stops.		

What are the stop-and frisk stats for 2002-2013?		
In 2012, 532,911 NYPD stops were recorded.
In 2013, 191,851 NYPD stops were recorded.		

Was the stop-and-frisk policy challenged?		
Yes, In 2012 the NYCLU sued the NYPD over stop-and-frisk abuse at private residential buildings, and in January 2013 a federal court found widespread constitutional violations. In August 2013 the court found similar violations in a much broader case brought by the Center for Constitutional Rights challenging street stops generally.		

Does Bloomberg support the stop-and-frisk policy?		
Yes, Bloomberg made it clear that he absolutely supported stop-and-frisk, and dismissed critics as a vocal minority		

Does Bloomberg support the stop-and-frisk policy?		
Yes, “I would suggest to the next mayor, whoever it is, that saving lives is the most important thing, more so than pandering. Stop-and-frisk has been shown to be—not the only, but the most effective, tool in getting guns out of the hands of kids.”		

Did Bloomberg cut the stop and frisk checking to 95 % ?		
The reduction Bloomberg touted is based on a comparison of data from the beginning of 2012 and the end of 2013, the end of his time in office. 

But as Bloomberg himself acknowledged, stop and frisks had ballooned before that period under his watch. The declines toward the end of his tenure came as the city faced public criticism over the policy and a lawsuit that questioned the legality of the police behavior and its impact on minorities. So while there was ultimately a sharp decline, Bloomberg had presided over a sharp increase in stop and frisks for most of his time as mayor.
He did actually reduce stop & frisk to a great extent. Si I rate this claim as refuted.
label: Refuted

claim: VIRAL IMAGE SHOWS SENATOR JAMES INHOFE NOW SERVES AS THE EPA’S CHIEF OF STAFF
evi:
the viral image demonstrates which context?		
The Washington Post reported Feb. 14 that Mandy Gunasekara, a former top EPA air policy official, has been tapped to return as the agency’s chief of staff, but the EPA hasn’t made any announcements to that effect at the time of publication.		

What is the 'EPA' organisation in the claim?		
The U.S Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).		

What is the date of the claim?		
February 18th 2020.		

Did JAMES INHOFE take the post of the EPA's chief of staff around 18th February 2020?		
Ryan Jackson was Chief of Staff at EPA until February 21		

Who took over after 21st February 2020 after Ryan Jackson left the role?		
Michael Molina became Acting Chief of Staff after Ryan Jackson.
label: Refuted

claim: Biden was arrested in 1977 in South Africa when trying to meet Nelson Mandela.
evi:
Had Biden ever mentioned being arrested trying to see Nelson Mandela before?		
No it is not featured in his memoirs.		

Has anyone spoke of the alleged arrest?		
Andrew Young, a former congressman and mayor of Atlanta who was the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations from 1977 to 1979, said that he had traveled with Mr. Biden over the years, including to South Africa. But Mr. Young said that he had never been arrested in South Africa and expressed skepticism that members of Congress would have faced arrest there.
label: Refuted

claim: $150 million had been collected by the Australian Red Cross as of 16/02/2020.
evi:
Is $150 million collected by the Australian Red Cross as of 16/02/2020?		
At the time of the February 16 post, $140 million had been donated to the Australian Red Cross for bushfire victims not $150 million as claimed. Regarding the claim the charity had only distributed $7 million “in $10,000 lots”, this was not correct at the time of the post. The Australian Red Cross had paid $32 million in emergency grants, according to a media release dated February 13. The charity also announced on February 3 that it was providing an additional $10,000 to extend the amount available to $20,000 as part of its immediate assistance.
label: Refuted

claim: The High court in India,  passed a mandatory order that says Bank of Baroda’s license must be revoked.
evi:
Has Bank of Baroda's license been revoked by the High Court of India?		
No, they did not pass an order to revoke the license.
label: Refuted

claim: Of the $150 million, only $7 million in $10,000 lots had been given out to bushfire victims by the Australian Red Cross as of the 16/02/2020.
evi:
At the time of the claim, how much had the Australian Red Cross distributed to victims of bushfires?		
By Thursday, (January 24th 2020) the organisation said of the $115m it has raised since July, $30m had been allocated for immediate assistance, $18m would go to a three-year bushfire recovery program and $1m had been set aside for a bereavement allowance. It has already issued 690 grants, totalling $6.9m so far.		

What was the data for February?		
These grants more than double existing immediate financial assistance, with the Red Cross Bushfire Advisory Panel allocating a further $30.5 million, with a new total of $61.5 million now available for immediate cash relief. Currently, around $1 million a day is being distributed to people impacted by the fires.
label: Refuted

claim: World Health Organization says a “child’s presence in school counts as ‘informed consent’ for vaccination".
evi:
What is the WHOs policy on vaccination for children under the age of 16		
A 2014 WHO report outlines three commonly used consent processes for vaccination programs: written, verbal and implied.		

According to the WHO, is a child appearing in school tantamount to giving consent for vaccination		
Some laws and regulations are
in place that identify school- or social-services
officials as appointed guardians for children
and adolescents not living with their parents,
including adolescents in boarding school. This is
also called “third party consent”. In such cases,
these third parties can provide consent for
medical care, including vaccination of specific,
individual children.		

How does informed consent work, would parents be contacted in various ways before the consent is implied?		
An implied consent process by which
parents are informed of imminent vaccination
through social mobilization and communication,
sometimes including letters directly addressed to
the parents.		

So if after these communications a parent has not opted out, does a child being at school imply consent?		
Subsequently, the physical presence
of the child or adolescent, with or without an
accompanying parent at the vaccination session, is
considered to imply consent.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Rashtriya Sikhshit Berojgar Yojna launched a scheme to pay Rs 50,000 to educated unemployed citizens in India.
evi:
How many citizens in the scheme applicable to?		
40,000 citizens		

Is it true that Rashtriya Sikhshit Berojgar Yojna launched a scheme to pay Rs 50,000 to educated unemployed citizens in India?		
No, The Press Information Bureau issued the following tweet in relation to the Rashtriya Sikhshit Berojgar  claim...
No such scheme has been launched by Govt of India. Beware of such fake and fraudulent sites collecting your personal info/fees
label: Refuted

claim: A U.S. federal judge released Benghazi evidence that puts former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in deep trouble.
evi:
When was this claim made?		
15/02/2020		

When and where was this claim published?		
18/10/2018 by Patriot Journal.		

What was the claim based on?		
In a combative exchange at a hearing Friday in Washington, D.C., a federal judge unabashedly accused career State Department officials of lying and signing "clearly false" affidavits to derail a series of lawsuits seeking information about former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's private email server and her handling of the 2012 terrorist attack on the U.S. Consulate in Benghazi, Libya.		

Has there been any evidence on Hilary Clinton mishandling her emails?		
No deliberate mishandling has been found
label: Refuted

claim: FBI Ignored Evidence That Hillary Clinton Put A Hit Out On Brett Kavanaugh.
evi:
Where did the claim originate?		
wearethellod.com		

What is known about wearethellod.com ?		
It is a satire website.

claim: Very close to 160 million people are now working in the United States.
evi:
How many people were working in the United States in December 2019?		
Seasonally adjusted, around 158.7 million people were working in December 2019.		

How many people were working in the United States in December 2019?		
151.812 million jobs in December 2019 when seasonally adjusted.		

How many people were working in the United States in unadjusted data in December 2019?		
In the unadjusted data, 158.5 million people were working in December 2019.		

What was the population average of people working in the United States in December 2019?		
60.9		

What was the population average of people working in the United States in December 2010?		
58.3
