Yes, At least 17.5 million grants are provided to South Africans every month. If the monthly figures are rounded down or simplified to one monthly amount then '17.5 million' is a fair account, in order to summarise this expenditure.		

Are 17.5 million social grants are provided to South Africans?		
Yes, At least 17.5 million grants are provided to South Africans every month. If the monthly figures are rounded down or simplified to one monthly amount then '17.5 million' is a fair account, in order to summarise this monthly expenditure as one figure.
label: Supported

claim: If Donald Trump is successful in dismantling the Affordable Care Act, there is no guarantee for people who have pre-existing conditions.
evi:
What was the affordable act all about		
Affordable Care Act  prevented insurance companies from excluding patients with pre-existing conditions through multiple provisions.		

What does the law state in terms of excluding patients with pre-existing conditions?		
A group health plan and a health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage may not impose any preexisting condition exclusion with respect to such plan or coverage.		

Can insurers charge older people more?		
Insurance companies may charge older policyholders more, but they are not permitted to charge them more than three times as much as a policyholder who is 21 years old.		

Does Donald Trump support the Affordable Care Act?		
No, The Trump administration on Monday said the entire Affordable Care Act should be struck down, in a dramatic reversal.		

Does Donald Trump support the Affordable Care Act?		
No, When running for president, Donald Trump vowed to repeal the health care law. Individual provisions are broadly popular, even across partisan lines.		

What health care bill is Trump introducing?		
American Health Care Act		

Does the American Health Care Act protect pre-existing conditions?		
The Trump Administration’s decision not to defend key federal protections against
insurance company discrimination threatens more than 130 million people with pre-existing
health conditions in the United States, including 10 million people who obtain coverage through
the individual market. If the Trump Administration is successful in effectively eliminating the
guaranteed issue provision, the community rating provision, and the coverage exclusion
prohibition, insurance companies once again will be able to increase premiums and deny
coverage altogether based on gender, age, and pre-existing health conditions.		

Does the American Health Care Act protect pre-existing conditions?		
President Donald Trump’s promise to protect pre-existing conditions coverage, perhaps the most popular Affordable Care Act provision, rings hollow. That’s because his administration is backing a lawsuit that would scrap it.
label: Supported

claim: There is a possibility that this poisonous gas could have been released by any neighboring country which is afraid of us
evi:
Pakistan May Have ‘Released Poison Gas’ Over Polluted New Delhi?		
A traffic policeman wears a mask to protect himself from air pollution at a junction during restrictions on private vehicles based on registration plates, on a smoggy morning in New Delhi, India, November 4, 2019. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui		

What is the cause of this supposed poisonous gas		
The air pollution crisis is now an annual tradition in Delhi at this time of year, owing to a toxic mixture of smoke from celebration firecrackers, the burning of crop stubble by farmers in the neighbouring regions of Punjab and Haryana, and a cold shift in temperatures locking in the fumes.		

What city is the most polluted city in 2018		
New Delhi was the world’s most polluted capital city in 2018, two groups monitoring air pollution said on Tuesday in a study of the amount of fine particulate matter known as PM2.5 in 61 capital cities around the world.
label: Refuted

evi:
Is the deal between the US and the UK going to affect the NHS		
No, A trade deal would not have the power to stop the NHS being a free, universal service		

Was there an agreed upon amount that was going to be paid to the US drug agencies instead of the NHS		
In a statement to Dispatches, the Department for International Trade said: “The NHS is not, and never will be, for sale to the private sector, whether overseas or domestic‎…The sustainability of the NHS is an absolute priority for the government. We could not agree to any proposals on medicines pricing or access that would put NHS finances at risk or reduce clinician and patient choice.”		

Could a trade deal with the US leave the NHS with a bill for billions?		
A trade deal with America might leave the NHS footing a bill for billions,		

Was a drug firm  trade deal in place with the US at the time of the claim ?		
No, Donald Trump told a press conference in London that the NHS could form part of a future trade deal between the UK and the United States
label: Refuted

claim: U.S. aid dollars sent to Ukraine under Biden’s supervision went toward Burisma, where Biden’s son Hunter was a board member.
evi:
Did the USA send aid to Ukraine whilst Joe Biden was vice president.		
The United States disbursed about $1.28 billion to Ukraine between 2014 and 2016		

Was Hunter Biden a board member of Ukrainian energy company 'Burisma'		
Hunter Biden was appointed to the board of Burisma.		

Did hunter Biden use his position to secure US government funds for energy company burisma?		
Ukraine’s top prosecutor said his office is reviewing several cases related to the owner of a gas company where the son of former Vice President Joe Biden sat on the board, but he added that he wasn’t aware of any evidence of wrongdoing by either Joe or Hunter Biden.		

Is there proof that U.S. aid money went to Burisma?		
No answer could be found.		

Did Burisma receive U.S. funds?		
No answer could be found.		

Is there a Burisma legal case regarding Hunter Biden?		
No, Ukrainian officials say the inquiry into alleged improprieties at Burisma has never been completely closed.

“The Burisma case is still there; it’s up and down,” a senior Ukrainian official said, speaking on condition of anonymity to discuss sensitive matters. “But the Burisma case and a Hunter Biden case are totally different things, and the latter simply does not exist.”
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Americans in swing states do not want to hear about the impeachment of Donald Trump in 2019.
evi:
What does the FiveThirtyeight impeachment poll tracker report?		
50.4% support beginning the impeachment process, while 41.2% do not; and 48.1% say Trump should be impeached or impeached and removed, while 44.6% don’t support that.		

What is a swing state?		
Swing states, which are also called purple states or battleground states, are states that don't lean toward one particular party.		

Do swing states in the US oppose or support Donald Trumps impeachment?		
Notably, though, that same poll shows that while a majority does not support removing Trump via impeachment, about the same percentage, 51%, supports the impeachment inquiry being conducted by the House (44% oppose it). That contradicts Trump’s claim that most “don’t want to hear about it” and don’t want to “talk about it.”
label: Refuted

claim: Indian social activist Mahatma Gandhi once said, “First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.”
evi:
Where is the earliest match of these words being used?		
Indeed, the website Quote Investigator found the earliest “substantive” match in a speech Klein delivered at an Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America conference that year.

“And, my friends, in this story you have a history of this entire movement,” Klein said during the address. “First they ignore you. Then they ridicule you. And then they attack you and want to burn you. And then they build monuments to you.”		

Can this quote be attributed to Gandhi?		
No, Yet, while Gandhi is highly quotable, the Daily Caller News Foundation found no evidence that the quote originated with him. A search of the Gandhi Heritage Portal’s archive, which contains 100 volumes of original documents related to Gandhi, turned up no results.
label: Refuted

claim: Over 200,000 NHS nurses have resigned since 2010.
evi:
How many nurses have voluntary resigned from 2010-2018?		
Over the eight years from 2010 to 2018, just under 97,000 of the 200,000 nurses and health visitors had ‘voluntary resignation’ recorded as a reason for leaving.		

Does the NHS now have 200,000 fewer nurses than in 2010?		
No, In June 2018, there were around 2,700 more nurses and health visitors (full-time equivalent) working for the NHS than in June 2010 (a 1% increase).		

Is the figure quoted of 200,000 just for resignations?		
No, Over the eight years Labour looked at, just under 97,000 of the 200,000 nurses and health visitors had ‘voluntary resignation’ recorded as a reason for leaving—the single most common reason for leaving.

In the year to June 2011, 50% of nursing staff who had a reason for leaving recorded, voluntarily resigned. By the year ending June 2018, this had increased to 63%.

In total, around a third of voluntary resignations between June 2010 and 2018 did not have a specific reason for them recorded. Around a quarter were listed as being due to relocation and around one in five cited ‘work life balance’. Just under one in ten resigned for reasons relating to promotion.
label: Refuted

claim: The Information and Communication Technology sector contributes more to Nigeria’s Gross Domestic Product than the Oil and Gas sector.
evi:

Information and Communications Technology’s (ICT) contribution to the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of 13.8%		

How much does the Oil and Gas sector contribute to Nigeria’s Gross Domestic Product?		
Oil and Gas contribution of 8.8%

new federal spending of approximately $20.5 trillion over the 2020-2029 budget
window

1. Employer Medicare Contribution

4.Better Enforcement of Existing Tax Laws
5.Immigration Reform
6.Elimination of the Overseas Contingency Operations Fund

Yes, Letter from the 2008 Barack Obama campaign about the Health Care Plan is less detailed.

While we are not aware of any estimates of this particular proposal, similar proposals have been estimated to cost the federal government roughly $28-32 trillion over a decade.		

How did Elizabeth Warren's opponents in the 2019-20 presidential primaries present their healthcare plans?		
Bernie Sanders' document presented a number of options to begin a discussion about the best way of financing Medicare-for-all.

so a total of 18,350,359 votes counted

One in 2008

And he didn't have that refusal used against him in a criminal proceeding. There is no evidence that MMR vaccine causes death but the VAERS report has some deaths listed although the website has a disclaimer that VAERS reports alone cannot be used to determine if a vaccine caused or contributed to an adverse event or illness.		

What is the rate of deaths caused by MMR vaccine?		
There is no evidence that MMR vaccine causes death

MMR vaccine against measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR)

claim: US President Donald Trump's administration built the greatest economy in history.
evi:
How is  a country's economic health measured?		
One way in which economists measure the performance of an economy is by looking at a widely used measure of total output called gross domestic product (GDP).		

How is  a country's economic health measured?		
All the world’s economies share three main goals:

Growth
High employment
Price stability		

What was the job creation growth during Trump's administration?		
Obama created 1.6 million more jobs than Trump over a three-year period.


President Trump’s best year of job growth was 2.314 million in 2018 (the first year of the tax cut) but it falls short of any of Obama’s last three years.		

What the overall employment rate like under Trump's administration?		
...the unemployment rate fell to 8.4 percent as the country emerged from pandemic lockdowns, but the data shows the recovery is losing steam.

Nearly a quarter of the August employment gains were in government jobs, particularly temporary work for the 2020 census, and employment in the world's largest economy remains 11.5 million positions or 7.6 percent below the level in February, before the coronavirus pandemic struck.		

What the overall employment rate like under Trump's administration?		
"The recovery is rapidly decelerating and we still have half of the lost jobs to get back. That shouldn't be happening," Adam Ozimek, chief economist at freelancing platform Upwork...		

What was the overall GDP growth under Trump's administration?		
His boasts also don’t stand up when you peel the onion on GDP growth and realize that the Federal deficits during his Presidency will exceed any that were not impacted by a recession.		

Did the US Federal Reserve comment on the US economy at the time of the claim?		
Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said in an article published on September 4, 2020:
"We think that the economy's going to need low interest rates, which support economic activity, for an extended period of time," he said. "It will be measured in years."
label: Refuted

how many police officers do the conservatives plan to take on?		
The Home Office has today confirmed the officer recruitment targets for every police force in England and Wales for the first year of the unprecedented drive to increase their ranks by 20,000 over the next 3 years.		

how many police officers do the conservatives plan to take on?		
Strengthening police numbers is a priority for the government, which is providing £750 million to support forces to recruit up to 6,000 additional officers onto our streets by the end of 2020 to 2021, the first stage in this new uplift.

claim: More than 500 scientists and professionals in climate and related fields have sent a "European Climate Declaration" to the Secretary-General of the United Nations.
evi:
How many of the 500 signatures are scientists?		
Amber Kerr, Researcher, Agricultural Sustainability Institute, University of California, Davis:
While reviewing the claims related to agriculture, I noted that only 26 out of the 506 signatories (5%) were professionals in biology, ecology, or environmental science. I suspect that the vast majority of signatories had little direct knowledge or understanding of this part of the petition that they signed.		

What were the prevalent fields of expertise within the signatures?		
The most prevalent groups of signatories were geologists (19%) and engineers (21%)—many of whom were implicitly or explicitly involved in fossil energy extraction. Most of the rest were physicists, chemists, and mathematicians.		

How many signatures were not scientists?		
11.3%		

Were there any signatories with credentials?		
Yes, “Peter Champness, Radiologist, Australia”; “Patrick Mellett, architect and CEO”; and “Fintan Ryan, Retired Senior Airline Captain” (to say nothing of the dozens and dozens of fossil fuel employees)		

How many of the signatories are scientists?		
Amber Kerr, Researcher, Agricultural Sustainability Institute, University of California, Davis:
While reviewing the claims related to agriculture, I noted that only 26 out of the 506 signatories (5%) were professionals in biology, ecology, or environmental science. I suspect that the vast majority of signatories had little direct knowledge or understanding of this part of the petition that they signed.		

What did the media report about the claim that more than 500 scientists and professionals in climate and related fields have sent a 'European Climate Declaration' to the Secretary-General of the United Nations.?		
The Washington Times - Sunday, September 29, 2019 published an article on the event.

Scientists tell U.N. Global Climate Summit: No emergency

Climate Intelligence Foundation calls for UN meeting with experts from both sides of debate

 ....last week’s U.N. Global Climate Summit were the 500 international scientists, engineers and other stakeholders sounding a very different message: “There is no climate emergency.”

The signers asked Mr. Guterres to place the declaration on the UN’s agenda for the meeting ending Monday—which hasn’t happened—and organize a meeting of scientists “on both sides of the climate debate early in 2020.”		

What did the media report about the claim that more than 500 scientists and professionals in climate and related fields have sent a 'European Climate Declaration' to the Secretary-General of the United Nations.?		
The Independent UK published on Wednesday 25 September 2019 :

Hundreds of climate change deniers including academics, politicians and lobbyists are to launch a campaign to stop commitments to net zero carbon emissions being enshrined in law, The Independent can reveal.

A letter titled “There is no climate emergency” – which has been signed by 400 people who deem climate change to be a myth – is being sent to leaders of European Union (EU) and United Nations (UN) institutions in the coming weeks ahead of key environment talks.		

Who was responsible for the declaration letter?		
The European Climate Declaration was spearheaded by the Amsterdam-based Climate Intelligence Foundation [CLINTEL].		

What credibility has been placed on the declaration?		
The letter has been criticized by six scientists who claim that its credibility is very low. One complaint is that most of the 500 are not experts in "climate science."		

What credibility has been placed on the declaration?		
The letter uses the phrasing "more than 500 knowledgeable and experienced scientists and professionals in climate and related fields". Not all are "scientists" as per the title that the OP wrote. As seen above, one person is simply listed as being an "author" and another is listed as "PhD in Law, author of several books".		

What credibility has been placed on the declaration?		
...the sheer number of prominent signers with scientific and engineering credentials belied the contention that only a handful of fringe researchers and fossil-fuel shills oppose the climate-catastrophe “consensus.”

The U.S. contingent was made up of 45 U.S. professors, engineers and scientists, including MIT professor emeritus Richard Lindzen; Freeman Dyson of the Institute of Advanced Studies at Princeton, and Stanford University professor emeritus Elliott D. Bloom, as well as several signers formerly affiliated with NASA.
label: Refuted

claim: Labour have committed to hire 10,000 police officers at a cost of £3 billion.

Labour’s figures show that in 2017-18 its police recruitment drive would cost £64.3m, £139.1m in 2018-19, £217.2m in 2019-20 and £298.8m in 2020-21, making a total of £771m or nearly £800m over the life of the next parliament.		

What will Labour's estimated funding go towards?		
The cost will go towards salary costs and does not include the cost of hiring or training new officers.		

Has Labour committed to hiring 10,000 police officers at a cost of £3 billion?		
No answer could be found.		

when was it this pledge done		
2017 manifesto

Whilst the medicine exists. It is not clear if it is used to treat dengue fever.		

Can dengue fever be cured within 48 hours?		
The treatment of the disease depends on its severity.  Severe dengue could not be cured in 48 hrs.

evi:
How common of a medical emergency is stroke in Kenya's hospitals?		
A study of 200 unconscious adult patients at the University College Hospital in Ibadan from August 2004 to March 2005. A third of them were diagnosed with acute stroke,		

Is there any data on how common stroke is throughout  Kenya's hospital system?		
A study of 2,922 patients admitted into one accident and emergency department of the Federal Medical Centre in Ekiti state from January 2010 to December 2012. Heart failure was the leading cause of admission with 329 patients, followed by stroke with 283 patients		

Is a comprehensive survey available for stroke data in Kenya's hospitals?		
No answer could be found.		

Is there any other small studies on stroke numbers in Kenya's hospitals?		
A 2016 study to see if hospital admission after hours or over weekends resulted in higher death rates. Out of 339 patients, 55.7% (187) had suffered a stroke. But the 339 patients accounted for 34.5% of all admissions in the study period.

claim: Cambridge University Student Union (CUSU) banned Remembrance Day celebrations remembering British war veterans.
evi:
What did Cambridge Universitys student union say about the claim?		
No, we did not ban poppies or Remembrance Day at Cambridge University…

CUSU would carry on as it always had in its Remembrance Day commemorations. This includes having the CUSU President lay a wreath as part of the Cambridge Remembrance Day commemorations and continuing to encourage individual students to commemorate Remembrance Day in any way they feel appropriate, which is consistent with Royal British Legion recommendations.		

Did CUSU vote down a Remembrance Sunday motion?		
On the agenda was a motion put forward by two non-voting students, to ask Council to promote Remembrance Day actively across the whole student body, as a way of remembering British war veterans. An amended motion was also proposed which deleted various phrases of the original motion, as per standard practice, in order to include all those affected by war. In deciding which of the two motions to take forward for a final vote, the amended motion was selected. However, and contrary to many reports in the media, the amended motion was then defeated by a huge margin with only three votes in favour.

claim: 90,000 Californians are unsheltered and homeless.
evi:
What is the definition of homeless?		
Homeless describes a person who lacks a fixed,
regular, and adequate nighttime residence.		

What is the definition of Unsheltered Homelessness?		
Unsheltered Homelessness refers to people
whose primary nighttime location is a public or
private place not designated for, or ordinarily
used as, a regular sleeping accommodation for
people (for example, the streets, vehicles, or
parks).		

How many unsheltered homeless were recorded in 2018 in California?		
89,543 people in California were unsheltered and homeless according to the  2018 Annual Homeless Assessment Report (AHAR) to Cong		

How many unsheltered homeless were recorded in 2019 in California?		
108,432 people in California were reported unsheltered and homeless in the 2019 2019 AHAR: Part 1 - PIT Estimates of Homelessness in the U.S.

claim: A majority of UK voters say violence against MPs is “worth it” to get their way in Brexit.
evi:
What survey does the claim reference?		
Findings from a 2019 Future of England Survey, conducted by YouGov		

Does the survey ask if violence against MP's is a price worth paying for Brexit?		
Yes, The majority of Remain voters across all three countries thought that violence towards MPs was a ‘price worth paying’ to Remain		

Did the survey ask people if violence against 'MPs specifically' was a price worth paying?		
No, the survey only gave respondents three simplistic answers to choose from:

- “I want this to happen regardless of Brexit”
- “I see it as a risk but it’s worth it”;
and 
- “[leaving/remaining in the EU] is not worth the risk of this happening”.		

The source of the claim is said to be the results of a survey conducted by a Cardiff university. What was the point of the survey?		
Among the questions posed, representative samples of electorates in each country were asked what they would be willing to see happen to get their way on Brexit. 

The researchers have been asking people’s views on this topic since the historic vote three years ago. 

 A range of scenarios were put to respondents and they were asked to state whether each one was a ‘price worth paying’ or ‘not worth paying’ to either Leave the EU or to Remain.		

There are the two questions in the poll using the words

"being a price worth paying or not worth paying?"

in connection with 

"Violence directed towards Members of Parliament"

European Union** might present challenges
to the UK but others disagree, labelling this
as Project Fear. For each of the following
please tell us whether you think this would
be a price worth paying or not worth paying
for Brexit?

and **remaining in the EU** might present
challenges to the UK but others disagree.

whether you think this would be a price
worth paying or not worth paying for
stopping Brexit

on her Instagram account.

“Im baaaccckkk! Or should I say, I’m A L I I I I VE and oh so ready for SCORP SEASON and my 30th!!!”

24/10/2019

An Extreme Risk Protection Order (ERPO), also known as a red flag law, is an order from a judge that suspends a person’s license to possess or carry a gun.

What was the ports agency's finicial year report for 2014/2015		
The port agency’s annual 2014/15 report shows that in the 2013/14 financial year, which started in July 2013, some 25 million deadweight tonnage (DWT) passed through the port. This is a widely used measure of a ship’s carrying capacity.

Kilindini Harbour is the main part of the Port of Mombasa,

In April 2013

The port agency’s annual  report shows that in the 2013/14 financial year, which started in July 2013, some 25 million deadweight tonnage (DWT) passed through the port		

How much cargo went through the port in 2019?		
The port manager’s most recent publicly available report shows that in 2016/17, this had climbed to 28.2 million DWT, an increase of 12%.

claim: In 2008 the US Congress gave Wall Street trillions of dollars of zero interest loans.
evi:
What happened in the US in 2007/8?		
The Great Recession.
Bank loans were going sour. Bank stock prices were in free fall. Big-name firms were outright failing or on the brink.

As the housing bubble popped and the most severe financial crisis since the Great Depression tightened its grip on the US economy, the situation swiftly became an all-hands-on-deck state of affairs for the Federal Reserve, which supervises bank holding companies and state member banks to ensure they're safe and sound.		

What is this claim based on?		
Federal Reserve's 'astounding' report: We loaned banks trillions
The Federal Reserve offers details on the loans it gave to banks and others at the height of the financial crisis. One program alone doled out nearly $9 trillion.		

What is this claim based on?		
The emergency loans, in the view of many finance experts, helped to avert a much deeper economic slump. And those loans have now been largely paid back without losses to the central bank.		

What did the Federal Bank do to combat the Great Recession?		
The emergency liquidity programs that the Federal Reserve set up provided secured and mostly short-term loans.
The Federal Reserve also provided credit to several systemically important financial institutions. These actions were taken to avoid the disorderly failure of these institutions and the potential catastrophic consequences for the U.S. financial system and economy. All extensions of credit were fully secured and are in the process of being fully repaid.
Finally, the Federal Reserve provided economic stimulus by lowering interest rates. Over the course of the crisis, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) reduced its target for the federal funds rate to a range of 0 to 1/4 percent.		

Were the interest rates zero?		
No, Interest rates were very low, but not at zero.
label: Refuted

claim: Pricking a needle on the fingertips of a stroke victim can save their life as they will gain consciousness in some time.
evi:
What are immediate actions to take when one has a stroke		
Call 911 immediately
Note the time you first see symptoms
Perform CPR, if necessary		

Can pricking the fingertips with a needle save the life of a stroke victim		
For every minute that passes, one million nerve cells are dying in the brain during a sudden stroke attack to the brain. We know that the sooner you get to a relevant healthcare facility the better the outcome, as the treatment we can provide can only be given within the first few hours of the stroke.”

The needle technique recommended in the post could be harmful in itself, Dr. Sokhi warned.

“The pain experienced by injuring these most sensitive parts of the body might cause the patient’s blood pressure to rise and worsen the stroke.
label: Refuted

claim: Once a stroke victim's mouth is crooked, you should pull their the ears until they are red and prick them until they bleed. This technique will stop capillaries in the victim’s brain from bursting.
evi:
How can you save someone if they are having a stroke?		
If you're experiencing any symptom of a stroke, which is you feel your face or somebody notices your face is dripping, if you can't raise your arm or put your arm up and it starts to drift down or your speech is slurred or jumbled words are coming out of your mouth, call 911 immediately.		

Can pricking earlobes help someone if they are having a stroke?		
No answer could be found.
label: Refuted

claim: Tote bags made from cotton harm the environment
evi:
What is the source used for this claim ?		
Denmark’s Ministry of Environment and Food, based on a 2018 government study		

What does the study statistics show us about the use of cotton totes ?		
The study found that it takes about 20,000 uses of an organic cotton bag to have the same environmental impact of using a plastic bag

Organic cotton bags: Reuse for grocery shopping at least 149 times for climate change, at
least 20000 times considering all indicators; reuse as waste bin bag if possible, otherwise
incinerate.		

What are the disadvantages of using plastic bags vs cotton bags?		
Plastic bags are mostly made of non-sustainable materials. Their production has a big carbon footprint and pollute soils and water. Plastic never disappear, it spread into small pieces that pollutes the ocean and lands. These microbeads have a direct impact on our health as the enter the food chain.

6- Do not forget that plastic bags are almost never recycled. The cost of their recycling is higher than their value, that is why the usually end in waste incinerators, landfills or in the sea.		

Does the report show that a cotton bag can be used 20000 times before it has the same impact as a plastic bag?		
No. The report shows that a cotton bag must be used 20000 times to have the SAME impact as a plastic bag. This is a negative thing. It is because of the resources (water and power) used to make the cotton bag.		

Do tote bags made from cotton harm the environment?		
The claim does not ask for comparison against plastic bags. It asks if cotton bags harm the environment. The answer is yes. Quite simply, any manufacturing process harms the environment - so the claim is supported because no comparison is required.
label: Supported

claim:
Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM)
danced at an election rally to celebrate the murder of Hindu Samaj leader, Kamlesh Tiwari.

What date was Hindu Samaj leader, Kamlesh Tiwari.  found murdered?		
Tiwari was found murdered inside his house in Lucknow on October 18, 2019.

claim: Late US advice columnist Ann Landers was the originator of the quote: "At age 20, we worry about what others think of us. At age 40, we don’t care what they think. At age 60, we discover that they have not been thinking of us at all."
evi:
Is there a list of quotes on aging from Ann Landers on here official website?		
No, There is no mention of it amongst her quotes.		

Did Landers ever say this in her column?		
In the Chicago tribune, answering to a fans question

Gem of the Day: At 20, we worry about what others think of us. At 40, we don`t care what they think of us. At 60, we discover that they haven`t been thinking of us at all.		

Has the quote ever been accredited to anyone else before Landers?		
The saying above was very similar to the statement published in 1934, and QI believes Will Rogers was responsible for both. The line from the script may have leaked before the film was completed and exhibited.

In March 1935 The Bee of Danville, Virginia printed the line and credited Rogers:[5]		

Has the quote ever been accredited to anyone else before Landers?		
The saying above was very similar to the statement published in 1934, and QI believes Will Rogers was responsible for both. The line from the script may have leaked before the film was completed and exhibited.

In March 1935 The Bee of Danville, Virginia printed the line and credited Rogers:[5]		

Did Ann Landers say "At age 20, we worry about what others think of us. At age 40, we don’t care what they think. At age 60, we discover that they have not been thinking of us at all."?		
No, She did say "Many who write are panic-stricken at the thought of leaving their 20s behind. More are terrified at the prospect of the Big 40. … For many, the fortieth birthday is a traumatic experience."		

Where did Landers say "Many who write are panic-stricken at the thought of leaving their 20s behind. More are terrified at the prospect of the Big 40. … For many, the fortieth birthday is a traumatic experience."?		
In a chapter about aging in her 1961 book, "Since You Asked Me
label: Refuted

Is Joe Biden from a working-class background?		
Joe Biden has working-class roots. However, in 1955, when he was 13 years old, the family moved to Mayfield, Delaware - a rapidly growing middle-class community sustained primarily by the nearby DuPont Chemical Company.

claim: India’s HDFC Bank is not liable to take responsibility for deposits over one lakh rupees per account holder.
evi:
Does the HDFC Bank only cover upto one lakh rupees (100,000)?		
It is true that deposits up to Rs 1 lakh are insured with banks. However, this is only in case a bank fails		

Is there a way to cover any additional funds in case the bank fails?		
Deposit insurance - Banks have to incorporate information about ‘deposit insurance cover’ along with the limit of coverage ...
Deposit insurance protects the depositors from losing their money in full. It ensures part recovery. So in case of a bank failure, a depositor doesn’t lose all their money.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

What finance methods have been proposed by Sen Bernie Sanders		
Sanders’ office outlined potential methods to finance the system. Those include income-based premiums paid by employees and employers, hiking the marginal tax rate to up to 70 percent on people making $10 million or more, raising the estate tax and putting a “fee on large financial institutions.”

claim: Flu shots contain Hydrocortisone which may cause bone weakness adrenal fatigue, weight gain and diabetes.
evi:
Do flu shots contain hydrocortisone?		
Yes, Two flu vaccines may contain traces/residue of hydrocortisone during the manufacturing process.		

What is hydrocortisone commonly used for?		
Hydrocortisone creams are used on the skin to treat swelling, itching and irritation. They can help with skin problems such as:

eczema
psoriasis
contact dermatitis
prickly heat rash
insect bites and stings
nappy rash		

Does hydrocortisone cause bone weakness, adrenal problems, weight gain and diabetes?		
Yes, Long-term use of hydrocortisone tablets may cause diabetes problems, weight gain, adrenal issues, bone weakness, and other negative effects.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Flu shots contain Formaldehyde which is a known human carcinogen and has been known to cause infertility and hormone imbalance.
evi:
Do flu shots contain Formaldehyde?		
Formaldehyde may be present to inactivate bacterial products for toxoid vaccines. This also kills viruses and bacteria that may contaminate the vaccine during production and storage.		

What is formaldehyde used for?		
Formaldehyde is a chemical also used in the production of killed vaccines. It's used very early in the manufacturing process to kill or inactivate the toxins from bacteria or viruses.		

How much formaldehyde is usually found in vaccines?		
As part of the manufacturing process, some residual formaldehyde can remain behind in vaccines at levels less than or equal to 0.02%.		

What side-effects can formaldehyde cause?		
Formaldehyde, a colorless, pungent-smelling gas, can cause watery eyes, burning sensations in the eyes and throat, nausea, and difficulty in breathing in some humans exposed at elevated levels (above 0.1 parts per million). High concentrations may trigger attacks in people with asthma. There is evidence that some people can develop a sensitivity to formaldehyde. It has also been shown to cause cancer in animals and may cause cancer in humans.  Health effects include eye, nose, and throat irritation; wheezing and coughing; fatigue; skin rash; severe allergic reactions. May cause cancer. May also cause other effects listed under "organic gases."		

Can formaldehyde affect fertility and hormonal imbalance?		
There have been studies on how Formaldehyde can affect fertility - but they are focused on people who work with the chemical in higher concentrations.		

Can traces of formaldehyde in vaccines cause health concerns?		
Although formaldehyde can be harmful in high concentrations, there are no health concerns about the small amounts found in vaccines.

claim: Flu shots contain polysorbate 80, which has been linked to ovarian damage and infertility. It could induce liver failure.
evi:

Do any UK flu vaccines contain polysorbate 80?		
Adjuvant: MF59C.1 which is an exclusive adjuvant: 9.75 mg squalene, 1.175 mg polysorbate 80, 1.175 mg sorbitan trioleate, 0.66 mg sodium citrate, 0.04 mg citric acid, water for injections.		

Why is there an adjuvant in vaccines?		
It helps promote a better immune response. Adjuvants also reduce the amount of virus needed for production of a vaccine, which can allow for greater supplies of vaccine to be manufactured.		

Why is there an adjuvant in vaccines?		
It helps promote a better immune response. Adjuvants also reduce the amount of virus needed for production of a vaccine,		

Are there concerns about polysorbate 80's affect on fertility?		
they raise concerns about Polysorbate 80 and its relationship with infertility. They state that up to the age of 12, children receive a combined 0.8 mg of Polysorbate 80 administered through the Australian childhood vaccination schedule. This figure should not be considered a cause for concern, as 0.8 mg of Polysorbate 80 (the cumulative dose over 12 years) is >90 000 times lower than the acute exposure dose (based on rat intravenous LD50 of 1790 mg/kg5) for a 41 kg 12-year-old girl or >6700 times lower for a 3 kg infant. The animal study,6 cited by Little and Ward, examining Polysorbate 80 toxicity on neonatal rats (over 4 days) gave doses equivalent to 550–5500 times higher than the entire exposure a human child gets by the age of 12.		

Are there concerns about polysorbate 80's affect on fertility?		
Many other critics of the HPV vaccine, raise the issue of toxicity. In particular, they raise concerns about Polysorbate 80 and its relationship with infertility.		

Has any evidence been shown for a link between polysorbate 80 and infertility?		
1 critic (Little and Ward ) cites case reports of a combined total of only six cases, including their own report of three cases

it is acknowledged that fertility can be affected by a wide range of factors

claim: Americans prefer giving people under 65 an option to join Medicare as opposed to requiring them to give up their current coverage.
evi:
Are there any recent polls on American health policy?		
Yes, But most of the recent polls have a wide variation in how questions are worded.		

Are there any recent polls on American health policy?		
Support for Medicare-for-all has narrowed in recent months, with 51% now saying they favor a national health plan and 47% opposed. At the same time, support for a public option has inched up since July, with 73% now saying they favor a government plan that would compete with private health care plans and 24% opposed.		

Are there any recent polls on American health policy?		
Support for a national health plan, or Medicare-for-all, appears to have narrowed somewhat in recent months. This month’s poll finds about half the public (51%) favors a national Medicare-for-all plan while 47% are opposed. This is the narrowest gap between those who favor and oppose such a plan measured in KFF polls since 2017, and represents a 5-percentage point drop in the share in favor and an 8-percentage point increase in the share opposed since April.		

What percentage of Americans prefer giving people under 65 an option to join Medicare as opposed to requiring them to give up their current coverage?		
73%

claim: Congressional benefits include free health care.
evi:
what kind of health insurance do members of congress get ?		
Congressional health benefits
Before the Affordable Care Act, Congress and staffers got their health care through employer-provided insurance, the Federal Employees Health Benefits (FEHB) Program. During the ACA debate, the idea that members of Congress would not be subject to the exchanges became a big political issue. So, the final "ACA" (Obamacare) required lawmakers and staffers to get their insurance through the local health exchange, the District of Columbia’s small business health options program (SHOP) exchange.

For the 2017 plan year, there were 57 plan options in the gold tier on the DC SHOP. Members and staff have to choose at least the gold option to receive the employer contribution, which is figured at 72% of the weighted average of all FEHB plan premiums.  

Once a member or staffer is no longer in federal service, they have an option to enroll in an FEHB plan under Temporary Continuation of Coverage (TCC) that they pay for (like COBRA).

Want more details on the Congressional health benefits? This CRS Report has you covered.

Congressional retirement benefits
Up until 1984, federal employees (including Members of Congress) did not pay Social Security taxes or receive Social Security benefits but were instead covered by the Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS). Members elected after 1984 are covered by the Federal Employees’ Retirement System (FERS).

Like other federal employees, Congressional pensions are financed through employee and employer contributions. Members pay Social Security payroll taxes equal to 6.2% Social Security taxes and contribute to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund (CSRDF).

Members of Congress are eligible for a pension at age 62 (with at least five years of service), age 50 (with at least twenty years of service), or at any age (after 25 years of service). "The amount of the pension depends on years of service and the average of the highest three years of
salary. By law, the starting amount of a Member’s ret		

Do members of members of congress gets free health care?		
Before the Affordable Care Act, senators and representatives used to receive health insurance through the Federal Employees Health Benefits program, which was similar to health insurance programs at large companies. That means that the employer (in this case, the U.S. government) makes a contribution toward the health insurance plan selected by the employee. Under the Affordable Care Act, the government still covers a portion of the costs but the plans have to be purchased on a D.C. exchange called D.C. Health Link.		

What Benefits Do Members Of Congress Get After They Leave Office?		
A sitting Member of Congress earns a salary of $174,000/year. That ends when he or she is no longer in office. But, depending on when the Member was elected, that person does receive a pension, access to a 401(k)-like retirement account and, in many cases Social Security benefits. Members of Congress started paying into Social Security in 1984. These benefits are generally the same as other federal employees would receive.

According to the Congressional Research Service, members are eligible for the pension at age 62 if they've served five years or more. (They are eligible at earlier ages with more years of service.)		

Does Congressional benefits include free health care ?		
No, It is not free, but it is generous compared to other private and not federal public employers. The percentage of premiums paid by the federal government
is calculated separately for individual, self plus one, and family coverage, but each uses the same
formula. According to the formula, the employer contribution is set at 72% of the weighted
average of all FEHB plan premiums, not to exceed 75% of any given plan’s premium.2

claim: Nigeria has Africa's highest rate of depression.
evi:
According to the World Health Organisation's Global Health Estimates what percentage of Nigeria's population suffers from depression?		
According to the statistics in the report, 3.9% of Nigeria's  population were suffering from depression in 2015.		

What countries in Africa are recorded as having populations suffering from depression with higher percentages than Nigeria?		
Cape Verde's population has the highest percentage suffering from depression (4.9%), followed by  Lesotho (4.8%), Botswana (4.7%), and Ethiopia (4.7%).		

What was the population of Nigeria in 2019?		
In its 2019 state of the world population report the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) says Nigeria’s population has hit a new high of 201 million.		

Has WHO released any later statistics in connection with the amount of depression in Nigeria's population?		
A tweet from WHO dated 17 April 2019, says:
Over 7,000,000 Nigerians are depressed.
(3.48% of the population in 2019)		

What was the percentage of the population with depression in Cape Verde,  Lesotho , Botswana and Ethiopia in the year of the claim, ie 2019?		
No answer could be found.		

Do any countries in Africa have  populations suffering from depression with higher percentages than Nigeria?		
Yes, Cape Verde's population has the highest percentage suffering from depression (4.9%), followed by  Lesotho (4.8%), Botswana (4.7%), and Ethiopia (4.7%).		

Does Nigeria have the highest rate of depression as a share of population compared to any other African countries?		
As a share of the population, at least 24 other countries in Africa have a higher rate of depression than Nigeria’s 3.9%.
label: Refuted

claim: Nigeria has an estimated physician-patient ratio of one doctor to every 4,000 to 5,000 patients.
evi:
What is Nigeria's estimated physician-patient ratio of one doctor to patients?		
In regards to Psychiatry, the doctor/patient ratio was 1:870 (One Psychiatrist).		

What is Nigeria's estimated physician-patient ratio of one doctor to patients?		
There are also less than 30,000 doctors in Nigeria today [27], and the approximate average doctor:patient ratio of 1:53,333		

What is the estimated number of doctors in Nigeria?		
40,000 doctors		

How many patients do the 40,000 doctors in Nigeria look after?		
40,000 doctors taking care of 200 million people.		

What is the latest estimate of Nigeria's population?		
As on July 1, 2019, the UN's population division estimates the population at 200.9 million.		

What is the ratio for 40,000 to 200 million?		
40, 000 doctors taking care of 200.9 million patients equates to 1:5000 (1 doctor per 5000 people as claimed)		

What is the WHO's recommendation for doctor patient ratio?		
the World Health Organisation, WHO, recommends one doctor to 600 patients,
label: Supported

claim: Joe Biden wants to abolish the "stepped up basis" that currently reduces inheritance taxes.
evi:
Does Joe Biden want to remove a policy that reduces inheritance taxes?		
Yes, Joe Biden wants to eliminate the stepped-up basis loophole, a type of break on inheritance taxes.		

What is a stepped-up basis?		
...a special rule for inherited property known as the step-up in basis rule. Here’s how it works: David inherits a house from his uncle who bought the house in 1982 for $70,000. The home was worth $800,000 at the time of his uncle’s death. If David decides to sell the house, his basis will be $800,000 so he will only be taxed on the difference between what he sold it for and his new stepped-up basis of $800,000.
label: Supported

claim: CNN reported Philip Andrei Gancia Became a Porn Star
evi:
Was the story actually posted on the CNN website?		
No, No it was posted on the WorldGreyNews website but with a fake CNN logo.		

Is WorldGreyNews a legitimate news source?		
No, No there is a small link at the bottom of the page that reads "Main article is FAKE. Create your own fake news"

when was this claim made

The card issuance will start in April 2020.

claim: The House of Representatives is now essentially running an impeachment process without following precedent, without allowing the president to have counsel, without allowing the president to call witnesses or have subpoena power.”
evi:
Who made the claim		
Ronna McDaniel		

What are the rules to be abided by for a senate trial for impeachment		
There are no set rules. Rather, the Senate passes a resolution first laying out trial procedures		

Did Donald Trump have counsel during his impeachment hearings		
No answer could be found.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: If they have a vote to do a formal impeachment inquiry, historically, precedent is such that, yes, then everyone gets the right, the minority party gets rights. Certainly, the White House gets rights. The president gets rights that aren’t there now.
evi:
What are the rules for a Senate trial such as an impeachment?		
There are no set rules. Rather, the Senate passes a resolution first laying out trial procedures.		

What rights does the person  on trial have?		
No answer could be found.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: In the US the impeachment process has always gone through the House Judiciary Committee, because it is the committee of jurisdiction over the Constitution and over impeachment, not the Intelligence Committee.
evi:
Has the impeachment process in the US ever not gone through the Judiciary Committee?		
In 1867, after the Judiciary Committee voted to not send articles of impeachment against President Andrew Johnson to the full House, a second attempt to impeach him succeeded after an inquiry by the Committee on Reconstruction.		

Has the impeachment process in the US ever not gone through the Judiciary Committee?		
Special committees began impeachment inquiries against federal judges in 1804,1808 and 1839.		

Does the US Constitution state that the House Judiciary Committee must conduct any impeachment inquiry?		
The Constitution doesn’t offer specific guidance on rules for impeachment inquiries and the House determines its own rules of parliamentary conduct. According to the CRS, (Congressional Research Service) the House’s rules allow for an impeachment inquiry to go forward without an initial resolution but the matter would move on the Judiciary Committee at some point.		

What is the standard process followed during an impeachment process?		
The House impeachment process generally proceeds in three phases: (1) initiation of the impeachment process; (2) Judiciary Committee investigation, hearings, and markup of articles of impeachment; and (3) full House consideration of the articles of impeachment.		

Do impeachment proceedings have to go through the Judiciary Committee?		
In recent decades, it has been
more common than not that the Judiciary Committee used information provided from another outside investigation. The
committee might create a task force or a subcommittee to review this material and collect any other information through
subpoenas, depositions, and public hearings. Impeachment investigations are governed by the standing rules of the House
that govern all committee investigations, the terms of the resolution authorizing the investigation, and perhaps additional
rules adopted by the committee specifically for the inquiry.
label: Refuted

claim: The Trump family was disallowed from operating any charity in the State of New York because they stole from a kids cancer charity.
evi:
Has a lawsuit been filed against the Trump family charities?		
Yes, ttorney General Barbara D. Underwood today (14/06/2018) announced a lawsuit against the Donald J. Trump Foundation, and its directors, Donald J. Trump (“Mr. Trump”), Donald J. Trump, Jr., Ivanka Trump, and Eric Trump.		

What does the 2018 lawsuit against the Trump family allege?		
The petition alleges a pattern of persistent illegal conduct, occurring over more than a decade, that includes extensive unlawful political coordination with the Trump presidential campaign, repeated and willful self-dealing transactions to benefit Mr. Trump’s personal and business interests, and violations of basic legal obligations for non-profit foundations.		

Does the 2018 lawsuit seek to ban the Trump family from operating any charity in the State of New York?		
The AG’s lawsuit also seeks a ban from future service as a director of a New York not-for-profit of 10 years for Mr. Trump and one year for each of the Foundation’s other board members, Donald Trump Jr., Ivanka Trump, and Eric Trump.		

Was the Donal J Trump Foundation a children's charity?		
As a private foundation, the Trump Foundation is primarily involved in making grants to other nonprofit organizations		

Has the lawsuit been settled?		
No answer could be found.		

Has Trump been banned from running a charity?		
No, the case was settled with stipulations in force if Trump ran another charity.

The settlement agreement imposes a regime of restrictions on any future service by Mr. Trump on a charity’s board of directors, including a total ban on any self-dealing. Any charity he joins as a director must have a majority of independent directors, must engage counsel with expertise in New York not-for-profit law, and must engage the services of an accounting firm to monitor and audit the organization’s grants and expenses. If Mr. Trump forms a new charity, such an organization must comply with these requirements, and also report to the Office of the Attorney General for five years.
label: Refuted

What is the US Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) allowed level for insect fragments in peanut butter?		
Average of 30 or more insect fragments per 100 grams.

evi:

On the day of the 2009 Obama rally, the Minneapolis police chief estimated the department’s costs to top $20,000 including for 50 officers on overtime at the 20,500-seat Target Center arena, the St. Paul Pioneer Press reported. We tried to confirm if that was the actual cost with police officials but did not get a response.

claim: US food standards allow for maggots in orange juice.
evi:
what is the allowed food defect in orange juice		
Citrus Fruit Juices, Canned

Mold
(AOAC 970.75)

Average mold count is 10% or more

Insects and insect eggs
(AOAC 970.72)

5 or more Drosophila and other fly eggs per 250 ml or 1 or more maggots per 250 ml		

does this food defect pose a threat to health		
These "Food Defect Action Levels" listed in this booklet are set on this premise--that they pose no inherent hazard to health.		

Does US FDA allow for maggots to be present in consumer orange juice?		
Yes, 1 or more maggots per 250 ml

claim: Thomas Jefferson said, “The government will one day be corrupt and filled with liars, and the people will flock to the one that tells the truth."
evi:
Where is the earliest instance of this saying being attributed to Jefferson?		
It appears in an October 2015 tweet from user Ziad K Abdelnour

No, it does not appear anywhere.

claim: One in four women in Africa suffer from depression.
evi:
How many women in Africa suffer from depression?		
In 2017, the World Health Organisation (WHO) estimated that 5.9% (one in 17) of women in the African region suffered from depressive disorders.		

What is the latest data on how many women in Africa suffer from depression?		
In a latest age-standardised estimate for women in sub-Saharan Africa is at 4.3% (one in 23)		

What is the latest data on how many women in Africa suffer from depression?		
In a latest age-standardised estimate for women in sub-Saharan Africa is at 4.3% (one in 23) in 2017.
label: Refuted

claim: 1 in 6 in the US get food poisoning each year but only 1 in 66 in the UK.
evi:
Where does the 1 in 66 estimate come from?		
The estimate that one in 66 people in the UK gets food poisoning is based on a 2011 FSA report. It estimated that in the UK a million people a year suffer a foodborne illness. The population of the UK today is around 66 million, which the original claimant seems to have used to get one in 66.		

Is this an accurate statistic?		
No, It’s difficult to estimate the number of people who get food poisoning a year. It’s not always possible to prove someone got ill because of something they’d eaten, and they may not always go to a doctor or seek medical advice. As a result the estimates are broad.		

Where does the one in 6 figure come from?		
The figure of one in six for the US comes from the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), which estimates that “each year roughly 1 in 6 Americans (or 48 million people)” get sick as a result of foodborne diseases		

Is this an accurate figure?		
The CDC told us this came from a paper published in 2011, but that the estimates are a “fairly accurate representation of the burden of [foodborne] diseases in the US.”		

Is the data between the two countries comparable?		
the data between the two countries isn’t comparable and varies considerably in how and when it was collected, and there are differences in the methodology behind the estimates. Real world factors, like access to medical care which differs widely between the two countries, can also affect the comparison.		

What is the estimated population in the UK that falls sick due to food poisoning?		
around a million people suffer a foodborne illness		

What was the UK's population in 2018?		
66,435,600		

When was this claim made?		
06/10/2019		

What is the estimated population in the U.S. that falls sick due to food poisoning?		
CDC estimates that each year roughly 1 in 6 Americans (or 48 million people) gets sick		

What was the population of the United States in 2018?		
332,140,037
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: "New Starbucks CEO" Rosalind Brewer admits she doesn't like white people?
evi:
Who is Rosalind Brewer?		
Rosalind G. Brewer is an American businesswoman and the first African American woman to become chief operations officer (COO) of Starbucks.
After retiring from Walmart on February 1, 2017 she accepted the COO role at Starbucks.		

Who is Rosalind Brewer?		
Rosalind G. Brewer is chief operations officer (COO) of Starbucks.		

What is the basis of this claim?		
A 2015 CNN interview where she discussed the importance of workforce diversity.		

What did Brewer say?		
"My executive team is very diverse, and I make that a priority," she told Harlow. "I demand it of my team and within the structure. And then, every now and then, you have to nudge your partners, and you have to speak up and speak out. And I try to use my platform for that. ... I try to set an example. I try to mentor many women inside my company and outside the company because I think it's important.

"And I talk to my suppliers about it. Just today we met with a supplier, and the entire other side of the table was all Caucasian males. That was interesting. I decided not to talk about it directly with [the supplier's] folks in the room because there were actually no females, like, levels down. So I'm going to place a call to him."		

Who is the CEO of Starbucks?		
Kevin Johnson
president and chief executive officer		

What do the accusations of not liking white people stem from?		
From an interview she gave CNN in 2015, in which she seemed to have a problem with too many white men in corporate America.
label: Refuted

claim: Chemotherapy is mustard gas poison.
evi:
What is chemotherapy?		
Chemotherapy, often called "chemo," is a treatment with drugs that kill cancer cells directly. Chemotherapy attacks all rapidly-dividing cells within the body, effectively targeting fast-growing tumors. Chemotherapy can be used alone or in combination with surgery, radiation, or immunotherapy.		

Has Mustard gas ever been used for chemotherapy?		
By World War II, at least two dozen medical researchers transformed mustard agents into cancer chemotherapy. In the 1940s, sulfur mustard, commonly called mustard gas, and nitrogen mustard, a derivative of mustard gas, became a new form of cancer treatment.2		

Is Mustard gas still used today?		
Several drugs derived from mustard agents are still used today to treat cancer, including one known as Mustargen		

Is Mustard gas still used today?		
During World War II, studies on nitrogen mustards (originally developed as a chemical weapon) in mice showed regression of advanced tumours.  This early research led to the development of other alkylating agents, many of which are used today, such as chlorambucil, melphalan, busufan and cyclophosphamide [iv].
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Cancer is a fungus called myotoxin, not a disease.
evi:
What is Cancer?		
Cancer is a broad term. It describes the DISEASE that results when cellular changes cause the uncontrolled growth and division of cells.
label: Refuted

claim: Theoretical physicist Albert Einstein once stated, “The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.”
evi:
Did Albert Einstein say, “The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.”		
No evidence in archives.		

Did Albert Einstein say, “The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.”		
Probably not.		

Is anyone else attributed to saying this?		
Similar quotes have been found.
label: Refuted

claim: Alkaline foods keep you from getting cancer.
evi:
Does an Alkaline Diet help prevent cancer?		
There is no evidence to prove  this.		

Has any research been done about alkaline water and cancer?		
Yes - conclusion - Promotion of alkaline diet and alkaline water to the public for cancer prevention or treatment is not justified.

Despite the promotion of the alkaline diet and alkaline water by the media and salespeople, there is almost no actual research to either support or disprove these ideas.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Trump TV Ad Misleads on Biden and Ukraine
evi:
Was Biden involved in the dismissal of the General Prosecutor Victor Shokin and Ukrainian politics		
Ukraine Prosecutor Says No Evidence of Wrongdoing by Bidens		

What was the content of Trumps ad as regards Joe Biden and Ukraine		
Trump said Biden threatened to withhold U.S. assistance to Ukraine unless it fired Shokin, which is true, but then implied without proof that it was done to protect Hunter Biden from prosecution.		

What links of involvement were found between Joe Biden and the dismissal of Victor Shokin		
“Biden was definitely not involved,” Lutsenko said. “We do not have any grounds to think that there was any wrongdoing starting from 2014.”

claim: The Democrats’ Medicare for All plan would reduce Americans’ household income by $17,000 a year.
evi:
What will the financial savings of the US Medicare proposal be for a single-payer?		
There’s a lot left to be answered about the concepts of Medicare-for-all specifically and the more broad category of single-payer before policymakers and voters can come close to understanding what it would mean in practice.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: The Democrat plans for socialized medicine will put doctors and hospitals out of business and also deny Americans’ treatment and everything they need.
evi:
How much does Medicare reimburse hospitals?		
Big hospital systems haggle constantly with Medicare over what they are paid, and often battle the government over charges of overbilling. On average, the government program pays hospitals about 87 cents for every dollar of their costs, compared with private insurers that pay $1.45.		

How much would Medicare for All reimburse hospitals?		
But those in favor of the most far-reaching changes, including Senator Bernie Sanders, who unveiled his latest Medicare for all plan as part of his presidential campaign, have remained largely silent on the question of how the nation’s 5,300 hospitals would be paid for patient care
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: In the U.S. Democratic proposals for universal health care would obliterate Medicare. Both the single-payer option and the public option would mean a raid of Medicare to fund socialism.
evi:
What is Medicare for All?		
Sanders' plan is a "single-payer" plan. That means the government will be the "single payer" on any health expenses. Right now, there are lots and lots of payers in the U.S. health care system — insurance companies, the federal government, states and so on.		

What is Medicare?		
Generally, Medicare is available for people age 65 or older, younger people with disabilities and people with End Stage Renal Disease (permanent kidney failure requiring dialysis or transplant). Medicare has two parts, Part A (Hospital Insurance) and Part B (Medicare Insurance). You are eligible for premium-free Part A if you are age 65 or older and you or your spouse worked and paid Medicare taxes for at least 10 years. You can get Part A at age 65 without having to pay premiums if:

You are receiving retirement benefits from Social Security or the Railroad Retirement Board.
You are eligible to receive Social Security or Railroad benefits but you have not yet filed for them.
You or your spouse had Medicare-covered government employment.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Democrats are draining Americans’ health care to finance open borders.
evi:
Are Democrats draining Americans' health care to finance open borders?		
No answer could be found.		

Is American health care covered for undocumented people?		
With the exception of emergency medical care, undocumented immigrants are not eligible for federally funded public health insurance programs, including Medicare, Medicaid and the Child Health Insurance Program (CHIP).		

Is American health care covered for undocumented people?		
California has become the first state in the country to offer government-subsidized health benefits to young adults living in the U.S. illegally.

The measure signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom on Tuesday extends coverage to low-income, undocumented adults ages 25 and younger for the state's Medicaid program.		

Are democrats draining Americans’ health care to finance the open borders ?		
In August, the president argued that Democrats "support giving illegal immigrants free healthcare at our expense." But that isn’t accurate. The statement, part of a Trump 2020 television advertisement, was rated Mostly False.
label: Refuted

522,000 living in Connecticut, could lose their health care coverage if the Trump administration and Republicans in Congress are successful.		

Did Donald trump try or succeed introducing bills to help those with pre existing conditions and health insurance?		
While lawmakers from both sides of the aisle have been on record objecting to any elimination of protections for patients with pre-existing conditions, the administration’s proposal to extend short-term health insurance plans that are inadequate for someone diagnosed with a serious illness such as cancer would reintroduce discrimination based on health history,		

Did any of trumps proposals offer health insurances to those with pre existing health conditions?		
plans that do not cover pre-existing conditions, nor the essential health care benefits. I'm going to offer right now a unanimous consent request to proceed to the immediate consideration of this bill … let me start with a request to bring this legislation that will protect people with pre-existing conditions and the essential health care benefits to the floor.”		

Does the Trump administration want to remove protections for people who have preexisting medical conditions?		
Finally, the Trump budget would weaken consumer protections for people with private coverage such as by allowing states to eliminate key protections for people with pre-existing conditions.

The World Health Organisation (WHO) estimates that four percent of Nigerians suffer from depression. However this is an estimate.

40,000.

Estimated 200.9 Million.

claim: The physician to patient ratio in Nigeria of one doctor to every 4,000 to 5,000 patients is six times smaller than the World Health Organisation's recommendation of one physician to every 600 patients.
evi:
Has WHO recommended a doctor to patient ratio ?		
The agency had not prescribed any ideal ratio of healthcare workers to population.

he concept of a healthcare worker to population ratio appears to have leapt out of the 2004 findings of the Joint Learning Initiative, a Harvard University-backed network of global health leaders. The report suggested that a density of 2.5 workers per 1,000 people would help reduce deaths of children and mothers. But it did not set this as a general healthcare staffing goal.

(page 13)
label: Refuted

It has an abysmal lack of mental health services in the country

claim: By 2018 only 3.95% of Nigeria's budget for funding the country's ministry of health had been allocated.
evi:

some N356.45 billion was allocated to the health ministry.

The allocated amount works out to 3.91% of the allocated budget, according to the country’s budget office.

claim: Donald Trump  put a stop to  Millionaires being eligible for the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP), commonly known as food stamps in the US.
evi:
What changes were made to the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program by Donald Trump		
To confer automatic eligibility for SNAP under the proposal, a household must receive TANF-funded cash or non-cash benefits valued at a minimum of $50 per month for at least 6 months. In addition, non-cash benefits that could convey automatic eligibility would be restricted to subsidized employment, work supports, or childcare. By establishing clear standards and requiring that benefits be ongoing and substantial, the proposal will ensure SNAP benefits go toward Americans most in need.		

what would this proposed rule fix		
The proposed rule would fix a loophole that has expanded SNAP recipients in some states to include people who receive assistance when they clearly don’t need it. In fact, the depth of this specific flexibility has become so egregious that a millionaire living in Minnesota successfully enrolled in the program simply to highlight the waste of taxpayer money. This proposal gives USDA the ability to save billions of dollars, ensuring nutrition assistance programs are delivered with consistency and integrity to those most in need.		

Who does the head of the Department of Agriculture report to?		
It is headed by the Secretary of Agriculture, who reports directly to the President of the United States and is a member of the president's Cabinet.
label: Supported

claim: Nigeria has the highest rate of depression within the continent of Africa.
evi:
Does Nigeria have the highest rate of depression in Africa?		
Using figures from 2016, Nigeria had the largest amount of people suffering with depression - 7,079,815. However as a percentage of Nigerian population this was 3.9%.  Therefore Nigeria did not have the highest percentage rate of depression in Africa. Cape Verde, for example had a rate of 4.9%.		

What was Nigeria's depression rate in 2016?		
3.9%		

What was Cape Verde's depression rate in 2016?		
4.9%		

What was Botswana's depression rate in 2016?		
4.7%
label: Refuted

claim: Nigeria has a population of 200 million and there are less than 150 psychiatrists in the country.
evi:
How many registered psychiatrists are there in Kenya?		
According to the Association of Psychiatrists in Nigeria, there are 250 psychiatrists registered and 200 psychiatry trainees.		

How many registered psychiatrists were there in Nigeria at the time of the claim (2019)?		
According to the Association of Psychiatrists in Nigeria,  there were 250 psychiatrists registered in 2019.		

What was the population of Nigeria at the time of the claim (2019)?		
Nigeria’s population stood at an all-time high of 201 million in 2019.
label: Refuted

claim: Every week in Nigeria, twelve doctors leave to seek employment in the United Kingdom.
evi:
How are doctors from other countries recorded in the UK?		
The General Medical Council is responsible for registering doctors and setting professional standards for all doctors working or training in the UK. Its registry does not make explicit whether doctors are from a country other than the UK or when they arrived in the UK, but does record the “place they were awarded their main medical degree”		

What does the registry say about primary medical qualifications obtained from Nigeria?		
The number of doctors whose primary medical qualifications were obtained from Nigeria rose by 1,742 – from 5,250 to 6,974 in those 18 months. This means that on average 22 Nigeria-trained doctors were added to the doctors’ registry every week.		

When did at least 12 Nigerian doctors get employed in the UK every week		
So far in 2018, 190 Nigerians have received their UK licenses, bringing the number to 5,250, or an average of 12 every week.		

Has the number of doctors gaining licenses to practice in the UK been increasing		
Another 998 Nigerian doctors were added to the register between 2010 and 2015, an average of almost 200 doctors annually. In 2016, the number rose to 245 doctors, and in 2017, the number almost doubled as 439 Nigerian doctors received their UK licenses, making it a total of 5,060 Nigerian doctors in the country.
label: Refuted

claim: The government should distribute multivitamins, vitamin c and zinc tablets to the common people as it will cure people of coronavirus and to those people who don't have the disease, they will get immune to the disease.
evi:
Can multivitamins, zinc etc.be taken to cure or prevent coronavirus (Covid 19)		
The (World health organisation (WHO) state on their website that , FACT: Vitamin and mineral supplements cannot cure COVID-19		

Can multivitamins, zinc etc.be taken to cure or prevent coronavirus (Covid 19)		
The official World health organisation  (WHO) official web site further states, Micronutrients, such as vitamins D and C and zinc, are critical for a well-functioning immune system and play a vital role in promoting health and nutritional well-being.  There is currently no guidance on the use of micronutrient supplements as a treatment of COVID-19.		

What is the function of the World Health Organisation (WHO)?		
The WHO is an organisation that issues conditional recommendations even when the quality of evidence may not be strong on issues of public health importance
label: Refuted

claim: Donald Trump says his impeachment is a coup.
evi:
What does Trump mean by coup?		
A coup d'état, French for 'stroke of state', also known as a coup or overthrow.		

What is a coup d'etat?		
a seizure and removal of a government and its powers. Typically, it is an illegal seizure of power by a political faction, rebel group, military, or a dictator		

What is a coup d'etat?		
We define a coup d'état as the sudden and irregular (i.e., illegal or extra-legal) removal, or displacement, of the executive authority of an independent government.		

What is impeachment?		
1. to charge with a crime or misdemeanor
specifically : to charge (a public official) before a competent tribunal with misconduct in office.
2. to cast doubt on
especially : to challenge the credibility or validity of		

Does the American Constitution explicitly cover the impeachment process?		
Yes, The impeachment provisions of the Constitution were derived from English practice.
label: Refuted

claim: The most serious violent and sexual offenders receive automatic early release from prison halfway through their sentence.
evi:
What are the standard terms of a custodial sentence in the UK?		
A determinate prison sentence is where the court sets a fixed length for the prison sentence and is the most common type of prison sentence. For example, an offender may be sentenced to four years in prison. This is the maximum period of time the offender could spend in prison. However, the offender will not necessarily spend the whole of this time in prison.

The rules governing when a prisoner is released vary depending on the length of the sentence and when the offence was committed.		

How much time would be spent in prison under a standard determinate sentence?		
Offenders sentenced to two years or more will serve half their sentence in prison and serve the rest of the sentence in the community on licence.  While on licence an offender will be subject to supervision and the licence will include conditions. If an offender breaches their conditions, they may be recalled to prison.		

Can judges hand down extended custodial sentences?		
Yes, These sentences were introduced to provide extra protection to the public in certain types of cases where the court has found that the offender is dangerous and an extended licence period is required to protect the public from risk of harm. The judge decides how long the offender should stay in prison and also fixes the extended licence period up to a maximum of eight years. The offender will either be entitled to automatic release at the two thirds point of the custodial sentence or be entitled to apply for parole at that point.		

What offences can draw an extended sentence?		
There are well over 100 serious offences that can carry an extended sentence including specified sexual offences.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Pretty Little Thing’s terms and conditions state that its products may contain chemicals that can cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm.
evi:
Does Pretty Little Thing's products contain lead		
Pretty Little Thing warns that some products such as wallets, handbags, purses, clutches, clothing, jewellery or shoes made of vinyl or imitation leather may contain traces of lead.		

Can high amount of lead cause cancer		
There have been several agencies and organizations both in the United States and internationally that have reviewed studies and made an assessment about whether lead can cause cancer.

The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has determined that lead and lead compounds are reasonably anticipated to be human carcinogens
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has classified lead as a probable human carcinogen.
The International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) has determined that inorganic lead is probably carcinogenic to humans, and that there is insufficient information to determine whether organic lead compounds will cause cancer in humans.
