50	New Jersey		

Does West Virginia position in the U.S national highway system affirms all the hard work by Governor Jim Justice on the states roads?		
Justice has a point about the overall number, but his celebratory tone is somewhat exaggerated. Most of the data reflects a period before he became governor, and a major reason for the increase came from the elimination of a category from the previous year’s report in which West Virginia ranked 50th nationally.
label: Supported

claim: The 5G radiation is bad for humans.
evi:
Has there been any testing of 5G on humans?		
Yes, There has been research on exposure to radio frequencies over the years.		

Are all radio frequencies the same?		
Yes, Higher frequency waves come from x-rays, uv rays and gamma rays, and are ionising and can damage DNA in humans.		

Are all radio frequencies the same?		
Yes, Lower frequency waves, like the radio waves of mobiles are non-ionising radiation, and don't damage DNA.		

What type of radiation is 5g?		
5g is non-ionising radiation, like 4g and 3g.		

Is there any evidence that non-ionising radiation, like 5g can harm humans?		
No, There is no convincing evidence that exposure to the radio waves of 5G can have any adverse health effects.
label: Refuted

claim: Donald Trump's fuel efficiency plan would reduce the cost of cars “by more than $3000” and make them “substantially safer.”
evi:
What is the aim of Donald Trumps Fuel efficacy plan?		
The aim is to amend certain existing
Corporate Average Fuel Economy
(CAFE) and tailpipe carbon dioxide
emissions standards for passenger cars
and light trucks and establish new
standards,		

Will the fuel efficacy plan reduce the cost of a car?		
a $2,340 reduction in total ownership costs on a 2030 vehicle. That includes $1,850 less for technology costs — or how much the car’s price would fall		

Will Trumps efficiency plan make cars safer?		
Regulatory provisions fully offset this effect, producing a near zero change in accident fatalities.
label: Refuted

claim: A 5G test in the Netherlands resulted in the death of 297 birds.
evi:
Were there any 5g tests taking place around the time of the birds deaths?		
This is not the case. 5G has not been tested in the vicinity of the park. (translated)		

Were the birds tested to find the cause of death?		
esearchers at the Natural History Museum in Rotterdam and Wageningen University did autopsies on 15 of the starlings. From the birds’ internal injuries, the researchers concluded that they had probably died from hitting objects (possibly the ground, tree branches or each other) at great force.

The exact reason why the birds hit the objects is not known, but the university suggested that it may have been caused by panic due to a hunting owl or another disturbance.

The university confirmed that the official cause of death was bleeding as a result of trauma, but that tests also found traces of a toxin from the seeds of a berry starlings are known to eat. But it’s not known if the toxins played a part in their death.
label: Refuted

claim: President Trump wanted the USA to buy Greenland from Denmark.
evi:
Is Greenland for sale?		
Greenland is not for sale and U.S. President Donald Trump’s idea of buying the semi-autonomous Danish territory in the Arctic from Denmark is “an absurd discussion,” Denmark’s prime minister said.		

Did Trump show an interest in the USA acquiring Greenland?		
Yes, Although no official offers were made he had put the idea out there.
label: Supported

claim: In the US, medical bills drive half a million people into bankruptcy every year.
evi:
What study was the value of the statistic gotten from		
From a study titled Medical Bankruptcy: Still Common Despite the Affordable Care Act		

Has the study been peer-reviewed and accepted by the scientific community		
It has not been peer reviewed		

In the non business bankruptcy filings for the time period, were medical bills the sole cause of bankruptcy listed on 500,000 cases?		
No. Bankruptcies typically involve multiple causes, and in some cases, medical bills may be a small piece of the pie. Sanders glosses over those nuances, stating that health-care costs drove people to bankruptcy in all 500,000 cases. The study he’s citing doesn’t establish that.
label: Refuted

claim: Chinese professor Zheng Yongnian gave an interview to state-run People's Daily in which he urged cutting water supplies to Hong Kong to end months of street protests in the city.
evi:
Where does Hong Kong get its water supply from?		
The local yield is inadequate to meet the fresh water demand in Hong Kong. It also fluctuates significantly and is unreliable, the difference in the quantities of local yield could be up to 200 million cubic metres. Confronted with the challenge of inadequate and unreliable local yield, Hong Kong has been importing Dongjiang (DJ) water since 1965 to meet local water demand.		

What did Chinese professor Zheng Yongnian say about the water supply to Hong Kong in relation to ongoing protests?		
No answer could be found.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: The UK has lost its measles free status just three years after the virus was eliminated.
evi:
Did the WHO ever announce that the UK had eliminated the measles virus		
The WHO listed the UK among 42 other countries that had eliminated the virus s of 2016		

Does "eliminated" mean that there were no cases of the measles virus in the year it was declared		
WHO defines measles elimination as the absence of circulating measles, in the presence of high vaccine coverage, along with good systems to identify cases of the disease. In countries that have eliminated measles, measles can still occur, but these will be isolated cases that only have limited spread within the community.		

Has the WHO removed the UK from the list of countries that were measles free		
In 2019, WHO determined that the UK could no longer be consider as ‘eliminated’ and that transmission of measles had been re-established.
label: Supported

claim: Trump has challenged Nevada’s new state election law - that requires mail-in ballots to be sent to all active voters amid the coronavirus pandemic - in court. Nevada’s Republican Secretary of State has asked the judge to dismiss the Trump lawsuit.
evi:
Did Donald Trump file a lawsuit challenging Nevada’s new election law that would require mail-in ballots to be sent to all active voters during the coronavirus pandemic?		
Yes, Plaintiffs Donald J. Trump for President, Inc., the Republican National Committee and Nevada Republican Party filed a lawsuit on 8th August 2020.		

Did the Nevada Republican Secretary of State, Barbara Cegavske, ask a judge to dismiss the lawsuit filed by Donald Trump against Nevada’s new mail-in ballot law?		
Yes, In a court filing Monday, Cegavske’s attorneys asked a judge to dismiss the lawsuit and contended that the lawsuit addresses a policy debate that should occur outside of a courtroom. The filing also said the Trump campaign and Republicans who filed the suit don’t have legal standing to make their argument and don’t explain how they’d be harmed by changes in the law.
label: Supported

claim: Former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill said, 'Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen'.
evi:
When did Winston Churchill say, 'Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen'.		
This quote is very often attributed to Churchill but appears nowhere in the Churchill canon.		

What does the International Churchill Society say about this quote?		
This quote is very often attributed to Churchill but appears nowhere in the Churchill canon.
label: Refuted

claim: Andrew Jackson said “One man with courage makes a majority.”
evi:
Who is Andrew Jackson?		
Andrew Jackson was the seventh U.S president and considered the founder of the democratic party.		

Where does the quote, "One man with courage makes a majority.” likely originate?		
James Parton's 1860 biography of Andrew Jackson, said "desperate courage makes one a majority" on the title page. It was not intended to be interpreted as Jackson's words.		

Is there any evidence Andrew Jackson said "One man with courage makes a majority.”		
No, There is no evidence that he said that quote at all.
label: Refuted

claim: Pennsylvania just opened up a $10 billion plant, during the presidency of Donald Trump, this would never normally have happened because they wouldn't have allowed them to frack.
evi:
Is there a $10 billion plant in  Pennyslvania?		
Yes, Shell is building a chemical plant that coverts natural gas to plastic products.		

What date was this plant approved and completed?		
It was announced by Shell in 2012 and the decision was completed in June 2016.		

Was this during Donald Trump's presidency?		
No, The plant predates Donald Trump's presidency.
label: Refuted

claim: TRUMP SAID Earlier this month, the U.S. government officially labeled China for the first time ever a currency manipulator — another promise kept.
evi:
What is currency manipulation		
Currency manipulation involves the artificial movement of a domestic currency valuation through government intervention such as by printing more money or buying and selling other currencies on the foreign exchange market.		

When did Donald Trump make the statement		
15th August, 2019		

Which U.S. government agency officially labeled China a currency manipulator		
The United States Treasury		

Was 2019 the first time China was designated as a currency manipulator		
No answer could be found.
label: Supported

claim: TRUMP said If he was a great president (barack Obama), how come he left me 138 judges to appoint when everybody said that’s the single most important thing a president of the United States has to do?
evi:
How many judge Vacancies were there when Donald Trump took office?		
112
label: Refuted

claim: "wealthy people in Canada donate to hospitals" to get better health care treatment.
evi:
Do Canadian hospitals award special privileges to wealthy donors		
No, Giving preferential treatment in Canada on the basis of donations would be violating the federal Canada Health Act		

Do Canadian hospitals award special privileges to wealthy donors		
The basics, however, remain the same--universal coverage for medically necessary health care services provided on the basis of need, rather than the ability to pay.
label: Refuted

claim: Robert Sweet, a federal judge who was overseeing a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein was killed.
evi:
How did Robert Sweet die?		
Robert W. Sweet, who as Mayor John V. Lindsay’s top deputy worked to end some of the most rancorous conflicts in 1960s New York, and who as a longtime federal judge struck down a state ban on begging on the streets, died of natural causes on Sunday in Ketchum, Idaho. He was 96.		

How did Robert Sweet die?		
Of natural causes at his home in Ketchum, Idaho. He was 96.
label: Refuted

claim: The push by Assembly Democrats seeking Americans with Disabilities Act accommodations for a lawmaker were timed to make Vos look bad.
evi:
Who is 'vos' that the claim refers to?		
Wisconsin Assembly Speaker Robin Vos, Republican for Rochester		

What accommodations for a lawmaker were democrats looking to peruse under the Americans with Disabilities Act?		
They were urging Assembly speaker to allow paralyzed lawmaker to call in to meetings		

How could this accommodation request impact Robin Vos?		
On July 29, 2019 vos had said he thinks it is "disrespectful for someone to be asking questions over a microphone or a speakerphone.		

When did democrats launce a bid to have accommodations made for a disabled lawmaker?		
Aug. 8, 2019		

What were the accommodations asked for by the democrats?		
to accommodate his request to call into meetings by phone.		

What date did he ask for this accomodation?		
Aug. 8, 2019		

When did vos make his remarks about it being disrespectful to 'call into meetings''?		
July 29, 2019:
label: Refuted

claim: Professor HC Verma still drives an old scooter.
evi:
Who is Professor HC Verma?		
HC Verma is an Indian experimental physicist and a retired professor of Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology.		

What did Professor HC Verma respond to the social media claim that he still drives an old scooter?		
On his Facebook page, the professor wrote:
A scooter photo is also shown in the post. I never had a scooter of this colour and make.
label: Refuted

claim: Eminent Physics professor HC Verma donates Rs 1 crore to PM relief fund and for charity.
evi:
Does Professor HC Verma donate RS 1 crore to the PM relief fund and charity?		
No, Dear Friends, I came to know about atwitter post telling that I earn 1 crore of royalty and donate the whole money to PM relief fund. I wish I could do that.
I wish to categorically deny the information.
label: Refuted

claim: Professor HC Verma,  gets Rs 1 cr as royalty per year for his book "'Concepts of Physics'
evi:
How much does Professor Verma get as royalty for his book		
The professor stated on his Facebook page that he does not get 1Cr royalty on his books
label: Refuted

claim: The "boyfriend loophole" means that "if you commit a serious crime of domestic abuse against your wife, you can't get a gun, but if you do it against your girlfriend, you can.
evi:
How does federal law define domestic violence?		
the term “misdemeanor crime of domestic violence” means an offense that—
(i)is a misdemeanor under Federal, State, or Tribal [3] law; and
(ii)has, as an element, the use or attempted use of physical force, or the threatened use of a deadly weapon, committed by a current or former spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim, by a person with whom the victim shares a child in common, by a person who is cohabiting with or has cohabited with the victim as a spouse, parent, or guardian, or by a person similarly situated to a spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim.		

Does the gun prohibition in federal law apply to domestic violence committed in more casual boyfriend/girlfriend relationships or people who were merely dating?		
No, there is no mention of a more casual relationship in federal law.		

Does state law exist that broadens the definition of domestic violence?		
States have closed the gaps in federal law pertaining to people who commit misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence by enacting laws that:

Prohibit domestic violence misdemeanants not covered by federal law from buying or possessing guns and/or ammunition.
Authorize or require courts to order people convicted of domestic violence misdemeanors to relinquish their guns and/or ammunition		

Does every state have state law that broadens the definition of 'domestic violence'?		
No. Multiple states have no such law.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: CNN's Chris Cuomo exploded at a man who called him fredo.
evi:
Was Chris Cuomo referred to as a Fredo		
On Tuesday, video surfaced of CNN anchor Chris Cuomo losing it after some guy (reportedly a Trump supporter) called him as “Fredo” on Sunday, in a reference to a character from the Godfather series		

What was his reaction for being called Fredo		
He exploded and threatened to use violence
label: Supported

claim: Would Florida assault weapon law amendment proposal ban virtually all guns?
evi:
What does the Florida gun law amendment propose?		
BAWN’s proposal defines assault weapons more broadly than past definitions. Instead of listing design features to designate the banned weapons, the question describes assault weapons as “semiautomatic rifles and shotguns capable of holding more than 10 rounds of ammunition at once, either in a fixed or detachable magazine, or any other ammunition-feeding device.” This definition expands on several existing state laws by including weapons that can accept large-capacity detachable magazines, which are typically what make assault weapons so lethal.

BAWN’s assault-weapons ban, which exempts military or law-enforcement members, would make possession of the defined weapons a third-degree felony. It would also give Floridians who already own these weapons a year to register them before their possession becomes illegal.
label: Refuted

claim: Britons have spent £4bn stockpiling goods in case of no-deal Brexit.
evi:
what is the total population of the UK		
total adult population of the UK being just over 52 million.		

Did Britons stockpile supplies in anticipation of a no deal Brexit?		
Yes, A survey carried out by finance provider Premium Credit shows that 17% of the country has started hoarding food, drink and medicine – with about 2.4 million people having spent more than £500 stockpiling.		

How much did Brits spend stockpiling before Brexit?		
Brits spent over £4.6 billion at Brexit stockpiling peaks		

Were any adverse effects due to stockpiling noted?		
Brexit-related stockpiling was also hitting cashflow, according to Premium Credit, which was increasing pressure on businesses and households to rely more on credit to make purchases.		

Can the 4.6 billion be accurately attributed to stockpiling?		
A survey carried out by finance provider Premium Credit shows that 17% of the country has started hoarding food, drink and medicine – with about 2.4 million people having spent more than £500 stockpiling.

A further 6.1 million have spent up to £500 while one in five, or 19%, have spent over £1,000 on hoarding.		

What is the population of the UK at the time of the claim?		
66,778,659
label: Supported

claim: U.S. Attorney General William Barr made a secret visit to the Manhattan jail where Jeffrey Epstein was being held just two weeks before the accused sex trafficker was found dead in his cell
evi:
Did the U.S Attorney General William Barr make a secret visit to the Manhattan Jail where  Jeffrey Epstein was being held		
Justice Department spokeswoman Kerri Kupec told Lead Stories:

The claim is preposterous. In fact, Attorney General Barr has never visited MCC. (And as a reminder, he has 24/7 FBI protective detail, which means they would have had to be there, as well
label: Refuted

claim: Attorney General William Barr visited the prison where accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein was being held.
evi:
Did Attorney General William Barr visit prison where sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein was being held?		
No, This story has been updated to remove references to a purported visit to the MCC by Attorney General William Barr because the source of the information did not have direct knowledge that the visit took place.		

Why was William Barr in New York City on July 23rd?		
Attorney General William P. Barr Delivers Keynote Address at the International Conference on Cyber Security.		

Is there any evidence to show that Barr paid Epstein a visit in prison?		
No, The only 'evidence' is a quote from the claim origin: Lewis Kasman.		

Who is Lewis Kasman?		
Lewis Kasman, who thought of himself as an “adopted son” of John Gotti, allegedly ran Albie Trimming Co., which supplied zippers, linings, and buttons to garment industry companies, as a front for the Gambino Mafia family’s control over the Seventh Avenue trucking industry.[2] However, Mr. Kasman recently turned state’s evidence as part of a federal 80-count indictment that charged 62 alleged mobsters with racketeering, theft of union benefits, and money laundering in connection.
label: Refuted

claim: In the weeks following El Paso and Dayton, evidence of an impending mass shooting spread on Snapchat and iMessage.
evi:
Are the mass shooting messages spreading on Snapchat and iMessage after El Paso and Dayton based on credible information?		
RUMOR ADDRESSED: Does this text message look familiar to you?

The Savanah Police Department has received word from some concerned citizens that this message is floating around through text message and on social media warning that a police officer claimed there could be shootings in Walmarts and are warning people not to go to these businesses. We are aware of the message, and after speaking with other law enforcement agencies we have learned that the message is floating around throughout the entire state and others as well. This message has not been determined to be a credible threat in the Savannah area, and appears to be the results of a wild internet rumor. Please be cautious of any social media rumors, and always bring them to law enforcement attention so that we can determine if there are any existing threats. Thank you to all who brought their concerns to the police department!		

Are the mass shooting messages spreading on Snapchat and iMessage after El Paso and Dayton based on credible information?		
Warsaw Police Department
  · 
PLEASE PEOPLE STOP SHARING MISINFORMATION !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Messages like the one shown here are popping up in social media news feeds everywhere. As of today local law enforcement has no information regarding any plans by individuals or groups to target any of the Wal-Marts in our area.		

What happened in the El Paso mass shooting?		
Police in El Paso, a large city on the Mexico-US border, first received reports of gunshots at 10:39 local time (16:39 GMT) on Saturday.

A gunman had opened fire with an assault-style rifle in a crowded Walmart on the city's east side. Nearby businesses were placed on lockdown and shoppers were evacuated.

The store is near a retail park, the Cielo Vista Mall, which is popular with El Paso residents as well as shoppers from just across the Mexican border.

In addition to the 22 fatalities, 24 people were injured in the shooting. Eight Mexican nationals were among the dead and the victims' ages range from 15 to 90.

Officers arrived on the scene within six minutes and the attacker surrendered after he was confronted by police outside the store.		

What happened in the Dayton mass shooting?		
Hours later, almost 1,600 miles away in Dayton, Ohio, shooting began at 01:07 local time (05:07 GMT) on Sunday in an area popular for its nightlife.

Security camera footage shows dozens of people racing through the doorway of the local Ned Peppers nightclub on E 5th Street. Nine people were killed and 27 were injured.

Just seconds later, the gunman is seen running towards the venue and being hit by police gunfire as he reaches the door. Police have confirmed they killed the gunman at the scene within 30 seconds of him opening fire.

Had the gunman made it through the door, Dayton Police Chief Richard Biehl said, the loss of life would have been "catastrophic".

The suspect, 24-year-old Connor Betts, used a .223-calibre assault rifle with high-capacity magazines that he had ordered legally from Texas. There was nothing in his history that would have stopped him from buying the gun legally, police said.
label: Refuted

claim: Jean Monnet said a European superstate should be created without the understanding of European people.
evi:
Did Jean Monnet say that a European superstate should be created without the understanding of European people?		
No evidence		

Did Jean Monnet say that a European superstate should be created without the understanding of European people?		
No answer could be found.		

Did Jean Monnet say that a European superstate should be created without the understanding of European people?		
The quote is often mis ascribed to Jean Monnet — in fact it is a paraphrase of a characterization of Monnet's intentions by British Conservative Adrian Hilton:		

Did Jean Monnet show any similar feelings towards a European superstrate than what is claimed in the apparent quote?		
Monnet is reported to have expressed somewhat similar sentiments, but without the notion of intentional deception,
label: Refuted

claim: Donald Trump said that he 'did criminal justice reform, which President Obama could not get approved...'
evi:
How did Trump reform criminal justice system?		
The FIRST STEP Act is consequential because it includes provisions for meaningful sentencing reform, which would reduce the number and amount of people in prison and is part of the starting point of any serious legislation for criminal justice reform.		

Did Obama pass legislation reforming the justice system?		
Yes, President Obama signed a bill reducing the disparity in penalties for the use of crack and powder cocaine. 
The enactment of the law sealed a hard-fought victory for civil rights activists who have argued for years that the differing punishments unfairly target African-Americans.
label: Refuted

claim: Democratic Republicans  Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar have vowed to take benefits like Social Security and Medicare away from senior citizens.
evi:
Did the Democratic Republicans Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar have vowed to take benefits like Social Security and Medicare away from senior citizens?		
No, The claim may originate with a satirical article published on Daily World Update, a parody news website that describes itself as part of a network that publishes “parody, satire, and tomfoolery.”
label: Refuted

claim: Olive Garden restaurant chain  are funding trumps 2020 campaign.
evi:
Has restaurant chain Olive Garden made any donations to Donal Trumps 2020 campaign?		
Olive Tree have tweeted themselves denying the claim.		

Has restaurant chain Olive Garden made any donations to Donal Trumps 2020 campaign?		
There are no records showing for Darden which is the parent company for Olive Garden any donations made to the Trump Campaign from the organization itself.		

Who can contribute and donate to political campaigns?		
Campaigns are prohibited from accepting contributions from certain types of organizations and individuals. These prohibited sources are:

Corporations, including nonprofit corporations (although funds from a corporate separate segregated fund are permissible)
Labor organizations (although funds from a separate segregated fund are permissible)
Federal government contractors
Foreign nationals
Contributions in the name of another		

Who can contribute and donate to political campaigns?		
Organizations themselves cannot contribute to candidates and party committees so therefore the organization cannot donate itself, but the organization's PACs, their individual members or employees or owners, and those individuals' immediate family members.
label: Refuted

claim: Abortion is never medically necessary.
evi:
What is an abortion?		
Abortion, the medical or surgical termination of a pregnancy,  one of the oldest, most common, and most controversial medical procedures.		

Are abortions safe?		
When undertaken by a trained health-care provider in sanitary conditions, abortions are one of the safest medical procedures available, safer even than child birth.		

Can an abortion be medically necessary?		
abortions are virtually always performed for the most serious medical and health reasons, including saving the woman’s life.
label: Refuted

claim: The Nigerian Embassy in The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) has been ejected from its premises.
evi:
What is the date of the claim?		
8th August 2019.		

Was the Nigerian Embassy in The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) ejected from its premises around August 2019?		
Ferdinard Nwonye, a spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said in an interview in Abuja on Friday 9th August 2019, 

“The Nigerian Embassy in the Democratic Republic of Congo was not shut down.
label: Refuted

claim: Social Security beneficiaries count on the US post office to get their checks.
evi:
How do most social security beneficiaries receive their checks		
As of June 1 2013, nearly 98 percent of Social Security beneficiaries and over 92 percent of SSI recipients receive their benefit payment electronically		

How do most social security beneficiaries receive their checks		
As of March 1, 2013, the Department of the Treasury was requiring that all beneficiaries receive their Social Security benefits by electronic funds transfer (EFT) unless they met an exemption to this requirement.
label: Refuted

claim: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has suffered a massive stroke.
evi:
Has Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg suffered a massive stroke?		
No, ...a closer inspection of the account reveals that it is not actually from Fox News. It has the wrong Twitter handle – @FoxChannel rather than @FoxNews – and lacks a blue check mark, which notes that the account has been verified by Twitter.

The Caller confirmed with a Fox News spokesperson that the company did not tweet this out, and the account, which noted that it was satirical in its bio, has since been suspended by Twitter.
label: Refuted

claim: White supremacy is a hoax and "not a real problem in America."
evi:
Has white supremacists caused more deaths than any other domestic extremist group?		
Yes, According to an unclassified intelligence bulletin from May 2017, from 2000 to 2016, white supremacists killed more people than any other domestic extremist movement. (This excludes the 9/11 terror attack)		

Is White Supremacy a current threat?		
Yes, At a congressional panel hearing in April 2020, FBI Director Christopher Wray stated, "The danger, I think, of white supremacists, violent extremism or any other kind of violent extremism, is significant." "We assess that it’s a persistent, pervasive threat."
label: Refuted

claim: Plane crashes resumed after FFK’s tenure as Minister of Aviation.
evi:
When was Femi Fani Kayode's tenure as Nigerian Minister of Aviation?		
07/11/2006 to 29/05/2007		

Were there any plane crashes on Nigeria from 07/11/2006 to 29/05/2007?		
No, One helicopter crash but no plane crashes.		

When was the first plane crash in Nigeria after 29/05/2007?		
• March 15, 2008, Beechcraft 1900D plane marked 5N-JAH, belonging to Wing Aviation crashed in Cross River State. The wreckage was not found until six months after. All four crewmembers died.		

When was the first helicopter crash in Nigeria after 29/05/2007?		
August 2, 2007, Bristow-owned helicopter crashed inside ExxonMobil facility in Port Harcourt.
label: Supported

claim: There were no plane crashes during FFK’s tenure as Minister of Aviation.
evi:
when was Femi Fani Kayode a Minister of Aviation?		
He was Minister of Aviation from Nov 7th 2006 to May 29th 2007.		

How many plane crashes were there in Nigeria between November 7, 2006 and May 29 2007?		
No answer could be found.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Five plane crashes with a death toll of 453 were recorded the year before Femi Fani Kayode became Nigeria’s Minister of Aviation.
evi:
When did Femi Fani Kayode become Nigeria’s Minister of Aviation?		
Minister of Aviation from Nov 7th 2006		

How many airplane crashes occurred between January 1, 2005, and November 7, 2006?		
Oct. 22, 2005 – A Nigerian Bellview Airlines Boeing 737 airliner crashed shortly after take-off from Lagos. All 111 passengers and six crew were killed.

Dec. 10, 2005 – A Nigerian Sosoliso Airlines DC9 from Abuja crashed on landing in Port Harcourt, killing 106 people, half of them schoolchildren on their way home for Christmas.

Sept. 17, 2006 – Twelve Nigerian military personnel, mostly high-ranking officers, were killed in a plane crash in Benue state. Six survived.

Oct. 29, 2006 – An ADC airliner with 114 passengers on board crashed and burned after take-off from Abuja, killing 96 people.		

How many airplane crashes occurred between January 1, 2005, and November 7, 2006?		
•October 29, 2006: An ADC aircraft crashed when it took off from Abuja, killing 105 people on board.

•January 28, 2005: A Nigeria Air Force fighter plane crashed into a farmland in Yar Kanya, Kano State.

•February 25, 2005: ADC’s B73 aircraft had its tyre burnt while landing at Yola Airport.

•March 27, 2005: A Boeing 737 of Bellview had one of its engines caught fire.

•June 11/12, 2005: Lagos: a Boeing 727-200 aircraft belonging to the domestic Chachangi Airlines overshot the runway at Murtala Muhammed Airport, while yet another overshot the runway at the airport in Jos in central Nigeria a day earlier.

•June 24, 2005: A Russian aircraft belonging to Harka Air crash- landed at the MMA, all the people on board died

•July 6, 2005, Port Harcourt: An Air France A330 plane crashed into a herd of cattle at Port Harcourt airport, sustaining serious damage and killing many of the cows.

•July 23, 2005, a Lufthansa aircraft crash-landed at Lagos airport and was badly damaged, but no life was lost.

•October 22, 2005: A Bellview Airlines Boeing 737 with 117 people on board crashed shortly after take-off from Lagos. All on board killed.

•December 10, 2005: A Port Harcourt bound Sosoliso Airlines flight 1145 crash-landed in Port Harcourt Airport, killing 109 passengers including 60 students of Jesuit Loyola College, Abuja.		

What was the death toll in airplane crashes between January 1, 2005, and November 7, 2006?		
A total of 331 lives were lost.
label: Refuted

claim: Just like Omoyele Sowore, a Nigerian human rights activist, President Muhammadu Buhari called for a revolution in 2011.
evi:
Did president Buhari call for a revolution in 2011		
Yes, In 2011, General Muhammadu Buhari, the candidate of the Congress for Progressive Change (CPC), called for a revolution in Nigeria. 

Via a statement by Yinka Odumakin, his spokesman at the time, Buhari asked Nigerians to make exceptional sacrifices to assert their collective will in the country.		

Did president Buhari call for a revolution in 2011		
In the same statement calling for a revolution in 2011, Buhari commended the Egyptian military for refusing to attack “the forces of change”.		

Do Sowore and Buhari's call for a revolution have anything in common		
They both were aimed at making the Nigerian public rise up and stand against bad leadership
label: Supported

claim: Mental illness is main driver of mass shootings says Donald trump when talking about the shootings in Texas and Ohio that killed 31 people.
evi:
Did Donald Trump say "Mental illness is main driver of mass shootings "?		
Yes in a meeting in the White House Diplomatic room on August 5th 2019.
label: Supported

claim: Donald Trump said, "Last year - 2018, we prosecuted a record number of firearms offenses."
evi:
Is Donald Trump quoted as saying: "Last year - 2018, we prosecuted a record number of firearms offenses."		
Yes on Aug 5th 2019		

In the USA, How many people were prosecuted for firearm offenses in 2018?		
In FY 2018, the Justice Department charged more than 15,300 defendants with federal firearms offenses		

What was the previous record for the highest amount of firearms offenses being prosecuted?		
13,062 defendants charged in fiscal year 2005
label: Supported

claim: Republicans voted to allow people with pre-existing mental illness to buy firearms.
evi:
Can people with mental illness buy firearms in the U.S?		
The Gun Control Act (GCA), codified at 18 U.S.C. § 922(g), makes it unlawful for certain categories of persons to ship, transport, receive, or possess firearms or ammunition, to include any person:
- who has been adjudicated as a mental defective or has been committed to any mental institution;		

What is the definition of a 'mental defective' in the U.S?		
A determination by a court, board, commission, or other lawful authority that a person, as a result of marked subnormal intelligence, or mental illness, incompetency, condition, or disease:		

Is Donald J. Trump a member of the U.S republican party in 2019?		
Donald J. Trump is a Republican party member.		

Did Donald trump of the republican party in the U.S oppose gun control for mental defectives?		
Yes, Trump Undid an Obama Rule That Added Mentally Ill People to Gun Check Register		

Was an actual vote taken to to allow people with pre-existing mental illness to buy firearms?		
Yes, Under the rule, which the Obama administration made permanent on its way out the door, Social Security beneficiaries with psychiatric disabilities who are assigned a money manager for their disability benefits would be reported to the FBI’s background check database as people ineligible to purchase firearms. 

House Republicans voted last week to eliminate the rule, and their counterparts in the Senate are expected to follow suit.
label: Supported

claim: The common theme with mass shooters is that the assailants were on psychotropic drugs.
evi:
Is an increase in use of psychiatric medications is causing an increase of violence?		
The problem with the argument blaming medications,however, is that though there has been a signicant increase in the use of psychiatric medications, there has not been a corresponding increase in violence. In fact, just the opposite has occurred. Violent crime has decreased dramatically.		

How many shooters were on psychiatric medications — or coming off them — at the time of their attacks?		
The following data is drawn from the sample of 48 shooters profiled in my book School Shooters: Understanding High School, College, and Adult Perpetrators. Out of 24 secondary school shooters, only two were taking medication at the time of their attacks: Eric Harris and Jeffrey Weise. Alvaro Castillo might have been, or he may have stopped his medication within three weeks of his attack and thus still have been coming off the drug. If we include him, then 12.5% of the sample was taking medications. Put differently, over 87% of the secondary school shooters were not on psychiatric medications at the time of their attacks. Furthermore, there is no evidence that medication made Harris, Weise, or Castillo manic or psychotic. The numbers are essentially the same for the college and adult shooters.
label: Refuted

claim: AG William Barr Tweets Odds Of Mass Shootings In Hometowns Of 2 Democrat Presidential Candidates Are 250 Billion To 1
evi:
Did Attorney General William Barr tweet that the odds were 250 Billion to 1 against mass shootings happening in  the hometowns of both Democratic presidential candidates, in the same weekend ?		
No, There is no evidence that William Barr tweeted this information. The tweet was fake.
label: Refuted

claim: Geckos carry pathogenic bacteria in their mouths which are very toxic to humans.
evi:
Are geckos harmful to humans?		
Wild caught geckos may have different types of bacteria in their oral cavities than captive-hatched ones.

They can, however, carry potentially dangerous bacteria, protozoa or, rarely, a pathogenic fungus that can be transmitted to a human via a bite that punctures the skin.		

Are geckos harmful to humans?		
A dangerous Salmonella outbreak in 16 states has been linked to pet geckos, according to a new report by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.		

Are geckos harmful to humans?		
There are plenty of myths and superstitions around this creature and many people are scared of these creatures for no good reason. In-fact it is a timid and shy creature which is more scared of you than you are of it. It does not pose any threat to humans.

 H. frenatus is non toxic and does not bite.

It is not known to transmit any kind of infections or diseases to humans.

Coming in contact with a gecko does not cause any kind of skin infections.
Coming in contact with its faeces or urine also does not cause any harm, although it should be avoided from a hygienic point of view.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Police stopped a mass shooting in Omaha, NE, in early August 2019
evi:
Was there a mass shooting in Omaha, Nebraska, in August 2019?		
No answer could be found.		

What is the list of mass shootings that have happened in Omaha, Nebraska?		
Dec. 5, 2007 —Omaha, Nebraska. Robert A. Hawkins killed eight people and himself using a semiautomatic rifle after entering the Westroads Mall.		

Where did the claim originate from?		
City News		

When and where was the City News domain registered ?		
2019-06-14 
Guangdong, CN		

Why is City News deemed to be a unreliable and inauthentic source for news based on registeration date?		
Many sites will hide any personal information used in the registration process, but a WhoIs search should always return the date a site was created. If a website is much, much younger than it claims to be, the chances are that it was set up to spread fake news stories.
label: Refuted

claim: Police stopped a mass shooting in Des Moines, IA, in early August 2019
evi:
Where was this claim made?		
A website called City News published this article claiming that the Omaha Police Department had "foiled a mass shooting plot by a 32-year old man.		

Where was this claim made?		
A website called City News published this article claiming that the Omaha Police Department had "foiled a mass shooting plot by a 32-year old man."		

Does the Omaha Police Department have any records of this event?		
No answer could be found.		

Is the news site legitimate?		
No, Domain records show that the City News website was registered in China last month for a period of one year — a telltale sign that the site is bogus.
label: Refuted

claim: President Buhari approves the creation of state police.
evi:
Has President Buhari approved the creation of state police?		
No, Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari 'clearly stated' on Monday that he had not given approval for a state or local government to establish their own police force.
label: Refuted

claim: "in a city of almost 700,000, we had five murders the entire year. Our average over the last 10 years is 18 (murders per year). We exceeded that average just on one day" after a gunman opened fire at a Walmart in the city.
evi:
How many murders has there been in El Passo in the last 10 years?		
El Paso that some years, "in a city of almost 700,000, we had five murders the entire year. Our average over the last 10 years is 18 (murders per year). We exceeded that average just on one day" after a gunman opened fire at a Walmart in the city.		

How many people were murdered in the ElPaso shooting referred to in the claim?		
The death toll in the El Paso Walmart shooting has risen to 22 after two people died at a hospital.		

How much was the average murders in ElPaso between 2009 and 2019?		
For the past ten years (2009 – 2018) El Paso has averaged sixteen (16) Murders per year. During the past
five years (2014 – 2018) El Paso has averaged eighteen (18) Murders per year.		

When did ElPaso have only 5 murders per year?		
1964 and 2010		

How many people lived in ElPaso in 2019?		
The population on 1st of April 2020 was 678,815.
label: Supported

claim: Social media videos claim that Clearblue pregnancy tests contain a type of morning-after pill called Plan B.
evi:
Do Clearblue pregnancy tests contain a "plan b " pill?		
No, Clearblue have made a notice on their website stating:

We are aware of videos circulating about Clearblue pregnancy tests and the tablet found inside.
Clearblue pregnancy tests do NOT contain Plan B.
All our tests contain a small desiccant tablet which is included to absorb moisture and should not be eaten.
If accidentally ingested please seek medical advice and for any further questions contact our careline at 1-800-321-3279		

What did Clearblue say about this claim		
We are aware of videos about Clearblue pregnancy tests and the tablet inside. Clearblue tests do NOT contain Plan B. All our tests contain a desiccant tablet to absorb moisture
label: Refuted

claim: So far in 2019, the United States has had 249 mass shootings, while Mexico had three, New Zealand, the Netherlands, Brazil and Canada had one, and many other countries had none.
evi:
What is the definition of "mass shooting" in the US?		
According to a Congressional Research Service report dated 18/03/2013:
There is no broadly agreed-to, specific conceptualization of this issue, so this report uses its own definition for public mass shootings. These are incidents occurring in relatively public places,
involving four or more deaths—not including the shooter(s)—and gunmen who select victims
somewhat indiscriminately. The violence in these cases is not a means to an end—the gunmen do
not pursue criminal profit or kill in the name of terrorist ideologies, for example.		

What is the definition of "mass shooting" in the US?		
Gun Violence Archive uses a purely statistical threshold to define mass shooting based ONLY on the numeric value of 4 or more shot or killed, not including the shooter.		

How does US compare to the rest of the world in connection with mass shootings?		
According to a research paper written by John R Lott, Crime Prevention Research Center dated  November 12, 2018:

The U.S. is well below the world average in terms of the number of mass public shootings, and the global increase over time has been much bigger than for the United States.

Over the 18 years from 1998 to 2015, our list contains 2,354 attacks and at least 4,880 shooters outside the United States and 53 attacks and 57 shooters within our country. By our count, the US makes up less than 1.15% of the mass public shooters, 1.49% of their murders, and 2.20% of their attacks. All these are much less than the US’s 4.6% share of the world population. Attacks in the US are not only less frequent than other countries, but they are also much less deadly on average.		

What does the updated version dated August 11, 2020 of this paper state?		
The U.S. is well below the world average in terms of the number of mass public shootings, and the global increase over time has been much bigger than for the United States.

Over the 20 years from 1998 to 2017, our list contains 2,772 attacks and at least 5,764 shooters outside the United States and 62 attacks and 66 shooters within our country. By our count, the US makes up less than 1.13% of the mass public shooters, 1.77% of their murders, and 2.19% of their attacks. All these are much less than the US’s 4.6% share of the world population. Attacks in the US are not only less frequent than other countries, they are also much less deadly on average. Out of the 101 countries where we have identified mass public shootings occurring, the United States ranks 66th in the per capita frequency of these attacks and 56th in the murder rate.		

What definition is used in this paper for the term "mass public shootings"?		
The cases here meet FBI's traditional definition of mass public shootings.		

What are the recorded statistics of mass shootings in the US in 2015 according to the US Gun Violence Archive?		
Mass Shootings recorded as  "Number of INCIDENTS reported and verified" in 2015 were 335.		

What did the Gun Violence Archive record as the number of mass shootings in 2019?		
The number recorded in the archive was 417.		

How do other nations define "mass shooting"?		
The Flemish Peace Institute studied mass shootings in Europe in which there were at least four deaths (not including the perpetrators) and which were not carried out in the domestic sphere or were the immediate result of purely criminal activities such as an armed robbery.		

Are the definitions of "mass shooting" from various sources/locations consistent?		
No, Different organisations will filter their data differently (excluding domestic crimes or gang violence for example) leading to variation in the definition of mass shooting.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: George Washington said “It will be found an unjust and unwise jealousy to deprive a man of his natural liberty upon the supposition he may abuse it.”
evi:
When was the first instance of the quote cited		
The first instance was in 1650 by Oliver Cromwell		

Has there been a record of George Washington making the quote that has been curated by his Mount Vernon library		
There is no evidence from them that he made such a statement
label: Refuted

claim: Zomato's Sales Have  Dropped By 60% In 10 Hours
evi:
Did the Zomato's Sales in India drop by 60% In 10 hours ?.		
We searched with various keywords like 'drop in Zomato sales', 'Zomato sales down by 60%', and 'Zomato sales' and did not find a single news articles on the same. This claim is false.
label: Refuted

claim: News report claims that Ghana has been named the second most corrupt country in Africa by Transparency International (TI).
evi:
Which country is the most corrupt country in Africa?		
Somalia.		

What is the second most corrupt country in Africa?		
South Sudan.		

What rank is Ghana in terms of its overall corruption in Africa?		
41.		

How are countries ranked on their corruption?		
The index ranks 180 countries and territories by their perceived levels of public sector  corruption, according to experts and business people. It uses a scale of zero to 100, where zero is highly corrupt and 100 is very clean.
label: Refuted

claim: Telecommunications company Airtel Nigeria is giving away 500,000 iPhones.
evi:
Has the Nigerian Telecommunications company Airtel Nigeria ran a promotion where they give away free iphones?		
No the "promotion" is a scam. When asked for comment the Airtel Nigeria's customer relations released a statement saying:

“Please be informed that we currently do not have any ongoing giveaway promo on the Airtel network. Kindly disregard the information,”
label: Refuted

claim: Leaves of sweet potatoes can kill cancer.
evi:
Is sweet potato in the list of foods that can help fight cancer		
No, They are not part of them according to research

claim: Joe Biden, whilst vice president, said the Obama administration had passed the criminal justice reform bill.
evi:
Is Joe Biden quoted as saying "the Obama administration had passed the criminal justice reform bill."?		
what he said was:

“The bill he talks about is a bill that in my — our administration, we passed. We passed that bill that you added onto. That’s the bill, in fact, you passed.”
label: Supported

claim: In an op-ed, then-sen. Joe Biden wrote that he believed that women working outside the home would, quote, "create the deterioration of family." He also said that women who were working outside the home were, quote, "avoiding responsibility."
evi:
Did Joe Biden state in an op-ed that women working outside of the home were "avoiding responsibility"?		
No, Joe Biden spoke on responsibility in his op-ed wen he said, "make it easier for people who have neither the financial necessity nor personal need to forsake their responsibility to care for their own children."		

Did Joe Biden state in an op-ed that women working outside of the home would "create the deterioration of family."?		
No, Although Biden spoke about the deterioration of families, He didn't specifically say 'working women' would cause the deterioration of the family.		

Does Joe Biden oppose women working outside the home?		
No, In July 28, 1981, Joe Biden praised his wife and said "She is a career woman. She is very devoted to her career, and very concerned about it, and she has good reason to be, and I am proud of the fact that she has such a career,"

However he did add "But it is outrageous to make my father, who makes less than $20,000 a year, to pay a tax to see to it that I can put my child in a day care center. I think that is preposterous."		

What was Joe Biden's op-ed about?		
The article, written by one Joseph R. Biden, was an op-ed arguing against a tax credit that would help families pay for child care. Biden, then a senator representing Delaware, made the case that by encouraging more high-earning parents to send their kids to day care, such a tax credit would, among other things, lead to “the deterioration of the family.”
label: Refuted

claim: Rodrigo Duterte changed his position again on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic.
evi:
Has Rodrigo Duterte changed alternated his position on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic?		
Yes, May 25
The president says it is “useless” to talk about opening of classes “unless [he is] sure that [school children] are really safe":

“I will not allow the opening of classes na magdikit-dikit iyang mga bata... Bahala na hindi na makatapos...wala nang aral. Laro na lang…Para sa akin, bakuna muna.”

June 5
Still intent on waiting for a vaccine, Duterte announces that he is considering the proposal of the Department of Education (DepEd) to use teleconferencing as an alternative to face-to-face classes:

“[I]f she (Education Secretary Leonor Briones) has [the technology] or if we can afford it, we’ll buy it and...the children can continue with their education.”		

Did Rodrigo Duterte changed his position again on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic ?		
Yes, The President has earlier approved the trial run of the face-to-face classes in areas considered at low risk for COVID-19. He later said I’m calling back the order and I will not allow face-to-face classes of children until we are through with this  following the emergence of a more infectious variant of the coronavirus disease in the UK.
label: Supported

claim: The City of New York could not proceed with the case of murder of Eric Garner because the Justice Department was pursuing its prosecution.
evi:
Is there a law that prevents the city of New York making an investigation if there is a federal investigation?		
No, De Blasio also said that it was a mistake for the city to wait for federal prosecutors to finish investigating Garner’s death before the police department began disciplinary proceedings. But there is no rule requiring the NYPD to do so.		

Did other journalists point out that there was no legal requirement for the city of New York to not investigate if there was a federal request?		
Yes, Nolan Hicks of the New York Post tweeted: 'There was nothing that prevented the de Blasio administration legally from bringing the administrative charges against Daniel Pantaleo while waiting on the Justice Department. City Hall says they held off on the Justice Department's behest.'		

Did the federal prosecutors refuse to take the case of murder of Eric Garner because the Justice Department was pursuing their prosecution ?		
The NYPD could have started those proceedings years ago. In fact, it did start that process well before the Justice Department closed its civil rights investigation this year with no charges. The NYPD’s delay had a material effect, because it meant more requirements for prosecutors seeking to prove Pantaleo’s culpability.
label: Refuted

claim: Companies like Amazon that made billions in profits did not pay one nickel in federal income tax
evi:
How much federal income tax does Amazon pay?		
The tax rate for Amazon from 2012 through 2018 was 8 percent and since 2002 they have paid $3.6 billion.		

How much profit does Amazon make?		
Since 2002, Amazon has earned $27.7 billion in global pretax profits.
label: Refuted

Hickenlooper’s eight years in office.

CNBC ranked Colorado’s economy in fifth place among all states in 2019

Yes, Firearms sales are surging in the wake of the Colorado movie theater massacre

claim: 500,000 Americans are sleeping out on the street
evi:
What date was this claim made?		
30/07/2019		

What was this claim based on?		
A point-in-time survey carried out in Jan 2018.		

What were the results of the PIT survey of homelessness in the USA carried out in Jan 2018?		
On a single night in 2018, roughly 553,000 people
were experiencing homelessness in the United
States. About two-thirds (65%) were staying in
sheltered locations—emergency shelters or transitional
housing programs—and about one-third (35%) were
in unsheltered locations such as on the street, in
abandoned buildings, or in other places not suitable for
human habitation.

Did Bernie Sanders  run for election in 1988?		
In 1988, when Sanders was mayor of Burlington, he first ran for the House

In 1988 he lost.		

What does he state as the likely reason he lost his 1988 run for election?		
“In 1988, I lost an election because I said we should not have assault weapons on the streets of America.”		

Does he support a ban on the sale and distribution of assault weapons?		
I do believe that we need to ban certain types of assault weapons. Bernie said.

claim: Pinning Down Prescription Drug Prices
evi:
What or who wants to 'pin down Prescription Drug Prices'?		
It is the shared aim of the U.S president and his Democratic 2020 election challengers.		

Did U.S president Trump want to bring down the price of prescription drugs?		
Yes, Trump declared that cutting drug prices was a top priority for him.		

Did the U.S democrat party want to bring down prescription drug prices.		
Yes, For years, congressional Democrats have tried to pass legislation to allow Medicare to negotiate prescription drug prices for millions of beneficiaries.

U.S. Reps. Elijah Cummings (Democrat.) and Peter Welch (Democrat.) met privately for about an hour with Trump and his newly appointed HHS secretary, Tom Price, to discuss ways to combat high drug prices.
label: Supported

claim: 87 million Americans are uninsured or underinsured
evi:
Where did this figure come from?		
Sanders is quoting from a 2019 report from the Commonwealth Fund. The report said that the number of people who are uninsured — 24 million — had declined since the passage of the Affordable Care Act in 2010, but that more people are “underinsured.”		

What does underinsured mean?		
That term refers to out-of-pocket costs that exceed 10 percent of income (or 5 percent of income if low-income, as well as deductible that were more than 5 percent of income. It also covers people who may have had a gap in insurance coverage.		

How many total are underinsured?		
63.1 million people which includes 43.8 million people had insurance but were underinsured, while 19.3 million people had a coverage gap.
label: Supported

claim: Albert Einstein once said, “Art is standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world, and letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy.”
evi:
Can the phrase "one hand extended into the world" be found in the Einstein Archives Online?		
No, Page shows a negative result from the search of the online archive.		

Can the phrase "one hand extended into the world" be found in 'The Ultimate Quotable Einstein'?		
No, Page shows a negative result from the search of 'The Ultimate Quotable Einstein'.		

Where does the quote "Art is standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world and letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy" come from?		
The quote may be from Christina Baldwin's 1990 book, Life’s Companion: Journal Writing as a Spiritual Quest, where a quote says, "Spiritual love is a position of standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world, letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy."		

Did Albert Einstein say "Art is standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world, and letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy"?		
There is no substantive evidence that Einstein made this statement. It is not listed in the 2010 book “The Ultimate Quotable Einstein” which is a comprehensive reference about the physicist’s pronouncements from Princeton University Press.[1]
label: Refuted

claim: The health-care industry made $100 billion in profits last year
evi:
How much profit did the Health care industry make in 2018?		
AM Best - Profits rose 19 percent to nearly $26 billion through the third quarter of 2018, compared to the same prior-year period.		

Were there any other reports of how much profit was made?		
Yes- The national Association of Insurance Commissioners said - it experienced
a significant increase in net earnings to $23.4 billion		

In the Sanders statement correct in stating that  health-care industry made $100 billion in profits last year during the second debate of the Democratic primary season ?		
Yes, Sanders is correct: The total net revenues, or profits, these companies posted in 2018 comes to just more than $100 billion — $100.96 billion, in fact

claim: Pro-Kremlin Pundit Blames Demonstrators for Police Crackdown on Moscow Protest
evi:
Which protest does the claim refer to?		
A July 27th Protest in Moscow over barring independents from  opposition candidates from city council elections.		

Did the police arrest unruly protestors at the protest?		
Police started arresting even before protest began!		

Was the protest largely peaceful?		
Moscow police set an ominous record on July 27, 2019 by arbitrarily detaining at least 1,373 people, including about 25 children, during peaceful protests, Human Rights Watch said		

What is a pundit?		
A person who knows a lot about a particular subject and is therefore often asked to give an opinion about it: 

- "a political/foreign-policy/sports pundit"		

What were demonstrators blamed for?		
29/07/2019 - An article by Alexey Martynov, Political scientist and director of the International Institute of Newly-Established States discussed the "riots in Moscow" - "about the failure of some self-proclaimed oppositionists to enter the election race for the post of city deputies of the capital's parliament." -  "So. This event is nothing more than an attempt to organize mass riots in the center of Moscow with a provocation of law enforcement agencies for a harsh reaction, following the example of their colleagues from Paris or New York, where in such circumstances no one stands on ceremony with violators of public order." - "So, an attempt to organize mass riots in Moscow with a provocation to the extremely harsh reaction of law enforcement officers failed. Of the 3,500 participants in the performance, there were about 800 journalists from various publications and bloggers who notified the police in advance of their desire to cover the scandalous event."		

Is Alexey Martynov a 'pundit'?		
Yes, He's referenced as a "Political Expert" or Political Scientist on different news articles, such as the News Agency Novosti Pridnestrovya that quote him as a "Political Expert." This satisfies the definition for  "Pundit."		

Were demonstrators blamed for a Police Crackdown on the Moscow Protest, by a pundit?		
Yes, Alexey Martynov, Political scientist said the protest was an "attempt to organize mass riots in the center of Moscow with a provocation of law enforcement agencies for a harsh reaction"
label: Supported

claim: The Nationals party, represents the poorest electorates in Australia.
evi:
What do they mean by "Poorest"?		
Two data sets measure the poverty line and disadvantage by federal electorate both		

Which are the worst off electorates?		
The three worst off electorates on both of these measures, Fowler, Blaxland and Spence, are all represented by the Labor Party.		

On average are the electorates represented by Nationals worse off?		
Yes, Two data sets measuring the poverty line and disadvantage by federal electorate both show that electorates represented by the Nationals are on average worse off than those represented by the Labor and Liberal parties.		

Does that mean that The Nationals party, represents the poorest electorates in Australia?		
No, further analysis which estimates the worst off 5 per cent of electorates held by the Nationals, Labor and the Liberal Party shows the Nationals and Labor with similar results for poverty and disadvantage, making the picture less clear.

Minor parties such as the Greens were not included in this analysis as each minor party only represents a single electorate; a statistician told Fact Check that a comparison cannot be made using one data point against parties that hold many more electorates.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Ancient Roman politician Marcus Tullius Cicero once said, “The Budget should be balanced, the Treasury should be refilled, public debt should be reduced.”

This is a quote from a book called "A Pillar of Iron" by Taylor Caldwell

how did hitesh mulchandani die		
hitesh mulchandani was allegedly abducted and mercilessly killed in Pimpri following a spat with a gang of criminals who were urinating outside a hotel near Pimpri railway station in wee hours of Tuesday.

claim: A 24 year old Indian Hindu man Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune was murdered by a Muslim gang for raising his voice against public urination.
evi:
Was the murder of Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune India, carried out by Muslim gang ?		
Pimpri Inspector Kalyan Pawar said, “The accused are on record criminals who have killed Hitesh over a spat. Amin was handed over to us by the hotel staff. However the others are absconding while we have launched a hunt to trace them.”		

Does the murder of Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune India, has any religious inclination ?		
A youth was allegedly abducted and mercilessly killed in Pimpri following a spat with a gang of criminals who were urinating outside a hotel near Pimpri railway station in wee hours of Tuesday.

The victim was identified as Hitesh Govardhan Mulchandani (24) a resident of Pimpri Camp.

The accused were identified as Amin Khan of Mominpura, Shahbaaz Qureshi of Kasarwadi, Arbaaz Sheikh of Khadki, Akshay Bhosale alias Linga of Sangvi and one Langda of Sangvi.

The Pimpri police said that five accused came at Krunal Bar and Restaurant at Radhika Chowk near Pimpri railway station. The accused had reportedly come there for drinks.

One of the accused identified as Amin Khan was allegedly urinating outside the hotel when the hotel staff objected.

The police added that the objection of the hotel staff led to a huge spat between Amin and the staffers

The police further said the hotel owner Rohit Sukheja arrived there with his friends including Hitesh Mulchandani. Hitesh tried to bring peace between the groups however it fired back at him.

When Rohit’s friend, Sahil Lalwani intervened to stop Amin, he allegedly got into fisticuffs. Amin also allegedly broke a bottle of beer on the head of another friend of Kailash Patil and injured him.		

what is india's stand on public urination		
Any person who, on any road or in any open place or street or thoroughfare within the limits of any town to which this section shall be specially extended by the State Government, commits any of the following offences, to the obstructions inconvenience, annoyance, risk, danger or damage of the residents or passengers shall, on conviction before a Magistrate, be liable to fine not exceeding fifty rupees, or to imprisonment with or without hard labor not exceeding eight days;”

March 2019

The Mueller report		

How much did The Mueller
report cost?		
Mueller Probe Cost $25 Million

claim: Robert S Mueller can't provide evidence that his investigation into  Russia’s interference in the 2016 presidential election reached a conclusion.
evi:
Who is Robert S Mueller?		
He is former FBI director and named special counsel for Russia investigation		

What is the investigation into Russia’s interference?		
The Russian investigation was investigating Russia's interference in the 2016 presidential election.		

Did the Mueller Report reach a conclusion?		
on January 6, 2017, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence released a report concluding that “Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign in 2016 aimed at the US presidential election”, that the goal of this campaign was “to undermine public faith in the US democratic process”, and that “Putin and the Russian Government developed a clear preference for President-elect Trump”;
label: Refuted

claim: The European Union asked for a 100 billion euro settlement for the UK to leave the EU.
evi:
What is the latest estimate for the UK's divorce bill upon leaving the EU?		
Based on our March forecast, but assuming a 31 October 2019 exit date, the financial
settlement would be €36.3 billion, or £32.8 billion, with the remaining £5.0 billion
difference being paid as part of the UK’s normal membership contributions to the EU.		

What is a Brexit divorce bill?		
In the financial settlement (the settlement), the UK and EU have set out how they will
settle their outstanding financial obligations to each other. The obligations arise out of the
UK’s participation in the EU Budget and broader aspects of its EU membership.
The settlement says which financial commitments will be covered, the methodology for
calculating the UK’s share and the payment schedule. The settlement is part of the
Withdrawal Agreement, which is the legally binding treaty setting out the negotiated
terms of the UK’s departure from the EU.
There is no definitive cost to the settlement. The final cost to the UK will depend on future
events such as future exchange rates and EU budgets. The Office for Budget Responsibility
estimate that the net cost to the UK may be £34 billion.
label: Refuted

claim: An exercise being done in a video can cure heart blockage and back pain in 7 days
evi:
Can clapping your hand 9 times cure heart blockage		
No answer could be found.		

Health benefits of cupping and curing heart diseases		
Cupping helps reduce anxiety among other things but does not help in curing heart blockages

claim: India’s Debt From The World Bank Reduced To Zero Under PM Narendra Modi in July 2019.
evi:
Does the World Bank offer loans to countries of the world?		
Yes, The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) lends to governments of middle-income and creditworthy low-income countries.		

Does the World Bank offer loans to countries of the world?		
Yes, The International Development Association (IDA) provides interest-free loans — called credits — and grants to governments of the poorest countries		

Did India have any loans with the IBRD in July 2019?		
Data is only available for 26/10/2017		

Did India have any loans with the World Bank in 2019?		
No answer could be found.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: President Trump fully co-operated with the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S presidential campaign.
evi:
What was the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S presidential campaign called?		
The Mueller Report.		

What is the Mueller Report?		
The report is a summation of the findings from the special counsel investigation. It is expected to contain the details of the investigation, from its interviews with key witnesses and other evidence amassed throughout the process and the Mueller team’s conclusions – or lack thereof.

In a letter to lawmakers, Attorney General William Barr said the report “sets forth the Special Counsel’s findings, analysis and the reasons for his conclusions.” 

Mueller was appointed in May 2017 shortly after Trump fired Comey. Mueller was authorized to investigate Russian interference in the 2016 election, whether any Trump associates coordinated or colluded with the Russians, whether Trump obstructed the investigation and any other crimes that were uncovered during the investigation.		

Did Donald Trump act in good faith when being investigated?		
Trump consistently denied that he or anyone on his team colluded with Russia to interfere in the election, and he has rejected further the intelligence community’s conclusion that Russia attempted to interfere in the election at all, including while standing next to Russian President Vladimir Putin shortly after Mueller’s appointment. He likewise denied the possibility he had obstructed justice.

Throughout the process, Trump railed against Mueller and Mueller’s team, accusing them of political bias and maligning both the intelligence community and Justice Department more broadly.		

What did the Mueller report discover about Donald Trumps role in the Russian interference of the 2016 U.S presidential campaign?		
Our investigation found multiple acts by the President that were capable of exerting undue influence over law enforcement investigations, including the Russian-interference and obstruction investigations,” Mueller wrote. “The incidents were often carried out through one-on-one meetings in which the President sought to use his official power outside of usual channels. These actions ranged from efforts to remove the Special Counsel and to reverse the effect of the Attorney General’s recusal; to the attempted use of official power to limit the scope of the investigation; to direct and indirect contacts with witnesses with the potential to influence their testimony.
label: Refuted

claim: Robert Mueller applied and was interviewed for the job of FBI director the day before he was appointed Special Counsel.
evi:
What did Robert Mueller go to the Whitehouse for on May 16 2017?		
He was there to 'give advice on the type of person that we should select to be FBI director'
label: Refuted

claim: The Trump campaign welcomed and made full use of Russian intervention  in the 2016 U.S presidential election.
evi:
How did Russia intervene in USA 2016 presidential elections?		
The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and
systematic fashion. Evidence of Russian government operations began to surface in mid-2016. In
June, the Democratic National Committee and its cyber response team publicly announced that
Russian hackers had compromised its computer network. Releases of hacked materials—hacks
that public reporting soon attributed to the Russian government—began that same month.
Additional releases followed in July through the organization WikiLeaks, with further releases in
October and November		

How did Russia intervene in USA 2016 presidential elections?		
The report claimed that the Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and
systematic fashion. Evidence of Russian government operations began to surface in mid-2016. In
June, the Democratic National Committee and its cyber response team publicly announced that
Russian hackers had compromised its computer network. Releases of hacked materials—hacks
that public reporting soon attributed to the Russian government—began that same month.
Additional releases followed in July through the organization WikiLeaks, with further releases in
October and November		

Did Russian government contact Trump Campaign to offer assistance during the 2016 presidential campaign?		
The investigation established multiple links between Trump Campaign officials and
individuals tied to the Russian government. Those links included Russian offers of assistance to
the Campaign.		

Did Trump's Campaign accept the Russian offers of assistance?		
In some instances, the Campaign was receptive to the offer, while in other instances
the Campaign officials shied away. Ultimately, the investigation did not establish that the
Campaign coordinated or conspired with the Russian government in its election-interference
activities.		

What did the investigation conclude?		
In sum, the investigation established multiple links between Trump Campaign officials and
individuals tied to the Russian government. Those links included Russian offers of assistance to
the Campaign. In some instances, the Campaign was receptive to the offer, while in other instances
the Campaign officials shied away. Ultimately, the investigation did not establish that the
Campaign coordinated or conspired with the Russian government in its election-interference
activities
label: Refuted

claim: A dossier by former British intelligence officer Christopher Steele containing contacts between Russian officials and members of the Trump campaign started the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election campaign.
evi:
What prompted the Russian interference investigation in the 2016 election campaign In the U.S?		
James Comey said ,  the "basis" for the start of the FBI's Russia investigation was "information we'd received about a conversation that a Trump campaign foreign policy adviser had with an individual in London about stolen emails that the Russians had that would be harmful to Hillary Clinton." Comey added that "it was weeks or months later that the so-called Steele dossier came to our attention."		

Who is James Comey?		
FBI Director at time of April 2016		

Did the Christopher Steele-compiled dossier, which detailed interactions between Russian officials and Trump campaign members, serve as the impetus for the Russia investigation?		
Christopher Steele's raw intelligence reporting did not inform the FBI's decision to initiate its  counterintelligence investigation in late July 2016.
label: Refuted

Are there other articles that say who owns Baltnews.lv?		
The three Russian-language news sites of collectively known as Baltnews have been found to be connected with Russian state-sponsored news agency Rossiya Segodnya, revealed an investigation by publication Re:Baltica on Friday.		

Who is Rossiya Segodnya?		
Rossia Segodnya, Russia's state-run media conglomerate

No answer could be found.

claim: Paul Manafort case recovers between forty two and forty six million U.S dollars meaning the cost to taxpayers approaches zero in investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S election.
evi:
What financial gains were made as a direct result of the Paul Manafort case during special counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S election?		
Mueller may have paid for his own investigation - because, as part of his plea deal with the special counsel, Manafort agreed to forfeit real estate and cash estimated to be worth between $42 million and $46 million.		

What was the cost of Robert Mueller’s Russian investigation at the time of the claim?		
The nearly two-year special counsel investigation of Russian election interference led by Robert Mueller cost nearly $32 million in total, a new filing shows - the special counsel’s fourth and final expenditures as reported by the Justice Department.		

What was the cost of Robert Mueller’s Russian investigation at the time of the claim?		
The special counsel investigation into Russian election interference led by Robert Mueller cost nearly $32 million in total.		

What was the cost to taxpayers for the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S election?		
According to Jerrold Nadler the cost of the Russian investigation the cost to the US taxpayer approaches zero as a result of the $42 million recovered by Mueller.

It recovered real estate and cash estimated to be worth between $42 million and $46 million from a Paul Manafort who agreed to forfeit it.		

Does the recovered money go towards covering the cost of the investigation?		
A Justice Department official said that the money will not go directly to funding the Russia investigation..

claim: London has no go areas.
evi:
What is a no-go area?		
A "no-go area" or "no-go zone" is a neighborhood or other geographic area where some or all outsiders either are physically prevented from entering or can enter only at risk.
In the 21st century, the term has most often been used to refer to areas that police or medical workers consider too dangerous to enter without heavy backup.		

Are there any no-go areas in London?		
There are no areas in the UK in which the laws of the UK cannot be enforced.		

Are there any no-go areas in London?		
In some communities  the police “never hear of any trouble because the community deals with that on its own. It’s not that the police are afraid to go into these areas or don’t want to go into those areas.”
label: Refuted

Who is Londons Mayor?		
Sadiq Khan		

Is Sadiq khan a Muslim?		
Sadiq Khans twitter - This is London: a Muslim Mayor
