claim: More Americans are uninsured today than when US President Donald Trump took office.
evi:
How many people were uninsured in 2016, the year before Trump took office?		
28.6 million people. That represents 9% of the population.		

How many people were uninsured in 2018?		
30.4 million people. That represents 9.4% of the population.		

Is U.S. Sen. Baldwin right that more Americans are without health insurance?		
Jan. 23, 2019, Gallup report: "U.S. Uninsured Rate Rises to Four-Year High."
— April 25, 2019, Georgetown University Health Policy Institute: "Updated CBO Estimates Find Uninsured Increased by 1.4 Million Between 2016 and 2018."
— Jan. 23, 2019, Forbes: "Uninsured rate hits four-year high amid Trump’s Obamacare attacks." 

— May 9, 2019, USA Today: "CDC: 1.1 million more American lost health insurance coverage in 2018." 
— Jan. 23, 2019, Los Angeles Times: "Uninsured rate under Trump surges to highest level since Obamacare began." 
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s National Center for Health Statistics report on health insurance shows there were 28.6 million people uninsured in 2016, the year before Trump took office. That represents 9% of the population.
In 2018, that number showed 30.4 million people, or 9.4% of people all ages were without insurance.
label: Supported

claim: Russia is not using illegitimate sanctions against Georgia.
evi:
Is Russia using illegitimate sanctions against Georgia?		
We have seen the Russian consumer-protection agency politicize trade and ban certain products when political relations with Russia deteriorate, not only in Georgia, but also in the Baltics, Moldova, Ukraine, and Central Asia,” Sergi Kapanadze, the Dean of the Caucasus School of Governance at the Caucasus University in Tbilisi wrote in a 2014 policy memo for the European Council on Foreign relations.		

What are the sanctions imposed by Russia against Georgia?		
After the Rose Revolution brought Saakashvili to power in 2004, Moscow soon began applying energy sanctions to the recalcitrant Georgian leader. As with other defiant ex-Soviet states, Georgia was subjected to massive gas price increases. From 2004 to 2006 the price demanded by Gazprom, the Russian state gas monopoly, increased by nearly 500 percent, from $50 to $235 per thousand cubic meters.19 Moscow tried to portray this as a ‘normal’ price increase, designed to bring Georgia in line with prices charged to Moscow's West European purchasers, which the Kremlin described as the “world market price.” Yet the political rationale was clear. First, price increases were targeted carefully to states which angered Moscow. Georgia, in fact, was treated the worst of any state—it was the first to be forced to pay full ‘Western’ prices, even ahead of Ukraine. Russia's most dramatic action, though, took place on January 22, 2006. Just days earlier it had stopped gas supplies to the Ukraine, allegedly over a pricing dispute. But it seemed that simply turning off the gas valves, even in midwinter, was not enough of a punishment for Georgia. Russia announced that both main gas lines to Georgia had been cut by bomb blasts, allegedly the work of Chechen separatists.23 Doubts were quickly raised. Why would Chechens target Georgia, a state which was at worst neutral in their dispute with Russia—and perhaps covertly a supporter, as Moscow alleged? Although it was never proven, many believed that Moscow had cut the lines deliberately, to weaken Saakashvili's government. Georgia suffered through a few days of closed schools and factories and freezing homes until gas service was restored.24		

What are the sanctions imposed by Russia against Georgia?		
As tensions rose with the new Saakashvili government, that is exactly what Moscow did. Georgian shipments were delayed by long ‘customs inspections’—a fatal measure for goods such as fresh fruit. The quality and safety of Georgian wine and mineral water was questioned. Russia's Chief Sanitary Inspector, Gennady Onishchenko, claimed that Georgian wine contained heavy metals and pesticides.33 In March, 2006, sales of Georgian wine were forbidden on ‘health’ grounds—a measure which remained in effect for over seven years—until, as we shall see, the election of a new President suddenly made Georgian wine ‘healthy’ again. Similarly, two major brands of Georgian mineral water were barred from the Russian marked in May, 2006 for “failing to meet water purity standards.”34 Banning imports on ‘health’ grounds has become a favorite tactic of the Kremlin, since these actions seem superficially plausible compared to open embargos.35		

What's meant by illigitimate sanctions?		
Max Weber
famously defined political legitimacy as the de facto ability of a political regime to
secure acceptance based on belief (‘Legitimita¨tsglaube’) as opposed to securing compliance based on coercion alone.6 In ‘Reply to Habermas’ Rawls dismisses the sociological
or descriptive concept of political legitimacy associated with Weber as insufficient.7 Not
because he thinks that Weber is wrong to focus on de facto acceptance of political
authority, but because Rawls thinks that any sufficient definition of legitimacy would
Langvatn 133
Downloaded from psc.sagepub.com by guest on January 18, 2016
have to acknowledge that there must be a benchmark of appropriate acceptance, or a
benchmark for when our belief that something is legitimate is appropriate. A full examination of political legitimacy must also ask whether
the agent who made the decision is authorized to make the decision, and whether the
decision has been made in accordance with established and recognized procedures that
are themselves appropriately authorized and sufficiently just.		

What's meant by illigitimate sanctions?		
Imposed without U.N. approval and contrary to WTO rules, international economic sanctions are no longer the exception, but a “new norm,” as Fyodor Lukyanov, editor-in-chief of this journal, argues. Sanctions against Russia were extended in 2015. And almost everyone even in Russia has forgotten that the sanctions are illegitimate, as if everyone has agreed that this is inevitable. Following this bad example Russia has introduced sanctions against Turkey. Retaliation, perhaps even much more severe, had to follow. But sanctions are in the gray area. And as a rule, they are ineffective or even counterproductive.
label: Refuted

claim: Ninety percent of the people applying for asylum never show up for their immigration court hearing in the months ahead.
evi:
What percentage of migrants show up to immigration court hearings, in the United States?		
Data show that 96 percent of asylum applicants show up to all their immigration court hearings.		

Does the United States government provide defensive asylum seekers with appointed immigration lawyers?		
Right to due process

What the law says: The Fifth Amendment states that “no person … shall be compelled in any criminal case to be a witness against himself, nor be deprived of life, liberty, or property, without due process of law.”

The issue of due process is at the heart of many immigration cases, including Reno v. Flores, the 1993 Supreme Court case that has returned to the spotlight with the surge in family separations. The case led to an agreement requiring the government to release children to their parents, a relative or a licensed program within 20 days.

In the ruling, Justice Antonin Scalia wrote “it is well established that the Fifth Amendment entitles aliens to due process of law in deportation proceedings.”

How it works in practice: Immigrants have the right to due process. But in reality, says, Andrew Arthur, a resident fellow in law and policy at the conservative Center for Immigration Studies, “courts of law run the gamut.”

In some cases, immigrants are not granted a hearing at all. When asked about the president’s tweet, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders pointed to the process of “expedited removal,” which was created by the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996.

“Just because you don’t see a judge doesn’t mean you aren’t receiving due process,” Sanders said.

Under the expedited removal process, immigrants who have been in the country illegally for less than two years and are apprehended within 100 miles of the border can be deported almost immediately without going through a court hearing.

The exception is asylum seekers, who must be granted a hearing.

Those who are not processed through expedited removal have the right to due process in an immigration court, where the main goal is to decide whether a person has a legal claim to remain in the U.S.

“In immigration court, you have very few rights,” said John Gihon, an immigration attorney who spent six years as a prosecutor for U.S. Immigration and Cust
label: Refuted

claim: The UN recommends a police-population ratio of one police officer to 220 people
evi:
Has the UN Recommended that a police force should have one police officer for every 220 people?		
No answer could be found.		

Has a proposed police officer to person ration been mentioned before elsewhere?		
in 1945. one American policeman oversaw 450 German civilians. Its success at the time has tended to inform international policing, with the ratio being passed down from one UN document to another over the years.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Russia violated South Korean airspace
evi:
Did any neutral countries have an opinion on what happened?		
Japan meanwhile has protested against both Russia and South Korea.

Because it claims sovereignty over the islands, Japan's government said that Russia had violated its airspace. It also said that South Korea's response was extremely regrettable.		

What are the defence zones of South Korea ?		
South Korea claims Russia went beyond its ADIZ (air defence identification zone ) and into the territorial airspace surrounding the islands.

But other nations do not recognise South Korea's claim of sovereignty.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Russian Mercenaries in Syria are Private Contractors and They Are Not Engaged in Combat
evi:
Have Russian mercenaries been engaged in combat in Syria?		
Yes, The Russian mercenaries fighting in Syria say they are not in the country for the money or to help Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.
Early last month, an unknown number of Russian mercenaries -- some reports say a dozen, others as many as 200 -- were killed by U.S. air strikes during fighting in Syria. The men were hired by a private military contracting firm called ChVK Vagner, which has been sending Russians to fight in Syria since 2015.		

Is ChVK Vagner sponsored by Russia?		
Mark Galeotti, a researcher with the Institute of International Relations in Prague, has written extensively on the topic of Wagner and Russia’s use of mercenaries as a potentially deniable asset. According to him, Wagner cannot be considered a legitimate private military company.

“I tend to call Wagner a pseudo-mercenary outfit because it is somewhere in between,” Galeotti told Polygraph.info. “Given that it seems largely bankrolled through Evro Polis [a company owned by Prigozhin], and it has a contract with the Syrian government worth 25% of the output of any gas and oil fields it recovers, there is clearly some truly mercenary aspect, even if much of the time it is working for the Russian command cell in Damascus.”

But while he acknowledges a possible change in Wagner’s ownership, Galeotti agreed that the organization was undoubtedly tied to the Russian state, at least in the beginning: “I don't think there is any question they were originally a state-sponsored op, is there?”

And given the fact that wounded fighters still appear to be receiving treatment at Russian military hospitals, possibly arriving on Russian military transport aircraft, it appears that Russian authorities know far more about Wagner and its activities than they have so far admitted in public.		

Have any Russian mercenaries received state medals of the type usually awarded to military personnel?		
Yes, According to Fontanka, Troshev (Wagners executive director) was awarded the Hero of Russia honor for assisting in the capture of Palmyra. Bogatov also reportedly won this title. Kuznetsov and Uktin have reportedly won the Order of Courage four times.
label: Refuted

claim: A bridge that collapsed on the Jamnagar-Junagadh highway was only inaugurated three months before its collapse.
evi:
Which bridge collapsed		
The Kolkata bridge		

How old was the bridge when it collapsed		
The bridge was 50 years old

evi:

No, The bridge was constructed before Modi became PM.

claim: Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge in India collapsed within 3 months of inauguration.
evi:
Which Bridge collapsed?		
Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge		

Was the bridge built only 3 months prior to the collapse?		
No, Google earth has an image showing the bridge is already there in 2009		

Was the bridge built only 3 months prior to the collapse?		
Alt News contacted GV Joshi, the executive engineer at Road and Buildings department in Rajkot to confirm the approximate time of construction. He said, “No it’s not all true. The bridge was built at least 45 years ago. It is also not true that the bridge was inaugurated by PM Modi.”		

Was the bridge inaugurated by PM modi?		
Alt News contacted GV Joshi, the executive engineer at Road and Buildings department in Rajkot to confirm the approximate time of construction. He said, “No it’s not all true. The bridge was built at least 45 years ago. It is also not true that the bridge was inaugurated by PM Modi.”
label: Refuted

claim: Muslims in Bangalore have named a mosque after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
evi:
How many mosques are in Bangaluru (Bangalore)?		
There are 400 mosques in Bengaluru.		

Is there a mosque called Modi Masjid in Bangalore?		
Yes, There are three. The one in question is the Modi Abdul Gafoor Masjid.		

Was the mosque named after Prime Minister Narendra Modi?		
The mosque was named after Modi Abdul Gafoor, a 19th century merchant. Apart from this mosque, there are two more mosques are in Bengaluru known as Modi Masjid.
label: Refuted

claim: Founding father of the United States, Patrick Henry said, “It cannot be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians; not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ. For this very reason peoples of other faiths have been afforded asylum, prosperity, and freedom of worship here.”
evi:
Was Patrick Henry a founding father of the United States?		
No, Henry served as a delegate to both the first and second Continental Congresses and was largely responsible for the establishment of a colonial militia. He helped draft a constitution for the new state of Virginia and served as its first governor from 1776 to 1779, when Thomas Jefferson succeeded him. After serving again as governor from 1784 to 1786, Henry was elected to the Constitutional Convention of 1787, but he declined to attend. At the Virginia ratifying convention, he opposed the federal Constitution, believing it to be a threat to state sovereignty.		

Dad Patrick Henry say “It cannot be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians; not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ. For this very reason peoples of other faiths have been afforded asylum, prosperity, and freedom of worship here.”?		
No, The Virginian, April 1956, Vol. II No. 3
label: Refuted

claim: Margaret Hello was phone inventor Alexander Graham Bell’s girlfriend
evi:
When was the telephone invented?		
On March 7, 1876, Bell was granted his telephone patent. A few days later, he made the first-ever telephone call to Watson, allegedly uttering the now-famous phrase, “Mr. Watson, come here. I want you.”		

Did Bell have a girlfriend at the time?		
While teaching, Bell met Mabel Hubbard, a deaf student. The couple married on July 11, 1877.		

Who was Margaret Hello?		
No answer could be found.		

Where does the word "hello" originate from?		
Hello (first attested in 1826), from holla, hollo (attested 1588). This variant of hallo is often credited to Thomas Edison as a coinage for telephone use, but its appearance in print predates the invention of the telephone by several decades.
label: Refuted

claim: A black woman named Malinda Borden Died when the titanic sank because the life boats were reserved for white people only.

No, The name is not listed on the  passenger list		

Was Malinda Borden listed as not accounted for after the titanic sank?		
No, Not listed on a missing or unaccounted for list.

claim: 1.9 million more children are in good and outstanding schools.
evi:
Where countries schools does the claim refer to?		
England, U.K.		

Who rates schools performance  in the U.K?		
The Office for Standards in Education, Children’s Services and Skills (Ofsted) inspects and regulates services that care for children and young people and services that provide education and skills for learners of all ages.		

do 1.9 million children attend a school rated good or outstanding by Ofsted in the U.K?		
Yes, It’s factually accurate		

How many children are in schools that havn't been rated by Ofsted?		
580,000 pupils were in schools that hadn’t even been inspected since 2010.		

Does the 1.9 million figure give an accurate impression of how schools in the U.K work for their pupils?		
It’s factually accurate, The problem is that it fails an important test of any statistic – it does not show the user what the
producer believes it shows. In this case, it does not adequately demonstrate that standards in
schools have improved since 2010, at least not to the extent that a quarter of all pupils are in
significantly better schools because of any policy intervention
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Nigeria is top in Africa for suicide.
evi:
What is Nigeria'S rank in suicide rate		
Nigeria had an age-standardised suicide rate of 17.3 per 100,000 people in 2016, which placed it seventh on the continent.

claim: Irish poet and playwright Oscar Wilde once said, “Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.”
evi:
Who was Oscar Wilde?		
Wilde was a poet, novelist and playwright who featured prominently in the aestheticism movement, in which beauty was considered to be the primary purpose of art. Two of his best known works, the 1895 satirical play “The Importance of Being Earnest” and the 1891 philosophical novel “The Picture of Dorian Gray,” are both considered literary classics.		

Does this quote appear In any of his works?		
nowhere in these works, or any of his others, does the phrase about happiness appear. A search of his complete works turned up no matching or similar expressions.
label: Refuted

claim: Pakistan cricketers were out till late at night smoking hookah before their match against India which led to their loss
evi:
When was the match against India, where the players were seen out the night before?		
on the Sunday		

What date was the video from?		
The video was from the night of June 14 (Friday) not Saturday as being alleged by fans and on social media. 

In a statement, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) clarified that no player had violated curfew and returned to their hotel rooms’ on-time the night before Pakistan’s match against India. The board added that players had gone out with their families two days before the match.
label: Refuted

claim: Four in ten fathers will not see their children this Father’s Day.
evi:
Did four in ten dads not see their children this Father’s Day?		
Incorrect. 37% of fathers who responded to a recent survey said that either they, or someone they knew, had ever experienced not seeing their children on Father's Day.
label: Refuted

claim: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is converting to Islam from Christianity.
evi:
Where was this claim published?		
Vatican Enquirer		

What is Vatican Enquirer?		
The Vatican Enquirer is a satirical look at headlines around the world.
The stories are not real and purely fictional. All details are fabricated, and is not intended for readers under 18 years of age. Invented names are use in all of its stories, except in cases of known public figures being satirized. Any other use of real names is purely accidental and coincidental.
label: Refuted

claim: A little girl photographed in a hospital bed receives a dollar for a kidney transplant every time someone shares a Facebook post.
evi:
Does Facebook offer to donate money based on the numbers or shares a post gets?		
No, It is a known like and share scam which lures people into liking or sharing a page or image by claiming Facebook will donate a given sum of money for each action,
label: Refuted

claim: Two brands of salt in India, Samnhar refined salt and Tata salt contain high levels of toxic compound potassium ferrocyanide.
evi:
Is potassium ferrocyanide toxic?		
Sodium, potassium and calcium ferrocyanide were evaluated by a working group established by the Nordic Council of Ministers in 2000. Sodium, potassium and calcium ferrocyanide were not considered to cause a safety problem due to the very small quantities consumed.
label: Refuted

claim: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez claimed Amazon was paying full-time employees so little that they required government food assistance.
evi:
How much did Amazon pay their workers in 2019?		
In November 2018, Amazon raised it's minimum wage to $15 an hour, or $35,096 for a full time employee.		

What were Amazon wages prior to this date?		
Prior to 2018, half of Amazon's workers made less than $35,096 as the $15 an hour minimum wage wasn't yet in effect.		

What is the federal poverty level in 2019?		
The federal poverty level in 2019 is $25,750.		

How many Amazon workers rely on government food assistance?		
Depending on the state, as many as 1 in 3 Amazon workers get food stamps in Arizona, and 1 in 10 in both Ohio and Pennsylvania.		

Is a full time worker for Amazon earning above the poverty line?		
Yes, With the wage increase from amazon,full time employees earn above the poverty line.		

With the wage increase will Amazon employees need to rely on government food assistance?		
This depends on the state, extra benefits, hours worked and age of children.  Some may still be eligible for food stamps.		

At the time of the claim (June 2019) was their data to say amazon workers were using food assistance programs?		
Yes, but only before the 2019 wage rise, was it a top employer of SNAP recipients in at least five states
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

In a Facebook meme.

Panelo said about Lawyer Jude Sabio that "He is hallucinating and just wants to publicize himself."

claim: Sri Lanka has been ranked in the top four most corrupt nations in the world
evi:
Which Country is the most most corrupt nation globally?		
Alexander E.M. Hess, Michael Sauter  |  24/7 Wall Street

More than half of the world's population believes corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem. Liberia and Mongolia are the two most corrupt countries in the world, according to a recent study. In both countries, 86% of residents believe corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem. Residents in the vast majority of countries around the world believe corruption has only gotten worse in the past two years.

Anti-corruption nonprofit Transparency International has released its 2013 Global Corruption Barometer, which surveyed residents in 107 countries. The world's corrupt nations differ in many ways. Four are located in Africa, three in Latin America and two in Asia. These nations also vary considerably in size and population. Mongolia has just 3.2 million residents, while Mexico, Nigeria and Russia are three of the largest countries on the globe, each with more than 100 million people. Based on the percentage of surveyed residents that reported corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem, these are the world's most corrupt nations		

Is Sri Lanka among the top four most corrupt nations in the world?		
Below are the top 10 most corrupt countries in the world, according to the U.S. News and World Report for 2018. The data was compiled from the 2018 Best Countries rankings, an analysis of 80 countries based on a survey of over 21,000 citizens around the world. The survey gauged how participants perceived the corruption in other countries.
1. Nigeria

2. Colombia

3. Pakistan

4. Iran

5. Mexico

6. Ghana

7. Angola

8. Russ

claim: "Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake.”
evi:
What data set does the figure that Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake come from?		
The figure comes from the 2018 UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) Business -to-consumer E-commerce index. The 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index, measures an economy’s preparedness to 
support online shopping.		

Does the data in the 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index include the whole world?		
No, The 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index has expanded its coverage to include 151 economies, up seven

Kenya is ranked 89th of 151 countries.

claim: The domestic Indonesian flight route CI9798 is being Operated by China Airlines.
evi:
What is the criteria to operate a domestic flight in Indonesia?		
National commercial air transportation business entities as referred to in
referred to in paragraph (1), all or most of the
capital, must be owned by an Indonesian legal entity or
Indonesian citizens.

Badan usaha angkutan udara niaga nasional sebagaimana
dimaksud pada ayat (1), seluruh atau sebagian besar

flight CI9798 is a code share for flight GA-612 operated by Garuda Indonesia.

Other airlines also code share the flight GA-612 such as :
Malaysia Airlines (MH)5780 & ANA (NH)5519.		

What is a code share flight?		
Code sharing is a marketing arrangement in which an airline places its designator code on a flight operated by another airline, and sells tickets for that flight. Airlines throughout the world continue to form code-share arrangements to strengthen or expand their market presence and competitive ability.		

Is Garuda Indonesia an Indonesian business?		
Yes it is the Airline of Indonesia.

claim: 25% of drug users in Nigeria are women
evi:
Are about 14.4 million Nigerians are currently on drugs ?.		
A UN report based on the country’s first comprehensive survey of drug use found an estimated 14.3 million Nigerians – not 14.4 million – aged 15 to 64 used drugs in 2017. This claim is mostly correct .		

Are 25% of drug users in Nigeria are women ?		
The report estimated that one in four drug users in Nigeria was a woman. This worked out to 3.4 million women aged 15 to 64 in 2017.

Women reported having less control than men over how and from whom they acquired mostly illicit drugs. They were also far more likely to be supplied drugs by a male partner.

current anomalies involving the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation?		
Unnecessary procedures Doctors in some clinics performed "unnecessary" procedures just so they can claim more benefits from the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth), health officials said on Wednesday, July 8.

Hontiveros, on the other hand, only joined PhilHealth’s board of directors from November 2014 to October 2015. She then stepped down to file her certificate of candidacy for the senatorial elections in 2016. Moreover, Hontiveros has sought an investigation into the PhilHealth funds that supposedly went to a dialysis center that claimed benefits for “ghost patients.”

3.6%

claim: On 13 June 2019 Kenya’s finance minister Henry Rotich claimed that Kenyas  growth is well above the sub-Saharan Africa region average growth of 3% and the global average of 3.6%.
evi:
What is the global average growth rate?		
After peaking at close to 4 percent in 2017, global growth remained strong, at 3.8 percent in the first half of 2018, but dropped to 3.2 percent in the second half of the year.		

What is the Sub-Saharan Africa growth rate?		
3.0% for 2018		

What is the growth rate for Kenya?		
6.3%
label: Supported

claim: Cosmetologists train  eleven times longer than emergency medical technicians
evi:
How many hours are required to complete a cosmetology course?		
Each state sets its own standards. Most require 1,500 hours, and some, like New York and Massachusetts, require only 1,000. Iowa requires 2,100.		

How many hours of training does it take to become an EMT?		
You can become an emergency medical technician in the state of Iowa after 132 hours.		

Using the Iowa Numbers of 2100hrs for cosmetology vs 132 hours for EMT training, How many times longer does it take to become a cosmetologist in Iowa?		
2100/132= 15.9090909091
(rounded up to 16 it works out you have to do an additional 15 times as much.		

How many hours does it take to become a cosmetologist in New York?		
1000hrs		

How many hours does it take qualify as an EMT in New York?		
EMTs courses are normally between 150 and 180 hours to complete.		

Using the New York Numbers of 1000hrs for cosmetology vs 180 hours for EMT training, How many times longer does it take to become a cosmetologist in Iowa?		
1000/180=5.55555555556

So over 4.5 times longer to become a cosmetologist.		

What is the average training time in the USA to become an EMT?		
According to Indeed career guide It takes approximately 120 hours of supervised training to become an EMT. This typically takes candidates between six months and one year to complete		

With Most states requiring 1500 hours of training to become a cosmetologist and the average EMT course taking 120hrs. how many times more training would you need to do to be come a cosmetologist?		
1500/120=12.5 so you would have to do 11.5 times more training to be a qualified cosmetologist in comparison to becoming an EMT based on the average numbers of 1500hrs for Cosmetology and 120hrs for EMT.
label: Supported

claim: Kenya’s excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to about 2% in 2017/18.
evi:
What is excise revenue?		
Excise duties and levies are imposed mostly on high-volume daily consumable products (e.g. petroleum and alcohol and tobacco products) as well as certain non-essential or luxury items (e.g. electronic equipment and cosmetics).   The primary function of these duties and levies is to ensure a constant stream of revenue for the State, with a secondary function of discouraging consumption of certain harmful products; i.e. harmful to human health or to the environment.		

What was Kenya’s excise revenue as a percentage share of GDP in 2003/04?		
3.7% (provisional figure)		

What was Kenya’s excise revenue as a percentage share of GDP in 2017/18?		
1.84%
(Table 7, page 22 in Quarterly Economic and Budgetary Review Fourth Quarter, Financial Year 2017/2018 Period ending 30th June, 2018)
label: Supported

claim: Kenya's excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to about 2% in 2017/18.
evi:
What was Kenya's excise duty in 2003/04?		
40.09 Ksh billion
3.5% of GDP		

What was Kenya's excise duty in 2017/18?		
117,481 Ksh billion
1.34% of GDP
label: Supported

claim: Republicans voted against military pay rises
evi:
How many republicans voted in favour of a military pay rise?		
When the Armed Services Committee passed the bill by a 33-to-24 vote on June 13, only two Republicans, Reps. Don Bacon (Neb.) and Elise Stefanik (N.Y.), voted in favour.		

Did the other republicans not believe in a military pay rise?		
GOP members (republicans) said the sprawling defense bill was a package deal and that the package, as a whole, wasn’t good enough.		

What did Rep. Mac Thornberry say about the pay rise		
The Chairman’s Mark supports a 3.1% military pay raise, essential end strength increases, an increase in compensation for military spouses to acquire professional licenses, and significant bipartisan housing reform to protect military families. The Mark continues reforms focused on sexual assault prevention and response. The Chairman’s Mark also prohibits the reduction of military health care personnel.		

Did majority of Republicans support the bill		
“This morning, the House Armed Services Committee marked up a defense authorization bill for 2020 that will keep America safe and defend our allies and interests abroad. It is shameful that all but two Republicans on the Committee chose to make this vote partisan.  In doing so, they voted to deny our troops a pay raise, reject critical defense initiatives, and ignore the requests of our military.  They did this all because the Committee would not agree to add billions more in unnecessary funding that would have required severe and draconian cuts to our investments in education and skills training, health care access, and infrastructure development.
label: Supported

claim: “This growth is well above the sub-Saharan Africa region average growth of 3% and the global average of 3.6%.” Kenya
evi:
What was Kenyas Annual growth in comparison to the  rest of the worlds economy?		
The world’s economy grew an estimated 3.6% that year. (Note: The IMF estimated Kenya’s economic growth for 2018 at 6.0%.)

Only 21 countries achieved a growth rate of at least 6.3%.
Only 21 countries achieved a growth rate of at least 6.3%.		

Was Kenya's growth WELL ABOVE the sub-Saharan Africa region average growth of 3% and the global average of 3.6%?		
The IMF estimated Kenya's economic growth for 2018 at 6% , so this is well above the average growth of 3% for sub-Saharan Africa and also well above the global average of 3.6%.
label: Supported

claim: Sri Lankan Muslims are demolishing mosques and are converting into Hinduism.
evi:
why was the mosque demolished?		
Muslims in Sri Lanka are demolishing a mosque because it was built using foreign funds and the site where it was built was actually allotted for a children library. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.		

Is the Sri Lankan  mosque getting demolished so that the Muslims get converted to Hindus ?		
Muslims in Sri Lanka are demolishing a mosque because it was built using foreign funds and the site where it was built was actually allotted for a children library. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE
label: Refuted

claim: About 14.4 million Nigerians are currently on drugs
evi:
How many people are estimated to use drugs in Nigeria?		
A United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) report in 2018 stated that drug use in Nigeria is estimated at 14.4 per cent or 14.3 million people aged between 15 and 64 years based on research carried out in 2017.		

How many people are estimated to use drugs in Nigeria?		
A United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) report stated that drug use in Nigeria is estimated at 14.4 per cent or 14.3 million people		

Are there any updated estimates on how many people in Nigeria used drugs at the time the claim was made in June 2019?		
No answer could be found.		

When was the UNODC report first published?		
First published in January 2019.		

What is the date of the claim?		
July 13th 2019
label: Supported

claim: “Excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to about 2% in 2017/18.”
evi:
What was the excise revenue in 2003/2004		
3.5%		

What was the excise revenue in 2017/2018		
1.91%
label: Supported

claim: Over 2013-2018, the Russian economy has grown by only 3%, i.e. less than 1% per year
evi:
What was the average growth in the Russian economy from 1999-2008?		
The growth of the Russian economy in the decade from 1999 to 2008 averaged 6.9% - the annual figures given by both the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and Rosstat (Russia’s state statistical agency) for this period converge.		

What was the growth rate from 2009-2018?		
As for the next ten years – from 2009 to 2018 -- IMF and Rosstat data do not coincide in only two cases. Additionally, Russia's economic growth during that period averaged 0.97% per year, according to the IMF, while Rosstat says it grew 0.91% per year. In any case, both estimates indicate that Russia’s economy grew “less than 1% per year,” as Kudrin noted in his interview.
label: Supported

claim: During the tenure of Nigerian President Jonathan, the inflationary pressure was kept at single digit.
evi:
What was the inflation rate in Nigeria in 2011 and 2012		
It was 10.85% and 12.24% in both years respectively
label: Refuted

claim: The growth of the Russian economy in the decade from 1999 to 2008 averaged 6.9%
evi:
What was Russia's average  economic growth between 1999 and 2008?		
(1999-2008) economic growth with real gross domestic product (GDP) increased by 6.9% annually on average.
label: Supported

claim: NigerianSocial Intervention Programmes have become a model for other nations. Together with the State Governments, we provide millions of school children with meals in primary schools, micro loans to traders and entrepreneurs, skills and knowledge acquisition support to graduates and of course, conditional cash transfers to the poorest and most vulnerable in our society
evi:
Have the Social Intervention Programmes in Nigeria become a model for other nations?		
No answer could be found.		

What is the Social Intervention Programmes in Nigeria?		
Social protection programmes became necessary for the Aregbesola’s administration because of the need to improve the lives of the down trodden in the state.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Nigeria was the number one destination for foreign direct investment during the tenure of President Jonathon.
evi:
Who was the number one destination for foreign direct investment from May 5th 2010 to May 29th 2015?		
Nigeria topped all other African countries in Mr Jonathan’s first two years with respective earnings of $8.84 and $7.07 billion. A drop to $5.5 and $4.65 billion in his subsequent two years in charge blew Nigeria off the top spot to the third spot in Africa. By his last year in office, the nation’s FDI had shrunk to $3.14 billion, placing Nigeria as Africa’s 7th destination for FDI.
label: Refuted

claim: Nigeria has made solid progress in fighting corruption in the past four years
evi:
Was Buhari Administration substantially able cut down corruption in the past four years ?		
Nigeria has a reputation for very massive corruption. I also know that the President (Buhari) has been able to cut that down very substantially. We talked about that, he is working on it and they have made a lot of progress and I think they will continue to make a lot of progress,” Trump said. Trump said this cut down on corruption in Nigeria will attract investors from the US to Nigeria. We have a lot of people in this country that invests in Nigeria, so cutting down on that corruption element and a corrupt element is very important to us and the President (Buhari) will be able to do that,” he added.

He also recognised Nigeria’s effort in its fight against terrorism and promised to support the country in that regard.

“Nigeria is one of the first African nation to join the coalition to defeat ISIS and Nigerian forces are currently leading regional efforts to defeat ISIS in West Africa and doing very well as we have. Nigeria is also leading Africa in the fight against Boko Haram,” he said.		

How many Nigerian have been convicted of corruption since President Buhari took office ?		
In the three years that I have been in charge of EFCC, we have secured 703 convictions. For me, it was an auspicious opportunity to contribute my quota to Mr President’s vision of a corruption-free nation. The opportunity to fully subscribe to President Buhari’s mantra to `kill corruption before it kills us’, was for me, the highest call to duty – one that required absolute commitment and passion.

“Indeed, the task of fighting corruption in Nigeria has never been, is not and can never be an easy one,” he said.

He said that in 2015, ”there were 103 convictions; in 2016, 194 convictions; in 2017, 189 were secured while 217 convictions were secured from January, 2018 until date”		

What is Nigeria's Ranking on Corruption Perception Index (CPI) for 2018 ?		
The Civil Society Legislative Advocacy Centre (CISLAC), Transparency International Chapter in Nigeria, said in a Tuesday morning statement to PREMIUM TIMES that “Nigeria scored 27 out of 100 points in the 2018 CPI, maintaining the same score as in the 2017 CPI.” In the country comparison, Nigeria ranks 144 out of 180 countries this year as opposed to 148 out of 180 countries in the 2017 CPI, the group added. Nigeria is thus still perceived as highly corrupt, and although the ranking shows that Nigeria moved up four (4) places, it only means that four other countries have scored worse while Nigeria stagnated.
label: Supported

claim: Nigeria has made solid progress in the area of economic growth and agriculture and industrial output have recovered since the recession
evi:
Has there been an increment in economic development in Nigeria since the recession of 2016		
Since the implementation of the EGRP (Economic Recovery and Growth Plan) after the recession in 2016, the economy has been averaging at 2.7% and in 2019 it puts the economy on the third straight year with economic decline		

Is Nigeria among the growing economies in Africa based on their GDP		
Nigeria not among the fastest growing economies in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) by percentage growth in GDP
label: Refuted

claim: In 2014 in McDowell County, West Virginia, life expectancy for men was 64 years.
evi:
What is the current life expectancy in McDowell County?		
It was 67 for males and 73.8 for women.		

Was the life expentancy in McDowell  lesser than that of Fairfax county in 2014 ?		
In 2014 ... in McDowell County, W.Va., one of the poorest counties in the nation, life expectancy for men was 64 years. In Fairfax County, Va., a wealthy county, just 350 miles away, life expectancy was nearly 82 years, an 18 year differential. The life expectancy gap for women in the two counties was 12 years.the gap for men between the two counties 15 years, rather than the 18-year figure Sanders cited.
label: Supported

claim: Nigeria are meeting the challenges of security with much greater support to the security forces in terms of money, equipment and improved local intelligence. Nigeria are meeting these challenges with superior firepower and resolve
evi:
What challenges of security is Nigeria facing?		
The Nigeria Security Tracker (NST), a project of the Council on Foreign Relations' Africa program, documents and maps violence in Nigeria that is motivated by political, economic, or social grievances. Different groups in Nigeria resort to violence. The militant Islamist movement Boko Haram is active in northern Nigeria. Violence among ethnic groups, farmers, and herdsmen sometimes acquires religious overtones. A new generation of Niger Delta militants threatens war against the state. Government soldiers kill civilians indiscriminately. Police are notorious for extrajudicial murder.		

What support is Nigerian Government giving to the security forces?		
President Muhammadu Buhari has reiterated his administration's commitment to ensure appropriate funding for the Armed Forces in order to enhance the capacity of its personnel and deepen professionalism in the fight against insurgency.		

Do Nigerian security forces have superior firepower?		
There are claims that the Buhari administration and the Nigerian military are inadequately equipping soldiers for the fight against Boko Haram		

Is Nigeria facing security challenges		
FOR some time now, the problem of insecurity which used to be one of the lowest in the hierarchy of social problems facing this country seems to have assumed alarming proportions since the end of the Nigerian civil war which ended in 1970.		

What has the Nigerian government done about the security challenges		
The insurgency has attracted the substantial deployment of the nation’s defense and intelligence establishments, as the Joint Task Force (JTF), which is comprised of the police and army, has been deployed in ten states in the north. Also, at border points, there has been tightened security, strict searches, and the deportation of illegal aliens.		

What has the Nigerian government done about the security challenges		
For instance, the Borno State government donated 10 armoured vehicles to the police, apparently to enable the Force to effectively combat the sect. In the 2012 budget, the government allocated a staggering $5.947 billion to defence and national security, translating to ₦921.91billion. This figure represents 20 per cent of the total budget and the highest allocation ever for defence and security in the history of the country. This also makes Nigeria the biggest spender on defence and security in Africa. The 2012 allocation is also a marked difference from the ₦233 billion in 2009, ₦264billion in 2010, and ₦348 billion in 2011.[19] The government has also ensured that Nigerian security agents receive up to the minute training in counter-terrorism, and every other capacity building initiative available in the world today for combating terrorism. This training has been continuous, taking place both in and outside the country. There has been speculation that some 300 Nigerian soldiers were sent to the United States to receive counter-insurgency, counter-terrorism and bomb-disposal training specifically aimed at fighting BH. However, Nigerian Army sources were reported as denying this. US officials would not comment on whether such activities were linked to BH.[20]		

Has the response of the government caused some change in the security challenge		
On Friday night an armed gang killed at least 34 people in the north-western state of Zamfara, which has been at the centre of a wave of attacks by bandits since the beginning of the year.

The Boko Haram insurgency has been terrorising people in the north-east for the past decade, and has been the main area of focus for Nigeria's armed forces.

But the triple suicide bombings in Borno on Sunday reflect just how complex the security challenges are.

The government has said that Boko Haram and the rival Islamic State of West Africa Province (Iswap) group are on their last legs. But both the military and population of the north-east continue to suffer regular attacks.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: It's free to watch TV in UK prisons.
evi:
Can UK prisoners watch TV for free?		
Prisoners must purchase phone credit themselves and pay rent for a TV.		

Can UK prisoners watch TV for free?		
Prisoners over retirement age do not have to pay for their TV.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: The U.S. women’s soccer team bring in more revenue but get paid less than the men
evi:
When has the U.S. women’s soccer team brought in more revenue?		
...from 2016-18, the women’s team brought in $50.8 million in revenue, while the men’s team brought in $49.9 million. That’s a difference of less than 2% in the women’s favor.		

When has the U.S. women’s soccer team brought in more revenue?		
From 2016 to 2018, women’s games generated about $50.8 million in revenue compared with $49.9 million for the men, according to U.S. soccer’s audited financial statements.		

Are the U.S. women’s soccer team paid less than the men?		
Yes, Despite their successes on the field, players on the U.S. Women’s National Team are still paid considerably less than their male counterparts.		

When has the U.S. women's soccer team been paid less than the men's?		
...the U.S. Men’s National Team received nearly $5.4 million in total performance bonuses after losing in the Round of 16 of the 2014 World Cup, while the U.S. Women’s National Team received less than a third of that amount for winning the World Cup the following year.
label: Supported

claim: Mexican drug cartels make £500 billion a year.
evi:
What are the worldwide proceeds from drugs estimated to be?		
If only flows related to drug trafficking and other
transnational organized crime activities were considered, related proceeds would have been equivalent to
around US$650 billion per year in the first decade
of the new millennium, equivalent to 1.5% of global
GDP or US$870 billion in 2009 assuming that the
proportions remained unchanged. The funds available
for laundering through the financial system would
have been equivalent to some 1% of global GDP or
US$580 billion in 2009.		

Does the UN have estimates for Mexican drug cartels?		
Calculating trafficking profits to North America (total
transit profits of US5.3 bn) is relatively straightforward.
The largest part of these profits are generated by South
American groups, notably groups from Colombia (most
of the US$3.3 bn in profits generated in shipping the
cocaine to Mexico), followed by profits made by Mexican drug cartels (US$2 bn for shipping the cocaine
across the border to the USA; far more money is then
made by the Mexican drug cartels within the United
States in trafficking the cocaine to the various wholesalers and retailers).		

What is the estimated revenue of Mexican drug cartels?		
The cash-rich cartels, believed by the Mexican government to generate well over $21 billion each year.		

What is the estimated revenue of Mexican drug cartels?		
NDIC estimates indicate that Mexican and Colombian DTOs generate, remove, and launder between $18 billion and $39 billion in wholesale drug proceeds annually
label: Refuted

claim: It costs £8 per day to watch TV in hospital if you’re 82.
evi:
What companies provide TV systems to hospitals?		
Some hospitals use TV systems provided by companies like HTS or Hospedia.		

Does Hospedia provide free TV services?		
Yes, FREE TV typically 8am-12noon, channels 1-5*
FREE TV 7am-7pm in children’s wards*
FREE outbound phone calls to 01, 02, 03 numbers and mobiles
FREE radio		

How much do you have to pay to watch TV in a hospital?		
For instance, as of April 2018 at the County Durham and Darlington NHS Trust, TV was free on channels one to five in the mornings, with prices ranging from £7.90 per day for the "1 Day TV Bundle" to the most expensive rate at £24.90 per day for the "3 Day TV & Movies Bundle."		

Do some hospitals provide TV services free of charge?		
James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, provide TV free of charge on some wards.		

How much are 82-year-olds charged to watch TV in hospitals?		
No answer could be found.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: India's Bharatiya Janata Party workers were killed in West Bengal by 11 Bajrang Dal members.
evi:
When was the claim made		
11/06/2019		

What was the claim based on		
The claim was based on a wrong story by a news center called NewsLaundry		

What did NewsLaundry do after discovering that they had made a wrong assessment and published a wrong story		
the story was pulled down owing to an “error in assessment”
label: Refuted

claim: Nigeria’s best University ranks 800th in world.
evi:
What is Nigeria's best University?		
Covenant University, Ota, Ogun State has become the highest ranked Nigerian university in the latest Times Higher Education ranking released on September 26, 2018		

Are there other rankings with different results?		
CWUR ranks only one Nigerian University in its list: University of Ibadan was ranked 991st in the world.		

Which spots are Nigerian Universities in the Times Higher Education World University rankings?		
Both Covenant University and University of Ibadan are ranked in the 601-800 bracket.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: 1.5 lakh sub centers and primary health centers being transformed as health and wellness centers (HWCs) to provide comprehensive primary healthcare services.
evi:
Which location does the claim refer to?		
India		

Who is claiming to develop the Health centres in the claim?		
Ayushman Bharat, which  is a National Health Protection Scheme, and will cover over 10 crore poor and vulnerable families		

Does the Ayushman Bharat Programme aim to transform 1.5 lakh sub centers and primary health centers into  health and wellness centers (HWCs)		
Yes, The government has set up 1.22 lakh Ayushman Bharat Health and Wellness Centres and will achieve the target of 1.5 lakh such centres by the end of this year, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said.
label: Supported

claim: Ayushman Bharat provides comprehensive health coverage up to Rs. 5 lakh per family per year to around 50 crore people.
evi:
What is Ayushman Bharat?		
National Health Protection Scheme, which will cover over 10 crore poor and vulnerable families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries) providing coverage up to 5 lakh rupees per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
label: Supported

claim: Former Vice President Joe Biden leaked the names of US Navy SEAL Team 6 families to Al Qaeda.
evi:
What event is this alluding to?		
Referring to the Navy SEALs unit responsible for the 2011 assassination of al Qaeda leader Osama Bin Laden		

What did Biden say about the people involved in the operation?		
President Barack Obama on May 1, 2011, announced to the nation that “a small team of Americans carried out the operation” at a compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan. Press reports immediately following Obama’s announcement identified the SEALs’ involvement; some explicitly named Team 6.		

Did he mention anyone specifically by name?		
No, Then, on May 3, Biden in remarks at an Atlantic Council event lauded the SEALs for their work. He did not mention the specific unit or any specific members by name.

“Let me briefly acknowledge tonight’s distinguished honorees. Admiral Jim Stavridis is the real deal,” Biden said. “He can tell you more about and understands the incredible, the phenomenal, the just almost unbelievable capacity of his Navy SEALs and what they did last Sunday.”

He later continued: “I’d be remiss also if I didn’t say an extra word about the incredible events, extraordinary events of this past Sunday. As vice president of the United States, as an American, I was in absolute awe, awe, of the capacity and dedication of the entire team — both the intelligence community, the CIA, the SEALs.”
label: Refuted

claim: Standing next to a mobile phone antenna or staying too long in its vicinity is a radiation risk.
evi:
Can standing next to a mobile phone antenna or staying too long in its vicinity be a radiation risk?		
No, Ofcom has been carrying out radio frequency electromagnetic field (EMF) measurements near mobile phone base stations for many years.  These published measurements have consistently shown that EMF levels are well within the internationally agreed levels published in the ICNIRP Guidelines.
label: Refuted

claim: Prolonged exposure to radiofrequency radiation from a mobile phone antenna may exceed the recommended guidelines.
evi:
Has there been studies to account for how much prolonged radiofrequency radiation?		
Yes, Certificate of ICNIRP (the International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation
Protection) Safety Measurement		

Have these tests been passed?		
Yes, The PASS/FAIL result relates to the measurements taken at each location and compares the emission levels for each band of frequencies in relation to the ICNIRP standards for that band.

Each location is the document is labelled PASS.
label: Refuted

claim: Three men were hung on a crane and shot for the rape and murder of a 10-year-old boy in Yemen in August 2018
evi:
Is News360.co.za a credible news site?		
This site may contain dodgy news. Think twice about trusting any story. Think thrice about sharing.		

Where did the news story originate and is that a credible news site?		
The Daily Mail which is a UK national newspaper and credible source of news.		

Do the facts match the News 360 story?		
Yes, "Three paedophiles are publicly shot then hanged from a crane as punishment for raping and killing a 10-year-old boy in Yemen"
label: Supported

claim: Indian Prime Minister Modi launched an initiative for improving women's safety by setting up a helpline number that helps in keeping GPRS track of the vehicle that women are travelling in.
evi:
Where did this initiative start?		
in 2014, Mumbai Police under their ‘Travel Safe When Alone’ initiative, had started an SMS helpline for women travelling alone. As part of the initiative, women travelling alone at nights through autos or taxis can SMS their vehicle’s registration number to 9969777888 that helps Police to keep track of the vehicle that the woman is taking and would get her location through GPS.		

Is this still operational?		
No, this special helpline was later on shut down by Mumbai Police owing to the poor response from Women users.		

When was this claim made?		
03/06/2019		

Who started the "Travel Safe When Alone" initiative?		
The Mumbai Police today launched a free SMS service for ensuring safety of women travelling alone or in odd hours.		

When did Narendra Modi become Prime Minister of India?		
On May 26, 2014, Narendra Modi was sworn into office.		

When did the "Travel Safe When Alone" initiative launch?		
March 8, 2014
label: Refuted

claim: Former Minnesota Senator Franken was accused credibly by eight women of groping and forceable kissing, all of which were corroborated in real time.
evi:
Who was the first to accuse Senator Franken of sexual misconduct		
Leeann Tweeden		

How many women accused Senator Franken of sexual harassment		
Asides Leann Tweeden, 7 more women accused the senator		

Were the stories told by the accusers corroborated with pictures or the like		
They described specific, detailed incidents in which he put his hands on their behinds or breasts during photos. Others recalled him trying to forcibly kiss them		

Was the Senator found guilty of the accusations		
The Ethics Committee started an initial inquiry, but they never completed their work because Franken agreed to leave before they could
label: Supported

claim: Taylor Swift says most Democrats, independents, Republicans back nondiscrimination for LGBTQ people.
evi:
Did Taylor Swift state that the majority of Americans, across all political parties favour non-discrimination policies for LGBTQ people?		
Yes, Taylor Swift posted a letter on Instagram stating that a recent study shows that over 64 percent of Tennesseeans support laws for protection of LGBTQ people against discrimination. Reports are that the majority of Americans across ALL parties favour these non-discrimination policies for LGBTQ people.		

Did Taylor Swift state that the majority of Americans, across all political parties favour non-discrimination policies for LGBTQ people?		
Yes.Taylor Swift posted a letter on Instagram stating that a recent study shows that over 64 percent of Tennesseeans support laws for protection of LGBTQ people against discrimination. Reports are that the majority of Americans across ALL parties favour these non-discrimination policies for LGBTQ people.		

Was Taylor Swift correct when she said that that the majority of Americans, across all political parties favour non-discrimination policies for LGBTQ people?		
Poll results in March 2019 showed majorities of liberals (81%), moderates (76%) and conservatives (55%) all favor nondiscrimination protections for LGBT people.
label: Supported

claim: Being vegan for a year saves 6,670kg of grain.
evi:
Where does this figure come from?		
This statistic appears to come from a book “Food Choice and Sustainability: Why Buying Local, Eating Less Meat, and Taking Baby Steps Won't Work”		

Is this a reputable and accurate source?		
None of these figures for the amount of grain saved by switching to a vegan diet appears in the book, but it does give a figure of 865 million tons of grain being used to feed livestock and fish globally in the year 2011 (around 780 billion kg). It is unclear how you would get from this figure to an estimate of either 6,670kg or 7,455kg per person; that would seem to imply there are just over 100 million meat eaters in the world.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Virginia Beach USA mass shooting a "false flag" ordered by the "Deep State" to distract attention away from the investigation of "SPYgate"
evi:
When did the Virginia Beach shooting take place		
May 31, 2019		

What are the casualties of the Virginia Beach shooting		
12 people were killed and 4 other people were wounded
label: Refuted

claim: Being vegan for a year saves 365 animals.
evi:
Are there any sources for how many animals are saved by adopting a vegan diet?		
The Vegan Society estimates 37 animals per year would be saved.
1 pig, 16 fish, 19 birds and 1 laying hen.		

Are there any sources for how many animals are saved by adopting a vegan diet?		
PETA conducted a study that estimated 198 animals would be saved per year.
130 shellfish, 40 fish, 26 chickens, 1 turkey, half a pig and one tenth of a cow.		

Are there any sources for how many animals are saved by adopting a vegan diet?		
Vegancalculator.com says that 1 animal would be saved per day.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Being vegan for a year saves 3,320kg of CO2.
evi:
Can you calculate your co2 saving by being vegan?		
Through the use  calculators to see the impact you have made being vegan or vegetarian. Vegan and vegetarian lifestyles require less resources like water, food, oil, contribute less CO2 to the atmosphere		

Is the figure for saved co2 from switching to a vegan diet in the claim accurate?		
One of the academic studies used in the claim actually puts the figure for saved co2 from switching to a vegan diet at under half of what is claimed, only 1,560kg saved per year.

Despite increased public awareness of the importance of tropical rainforests, deforestation rates are actually on the rise, mostly due to activities such as commercial logging, agriculture, cattle ranching, dam-building and mining, but also due to subsistence agriculture and collection of fuel wood.

data from national surveys that ask about births and deaths are used to estimate the mortality rate”.

evi:

VARANASI: Ganesh Chaturthi was observed with religious fervour in the city on Wednesday. Devotees thronged in several temples to seek the blessings of Lord Ganesha on the occasion. Bada Ganesh, Chintamani Ganesha, Sakshi Ganesha temples of the city witnessed a large number of devotees. Meanwhile, special bhajan and kirtan were organised in different well-decorated temples, muths and ashrams in the city.
Besides, several puja committees geared up for the six- day festivity by setting up puja pandals adorning colourful and attractive idols of Lord Ganesha. Kashi Vidya Mandir is also organising Ganpati Mahotsav at Gai ghat area.
Meanwhile, in Allahabad, Several functions were organised on Ganesh chaturthi at different parts of the city.
At the historic Takshakeshwar Nath temple, the pujan began amidst recitation of vedic mantras by the priest Ravi Shankarji Maharaj accomapnied by 11 fellow priests. The deity of Lord Ganesha was decked up for the occasion after performance of the daily shringaar and the morning aarti followed by distribution of prasad.

claim: Abortion is more dangerous now than ever before
evi:
Did more women die whilst having abortions in 2019, than in earlier years?		
No, The case fatality rate was higher in the 1970's than it is today.		

Is Abortion more dangerous than ever before?		
The claim has no information about types of abortion, or what is considered dangerous. Therefore it is impossible to state definitively.		

Did more women die whilst having abortions in 2019, than in previous years?		
The case fatality rate for women dying during abortion procedures was higher in the 1970's than it is today. So fewer women died whilst having abortions in 2019, than in some previous years.		

Is abortion considered more dangerous than ever before?		
Fatality figures are produced for deaths that occur during legal abortion operations. Illegal abortions may not be recorded as the cause of death. Therefore it is difficult to compare figures, as there is no specific data that is comparable between years.		

Did more women die whilst having abortions in 2019, than in previous years in the US?		
The case fatality rate for women dying during abortion procedures was higher in the 1970's than it is today. So fewer women died whilst having abortions in 2019, than in some previous years.		

Is abortion considered more dangerous than ever before in the US?		
There is no specific data that is comparable between years.		

Has death from abortions risen or fallen since previous decades till 2019?		
By 2008 through 2014, the most recent set of data available, it had fallen to 0.62 deaths per 100,000 live births. Abortions now have less short-term risk to the health of the mother than carrying a pregnancy to term		

Are abortions in the US considered safe in 2019?		
In late 2018 a Landmark Report Concluded that Abortion In U.S. Is Safe

claim: Trump insisted that the special counsel was totally conflicted
evi:
Who was the US special council at the time of the claim?		
Robert Mueller, in full Robert Swan Mueller III, (born August 7, 1944, New York, New York, U.S.), American law enforcement official who served as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) from 2001 to 2013. In 2017–19 he was special counsel to a Department of Justice investigation into possible Russian interference in the U.S. presidential election of 2016.		

What are the basis for the claim that Robert Mueller have conflict of interests after being appointed as a special council?		
Mueller’s former law firm, WilmerHale, represents Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, who met with a Russian bank executive in December, and the president’s former campaign manager Paul Manafort, who is a subject of a federal investigation.

Legal experts said the ethics rule can be waived by the Justice Department, which appointed Mueller. He did not represent Kushner or Manafort directly at his former law firm.		

What did the US department of Justice conclude regarding the special council's conflict of interest?		
Justice Department ethics officials concluded that it is “appropriate” for recently named special counsel Robert Mueller to move forward with investigating Russia and the 2016 election, despite work by his former law firm that might overlap with his inquiry, a DOJ spokeswoman said Tuesday.

“While we cannot confirm or deny the applicability of the regulation to the matters to which Special Counsel Mueller was appointed, we can confirm that the Department ethics experts have reviewed the matters and determined that Mr. Mueller’s participation in the matters assigned to him is appropriate,” she added.
label: Refuted

claim: Barack Obama said, "Anybody can buy any weapon, any time without much, if any, regulation. They buy it over the internet. They can buy machine guns."
evi:
What are the regulations on the sale of weapons in the US?		
There are about 300 federal and state gun laws that regulate the sale and acquisition of firearms in the United States. When it comes to internet gun sales, the firearm is sent to a gun dealer who holds a federal firearms license. An FBI background check is then conducted before the firearm is transferred to the buyer.		

Can firearms be sold on the internet in the US?		
Yes, Potential gun buyers can view firearm advertisements and make
purchases from the following categories of websites: major retailers,
online retailers, online auctions and marketplaces, online classified
listings, online forums and social media networks, and Dark Web
websites.		

Who can buy a machine gun in the US?		
Contrary to popular belief, it is perfectly legal for a law-abiding American citizen to own/possess a machine gun (sometimes called a full-auto firearm or automatic weapon).

The absolute easiest way is for someone to get a Federal Firearms License or “FFL” (even a home-based FFL).

Depending on the type of FFL, the FFL-holder can purchase and sell machine guns, regardless of when they were made (more on this below), and they can even legally make their own machine guns or lawfully convert current firearms into full-autos.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

cattle outnumber people nearly 5 to 1

Concentrated Animal Feeding Operation		

Are there a lot of CAFO's in Kewaunee county?		
In recent years, more mega dairy operations called CAFOs (confined animal feeding operations) have swallowed up Kewaunee County's fragile fields.

claim:
US Republican members of the budget-writing committee sidestepped adding any
regulations to Concentrated Animal
Feeding Operations (CAFOs).
evi:
Did the US Republican members of the budget-writing committee sidestepped adding any regulations to Concentrated Animal Feeding Operations (CAFOs) ?		
No answer could be found.		

What did the US Republican members of the budget-writing committee do with regards to oversight of large-scale farm regulations?		
The committee delayed action on measures on fee changes directly tied to CAFOs, it did not
reject them. And there are clear concerns about the impact of manure on drinking water,
including cases where fecal microbes has been detected in water.		

Did Republicans on the budget-writing committee reject changes tied to CAFO?		
The Joint Committee for Review of Administrative Rules ultimately voted last fall to block a portion of the rule that had placed prohibitions on the movement of deer carcasses from CWD-affected counties. JCRAR members last month officially introduced their legislation to codify the suspension.		

What were the changes proposed for the CAFO?		
Under the proposal, now going the Republican-controlled state Legislature, five more science positions and a new bureau would be added to the DNR.

The five positions would be charged with researching water and sources of contamination, while at least two would focus on synthetic chemicals known as PFAS that are present in things ranging from firefighting foam to food packaging.

Evers is looking to add five separate staff positions to oversee concentrated animal feeding operations, or CAFOs. And he wants to up the $345 annual permit fee that CAFO owners who hold a water pollutant discharge elimination system permit have to pay.

That fee would be increased to $660 annually beginning in the first year of the budget, according to a DNR spokesman.

The budget would also create a new permit issuance fee of $3,270 for the operation of a CAFO to be implemented in the first year of the biennium, per DNR. The language would also require CAFO operators to pay $3,270 every five years thereafter for permit reissuance.

Evers’ budget doesn’t include any provisions to increase state park fees or hunting and fishing fees. But it does propose allocating around $2.8 million over the biennium from the conservation fund for the state park system. The budget doesn’t note how much funding each park would receive.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: 12% of the electorate voted for no deal in the 2019 EU parliamentary elections
evi:
What was the 2019 Eu Parliamentary elections for?		
Elections to the European Parliament take place every five years by universal adult suffrage to vote European parliament members,		

What is "no deal"?		
A no-deal Brexit (also clean break Brexit) was the potential withdrawal of the UK from the European Union (EU) without a withdrawal agreement		

How many parties supported the No Deal?		
Two parties standing in the 2019 EU parliamentary elections in Great Britain seem to support a no deal Brexit as their preferred outcome: the Brexit Party and UKIP.		

What percentage of votes did these parties get?		
These two parties won 35% of the vote in Great Britain between them (the Brexit Party got 31.6% and UKIP got 3.3%).		

What percentage of eligible voters cast a vote for a no deal party?		
34% of all UK voters who voted in the EU parliamentary elections voted for a party that seems to favour no deal, meaning about 13% of the total UK electorate voted for a no deal party.		

Was everyone who voted for a no deal party, necessarily preferring a no deal brexit?		
a poll by Lord Ashcroft taken just after the election found 67% of those reporting they had voted for the Brexit party said they thought the best Brexit outcome would be leaving the EU with no deal. 23% thought the best outcome would be some form of deal, but not the one negotiated by the government.		

How do Northern Ireland elections work?		
Single Transferable Vote (STV)
 Under STV, voters rank candidates in order of preference by marking 1, 2, 3 and so on next to the names of candidates on a ballot paper. A voter can rank as many or as few candidates as they like or just vote for one candidate.

Robert E.  Lee personally owned slaves that he inherited upon the death of his mother, Ann Lee, in 1829. 

Lee, as executor of Custis’ will and supervisor of Custis’ estates, drove his new-found labor force hard to lift those estates from debt. Concerned that the endeavor might take longer than the five years stipulated, Lee petitioned state courts to extend his control of enslaved people.		

Did Robert E. Lee do anything to show he opposed slavery?		
In this enlightened age, there are few I believe, but what will acknowledge, that slavery as an institution is a moral & political evil in any Country. It is useless to expatiate on its disadvantages. I think it however a greater evil to the white than to the black race, & while my feelings are strongly interested in behalf of the latter, my sympathies are more strong for the former.

claim: Drug Abuse Resistance Education has removed cannabis from its list of gateway drugs.
evi:
What is Drug Abuse Resistance Education?		
D.A.R.E. IS SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION EDUCATION AND MUCH MORE!

This year millions of school children around the world will benefit from D.A.R.E. (Drug Abuse Resistance Education), the highly acclaimed program that gives kids the skills they need to avoid involvement in drugs, gangs, and violence.

D.A.R.E. was founded in 1983 and has proven so successful that it has been implemented in thousands of schools throughout the United States and many other countries.

D.A.R.E. is a police officer-led series of classroom lessons that teaches children from kindergarten through 12th grade how to resist peer pressure and live productive drug and violence-free lives.		

What is a gateway drug?		
A gateway drug is a drug that opens the door to the use of other, harder drugs. Gateway drugs are typically inexpensive and readily available.		

Has DARE changed their belief about cannabis being a gateway drug?		
No, Frank Pegueros, DARE America’s president and CEO, tells me the organization’s position on that question has not changed. He says the confusion is “based on what appears to have been a partial posting of a document on our website.” The part that was posted (which has since been removed) discussed alcohol and tobacco as gateway drugs; the part discussing marijuana as a gateway drug was on a subsequent page that was not posted. “It’s obvious from looking at the document that the entire document was in fact not posted, because it only addressed tobacco and alcohol,” Pegueros says. “It didn’t address marijuana or inhalants, the typical substances considered to be gateway drugs.
label: Refuted

It is a false claim by Trump. China isn't paying the tariffs, nor are Chinese exporters funding the $16 billion in aid designated for o to U.S. farmers and ranchers. 

Instead, that money will come from the Commodity Credit Corp., part of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. The CCC was created in the 1930s to stabilize and protect farm income, with the Wall Street Journal noting it has the authority to draw $30 billion annually from the Treasury Department in support of farmers.

Yes, Teachers, university professors and researchers called on their colleagues to show integrity in the March 4 presidential election. The open letter, which was signed by almost 150 workers in the field of science and education, was received on February 3 at the disposal of Kasparov.Ru .

"Teachers can do a lot to ensure that elections are fair - voting often takes place in school buildings, the composition of election commissions is often formed from teachers and heads of educational institutions," the authors of the appeal write.

Meanwhile, only those teachers who are members of United Russia will be members of election commissions in Moscow. In addition, a distribution order for a pro-Putin rally on February 4 on Poklonnaya Hill was sent to schools. Schools are required to provide several people to participate in the rally.

The publication also claims that employees of schools and state-owned companies are forced to go on February 4 to the opposition procession "For Fair Elections" from Yakimanka to Bolotnaya Square, but with posters and slogans in support of Vladimir Putin.

114.36 Billion pounds

claim: Joe Biden told Ukrainian government leaders that if they did not sack the prosecutor going after his son then they would not give them a $2 billion loan.

Since May 7, 2014 GPO has been investigating case No42014000000000375 of alleged criminal activity of subsidiaries of Burisma in Ukraine,		

Who was the lead investigator in Ukraine investigation of Burisma?		
Prosecutor General Viktor Shokin		

Did Vice President Joe Biden tell the Ukrainian government that if they did not sack the prosecutor investigating Burisma then they would not give them a loan?		
n his own words, Biden described how he threatened Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko in March 2016 that the Obama administration would pull U.S. loan guarantees,  if it did not fire Prosecutor General Viktor Shokin		

How much was the loan being threatened to e removed?		
$1 billion in U.S		

Who is Joe Biden's Son?		
younger son, Hunter Biden.		

Was Hunter Biden connected with the Burisma company being investigated in Ukraine?		
Burisma Holdings employed Biden’s younger son, Hunter, as a board member.

Biden’s office was quoted, on the record, acknowledging Hunter Biden’s role in Burisma in a New York Times article about the general prosecutor’s Burisma case that appeared four months before Biden forced the firing of Shokin. The vice president’s office suggested in that article that Hunter Biden was a lawyer free to pursue his own private business deals.
