claim: 80%of the population continues to occupy less than 10% of the South African Land
evi:
Who made this claim?		
The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF)		

What data does the EFF base this claim on?		
The EFF bases its claim on ownership data and the size of the African and coloured population.		

Is ownership data a good representation to calculate the figures for this claim?		
The party’s national communications manager, Sixolise Gcilishe, explained  it was calculated using South Africa land redistribution numbers		

Are the calculations done by EFF using the SA land redistribution numbers accurate?		
news24 states that the EFF’s calculation makes assumptions about ownership to support a claim about the occupation of land. It incorrectly assumes white people own 82 million hectares of agricultural land and overestimates land individually owned by Indians.
label: Refuted

claim: Close to 40% of South Africans who need jobs are unemployed, meaning that more than nine million South Africans who need jobs and are capable of working cannot find employment
evi:
How many people were unemployed in South Africa in February 2019?		
According to the report and based on the official definition of unemployment, 6.2 million people were unemployed at that time.		

How many people were unemployed in South Africa in February 2019?		
According to the report and based on the official definition of unemployment, 6.2 million people were unemployed at that time. But there is some variation in which groups of people were officially counted as unemployed.		

How many people were unemployed in South Africa in February 2019?		
based on the official definition of unemployment, 6.2 million people were unemployed An additional 817,000 people without work provided reasons for failing to search for a job other than the ones contained in the definition of a discouraged work seeker.		

Does the official definition of unemployment include people who are considered "discouraged work seekers"?		
No. People who wanted to work, but did not try to find work because of a lack of jobs in their area, because they had lost hope or could not find work requiring their skills, were not counted as unemployed.		

How many people were considered discouraged work seekers?		
2.7 million.		

If you add up the discouraged work seekers and the official unemployed, does it equal 9 million unemployed people in South Africa?		
2.7 million discouraged work seekers, plus 6.2 million officially unemployed equals 8.9 million.		

How many people were considered discouraged work seekers at the time period leading up to February 2019?		
2.7 million.		

If figures include the discouraged work seekers and the official unemployed, does it equal 9 million unemployed people in South Africa in February 2019?		
2.7 million discouraged work seekers, plus 6.2 million officially unemployed equals 8.9 million.		

Are any other people classed as unemployed in South Africa?		
A further 2.7 million were identified as discouraged work seekers. -people whowanted to work, but did not try to find work because of a lack of jobs in their area,		

The claim states 'close to 40% , What does this refer to?		
The 40% refers to the the labour force (26.1 million)		

What is 40% of the 26.1 million		
Almost 9.8 million
label: Supported

claim: The post-1994 governments have cumulatively bought less than 7% of the targeted 30% of land meant for redistribution over a period of 25 years.
evi:
How much agriculture land did South Africa have in 1994 ?		
Approximately 82 million hectares of white owned agricultural land

30% of this land to the previously disadvantaged by 2014. This constitutes approximately 24.5 million hectares of the said agricultural land.		

Approximately how much land has been restored to date?		
About 30% of the 24.5m has been targeted by 2014.

Broken down as follows 
1994/95 - May 2009, amounts to 6.7m ha + 882 238ha (land redistribution: 2009 to-date) + 368 483ha (restitution: 2009 to-date), totalling 7.950 721m ha		

Has the post-1994 governments cumulatively bought less than 7% of the targeted 30% of land meant for redistribution over a period of 25 years ?		
No, it has bought about 20% of the targeted 30% of the land.

N1.2 trillion

The Federal Government has announced that a total of N1.6 trillion (N1,580,270,755,084.44) capital cost was released to Ministries, Departments and Agencies for the 2017 federal budget.

– Capital Expenditure (excluding Share of
Capital in Statutory Transfers) = N1.59 trillion
– Capital Expenditure (including share of
capital expenditure in Statutory Transfer) = N1.75 trillion

The federal government releasedd a total of 1.2 trillion naira for capital expenses according to the Minister of Finance for 2016		

How much was recorded as Nigeria's capital expenditure in 2017		
TOTAL CAPITAL EXPENDITURE 2,177,866,775,867		

How much was recorded as Nigeria's capital expenditure in 2017

The Minister of Finance, Kemi Adeosun, made this known in Abuja on Tuesday.

The N1.6 trillion total capital releases for 2017 is remarkably higher than the N1.2 trillion (N1,219,471,747,443.00) total capital releases for 2016.

claim: Obama declared Flint water crisis a National Emergency and never fixed it.
evi:
Did Obama declare a national emergency for the Flint water crisis?		
No, Obama did not declare a "national" emergency for flint. He did sign an Emergency declaration for Michigan which covered Flint since it is in that state.		

Was the city of Flint in Michigan awarded funds for the water crisis?		
Yes $167,000,000 was awarded in funding for Flints water infrastructure.		

Have works already began to repair and replace the water infrastructure in Flint?		
Overall, to date, service lines to 7,966 homes have been identified as lead and/or galvanized and have been replaced
label: Refuted

claim: In Tshwane, the Democratic Alliance (DA) inherited a deficit of over R1 billion from the African National Congress (ANC) and turned it into a surplus in a year.
evi:
Did the Democratic Alliance (DA) inherit a deficit of over R1 billion from the African National Congress (ANC)?		
The City of Tshwane had a R1.4 billion deficit in 2015/16.		

Did the Democratic Alliance (DA) inherit a deficit of over R1 billion from the African National Congress (ANC)?		
The DA inherited a Tshwane rotten to the core from your ANC. We’re working hard to fix that mess AND deliver. As an example, the DA inherited a R2bn deficit from the ANC. By the end of the first financial year in office, under DA-governance, it was corrected, with a surplus		

Did the City of Tshwane have a surplus in 2016/17?		
In 2016–17, Tshwane had a surplus of R730 million.		

Did the African National Congress (ANC) leave behind a surplus in 2016/17?		
In a Sona Debate on the 12th of February 2019, Gauteng's head of social development, Nandi Mayathula-Khoza, stated that "In Tshwane, the ANC-led government left a surplus of R736 million in 2016/17."		

how many persons could confirm the surplus		
“In Tshwane, the ANC-led government left a surplus of R736 million in 2016/17,” said Gauteng’s head of social development, Nandi Mayathula-Khoza, during the Sona debate.		

how many persons could confirm the surplus		
ANC regional chairperson Kgosi Maepa reportedly gave the same figure for the surplus.
label: Supported

claim: The German press launched a massive campaign to discredit Russian and Russian language media.
evi:
Has there been any evidence that the German press has tried to supress or discredit Russian language media?		
Earlier in January, the German Association of Journalists (DJV) urged the state media regulatory authorities not to grant a broadcasting license to the channel Russia Today for its website RT Deutsch.

“Russia Today is not an information medium for us, but a propaganda instrument of the Kremlin, which tries to make politics with disinformation," said DJV Federal Chairman Frank Überall. He added that, RT "has repeatedly invented stories in the past." There should not be a broadcasting license for a propaganda station."		

Was this a campaign against Russian Media?		
No, Following Zakharova’s press conference on January 31, DJV issued a statement saying that there was no campaign against Russian foreign media in Germany, there is only “unanimous criticism toward the methods of their work.”

The editor-in-chief of T-online.de Florian Harms, and Christian Mihr, the Managing Director of the German office of “Reporters without Borders,” an International NGO based in Paris, joined in denying the Russian allegations.

The German government also rejected Russian MFA’s accusations that German press, in cooperation with the government, are waging a campaign against Russian media. Government spokesperson Steffen Seibert said, “Those who spread such unfounded claims have little to no idea of Germany and little idea of freedom of the press. I explicitly reject such allegations.”		

Why are German media critic of Russia?		
RT and Sputnik face mistrust not only in Germany, but throughout most of Europe, including Britain and France. The French government has opened an investigation into possible Russian interference during the Yellow Vest protests last year, when social-media accounts linked to Moscow spread false news published by Russia Today and Sputnik.

An earlier fact check established that Moscow used the two outlets to undermine Emmanuel Macron’s presidential election campaign in 2017.

Macron has stated openly in the presence of Russian President Vladimir Putin that “Russia Today and Sputnik were agents of influence and propaganda that spread falsehoods about me and my campaign.”

And in December 2018, UK’s media regulator Ofcom, which has launched numerous probes of RT activities, found that the Russian channel has failed to comply with Britain’s broadcasting rules, which could result in fines and ultimately revocation of its broadcast license.
label: Refuted

If Medicaid was expanded into North Carolina what sectors of industry would see an increase in Employment?		
Ambulatory health care services, Hospitals, Construction, Retail & Wholesale trade, Food services & drinking places, Professional, scientific & technical services, Social assistance, State & local and all other sectors.		

What would be the potential job losses if Medicaid was not expanded into North Carolina.		
By 2017, potential job losses would
rise to 36,000 and would continue to climb to 43,000 by 2020.

claim: Germany owes £3.7 trillion of WWII debt.
evi:
What was the total cost of damage caused to Britain by Germany in World War 2?		
The Commission estimated damage to all properties at
£860 million at 1938 replacement cost or £1,450 million (£1.45 Billion) at 1947
values.		

What is £1.45 Billion from 1947 worth in modern day money?		
Factoring inflation alone at a rate of 4.7% as set by bank of england over this period the total amount would be £38,287,801,729.78		

Does Germany have an outstanding debt to the UK from damages that occurred during World War 2 ?		
No the debts were written off in 1990: In 1990, the treaty on the final settlement with respect to Germany was signed by West Germany, East Germany, the US, the UK, the Soviet Union and France. It allowed the recently reunited Germany to have full sovereignty over its internal and external affairs. The Government considers that that treaty definitively settled between the parties matters arising out of the second world war. The treaty was laid before the House for clearance under the Ponsonby rule. The Government have no plans to reopen any claim for reparations from Germany in respect of losses sustained during world war two, including for damage caused to UK cities.
label: Refuted

claim: More than 9 million eligible voters aren’t registered for South Africa’s 2019 elections.
evi:
Are more than a quarter of eligible voters not registered for South Africa’s 2019 elections ?		
Yes, more than 9 million eligible voters aren’t registered for South Africa’s 2019 elections.
While the number of registered voters in 2019 has increased to 26.7 million, the eligible population has increased to about 35.9 million.
This puts the registration rate at 74.5% in 2019.
This claim is correct.

claim: The problem with wind is, in the United States, we’re subsidizing these wind towers all over the place because wind doesn’t work — for the most part, doesn’t work without subsidy
evi:

Yes. The United States ranks first in the world for electricity generated from wind, according to the Department of Energy.		

Does USA have a subsidy system for wind turbines?		
A 2017 report by Management Information Services Inc found that non-hydro renewable energy (primarily wind and solar) benefited from $158 billion in federal subsidies, or 16% of the total energy subsidies, largely in the form of tax policy and direct federal expenditures on research and development (R&D).		

What do America's Wind Turbines cost to product a Megawatt of electricity?		
Lazard, an investment bank, estimated in November 2018 that unsubsidized wind costs between $29-$56 per MWh and with subsidies, wind costs between $14-$47 per MWh.		

What do America's Wind Turbines cost to product a Megawatt of electricity?		
The EIA, estimated the average cost without subsidies would be $48.80/MWh for wind turbines.		

Would America's Wind Turbines be profitable if they were not subsidised?		
No answer could be found.

claim: Chelsea Clinton said Satanism is a religion that deserves respect.
evi:
Did Chelsea Clinton specifically say that Satanism is a religion that deserves respect?		
No, Oh goodness gracious. We can be civil, cheerful, respectful to & friends with people who don’t share our religious beliefs. Sometimes, we even marry them. I’m a Methodist & my husband is Jewish, thank you for asking. A very happy New Year to you Rhonda!		

Has Chelsea Clinton ever mentioned the Church of Satan?		
Yes, In 2017, @ChurchofSatan & I were put on a few threads together. In 2018, it’s...@Hooters. What a time to be alive Chrissy!		

Is the Church of Satan involved in satanism?		
Why do Satanists worship The Devil?

We don’t. Satanists are atheists. We see the universe as being indifferent to us, and so all morals and values are subjective human constructions.

Our position is to be self-centered, with ourselves being the most important person (the “God”) of our subjective universe, so we are sometimes said to worship ourselves. Our current High Priest Gilmore calls this the step moving from being an atheist to being an “I-Theist.”

Satan to us is a symbol of pride, liberty and individualism, and it serves as an external metaphorical projection of our highest personal potential. We do not believe in Satan as a being or person.

to 15. This has resulted in the sustained participation of over 95% in schooling since the
mid to late 1990s		

What was the school enrolment rates for children aged 7-15 in 1994 in South Africa?		
It ranges from between 89.7% and 94%, depending on the age.		

What was the school enrolment rates for children aged 7-15 in 2019 in South Africa?		
No answer could be found. But figures were found for 2017 with their being 14 million learners at school in 2017		

What's the compulsory school age in South Africa?		
As stipulated in the South African Schools Act of 1996, all children between the ages of 7 and 15 are compelled to attend school.  Parents and guardians should ensure that all learners of this age are registered to go to school and that their children attend school regularly.

From 1991 to 2014, the number of higher education students funded has
increased from 7 240 to 186 150, consistently showing a higher proportion
of female students (for only two years of the 24 years is this less than
50%), African students (most – 21 of 24 years – this is higher than 85%)
followed by Coloured students, then Indian and then white students
(usually between 1,7% to 3,9%).
 The funds to support these students increased from R22m in 1991 to
R6,6bn in 2014, with the most significant growth in the years from 2010 to
2014		

Why is it not advisable to trust the data provided		
The enrolment rates for children aged seven to 15 in 1994 vary between 89.7% and 97.7%. This data was calculated using the 1994 October Household Survey. But Stats SA previously cautioned against using data from this survey because there were sampling and fieldwork issues.

claim: The NHS Long Term Plan will save 500,000 lives.
evi:
What is The NHS Long Term Plan?		
The new plan focuses on what the NHS can deliver, and how. In terms of what, the aim is to shift the NHS model of care further upstream: more preventive care, closer integration of services in the community for people with chronic conditions, better coordination of urgent care to reduce demand on emergency departments, and outpatient visits reduced by a third. Improvements are promised in priority services, including mental health, maternity, and cancer. And there is a welcome emphasis on the NHS’s role in tackling health inequalities. Gaps in life expectancy in England are wide, growing, and unjust.5		

How will the NHS Long Term Plan save 500,000 lives?		
NHS England’s Chief Executive, Simon Stevens, has written the plan at the request of the prime minister. He says it can save up to half a million lives by focusing on killer conditions and getting people to live healthier lifestyles.		

What is the breakdown of the 500,000 people saved?		
No answer could be found.		

What is the time frame the NHS plan towards saving 500,000		
NHS says itself in the plan, not all of the goals it sets are meant to be fulfilled within ten years, some are over a shorter time frame

unemployed and another 11.3 million underemployed

What was the capital expenditure component of Nigeria's spending in 2017?		
the Minister of Power, Works and Housing (PWH), Babatunde Raji Fashola suggest that his ministry did not complete any capital project in 2017, despite receiving the largest capital expenditure allocation across all parastatals. 

Despite the Ministry's reports, the Debt Management Office (DMO) stated that it released ₦1.2 trillion to finance capital projects in 2017. Given the size of Mr Fashola's ministry, it is improbable that they received none of these funds. The implication is that the Ministry received these funds too late in the year to execute for that calendar year.

That is highly plausible. Afterall, in December 2017, the Minister of Finance announced the Ministry released ₦750 billion for capital projects. These projects effectively become 2018 projects.

The majority of Almajiris in Nigeria are children from 3 to 18 years old. Community leaders say these children are totally neglected by their parents.

Yes, 2.-( 1) Every Government in Nigeria sha.ll provide free, compulsory and
Universal basic education for every child of primary and junior secondary, school age.
(2) Every parent shall ensure that his child or ward attends and completes his -
(a) primary school education; and
(b) junior secondary school education,
by endeavouring to send the child to primary and junior secondary schools.

Local government councils.

claim: Iraq and Syria have been liberated from ISIS.
evi:
Have Iraq and Syria been ‘liberated’ from ISIS, as President Trump says?		
In other words, declaring ISIS has been “beaten” or “defeated,” as President Trump did in December 2018, is flat-out wrong and would be worthy of Pinocchios.More recently, he has said that the United States has liberated “virtually 100 percent of ISIS in Iraq and Syria” and that the caliphate is “almost knocked out.” These assertions are closer to reality. ISIS can no longer claim it has a territorial caliphate in Iraq and Syria. It no longer controls land or operates a government.

That, however, doesn’t mean it could not resurge, as the president’s aides have made clear. In comparison with the last time the United States withdrew forces, the situation is eerily similar if not arguably worse.
label: Refuted

Lataji assured her fans she has no plans to retire.

“I will continue to sing till my last breath. Music is the essence of my existence.

I just can’t connect with today’s film songs. So I have bowed out. As far as non-film songs are concerned, I will continue to sing them no matter what.”		

Was the announment made by JHOOTH BOLE KAUVA KAATE

that an ousted President Trump would lead to a President Pence.

No answer could be found.		

What is Adderall?		
Adderall, the brand name for dextroamphetamine-amphetamine, is typically prescribed for conditions like attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and narcolepsy.		

Is President Donald Trump on any medication?		
His list includes Crestor for high cholesterol, aspirin to prevent heart attacks, antibiotics to treat skin rosacea, Propecia for baldness, and Ambien to help him rest on flights.

That's according to White House physician Ronny Jackson, who released information about Trump's yearly physical, which was conducted last week, at a press conference on Tuesday.

claim: Diabetes can be cured by consuming sprouted wheat for 2 days.
evi:
Is there a cure for diabetes?		
There is no cure for diabetes.		

Can Type 1 diabetes be cured?		
Diabetes can't be cured. Treatment aims to keep your blood glucose levels as normal as possible and control your symptoms.		

Is there a cure for Type 2 diabetes?		
Diabetes is a lifelong disease and there is no cure.

Some people with type 2 diabetes no longer need medicine if they lose weight and become more active.

"This false smear originated four months ago on a QAnon conspiracy account. It is obviously and categorically untrue."

Thanks for flagging. This is some very seriously fake news.

label: Supported

claim: Samora Machel said “The day you hear the whites speak of me in good terms, don’t share your secrets with me, because that means I would have betrayed you already.”
evi:
is Samora Machel quoted as saying “The day you hear the whites speak of me in good terms, don’t share your secrets with me, because that means I would have betrayed you already.”		
There is no record of him ever saying this.		

Is Samora Machel  known to be racist?		
No, quoted as saying "there are whites born in Mozambique who want to join our ranks. We do not consider these as foreigners who support us. Such a man is one of us and it is his duty, just as it is my duty, to liberate Mozambique."
label: Refuted

claim: Black Friday originated with the practice of selling off slaves on the day after Thanksgiving.
evi:
When was the term black friday first recorded in use?		
“Black Friday” was likely first used in 1951 – over 80 years after slavery ended in the US.
label: Refuted

claim: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that 33crore bank accounts were opened in Chhattisgarh.
evi:
Did PM Narendra Modi say that 33crore bank accounts were opened in Chhattisgarh?		
No, He actually said "Today we have 33 crore bank accounts opened. In Chhattisgarh alone, 1.25 crore bank accounts have been opened for the people who had never visited a bank before."
label: Refuted

claim: If a fire starts in the Yale library, all the oxygen leaves the building killing all who are inside in order to protect the rare books
evi:
Does Yale have a rare book library?		
Yes, The Yale University Library comprises three central libraries—Sterling Memorial Library, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, and the Anne T. and Robert M. Bass Library		

Does the Beinecke Library have a fire-extinguishing system removes the air from the book stacks dooming anyone inside to a slow death by asphyxiation?		
There is a kernal of truth to this. Instead of water sprinklers that would harm the rare books collections, a combination of halon and Inergen gases would be pumped into the stacks to stop the combustion process, and thus the spread of fire.

They do lower the percentage of oxygen, but not enough to kill anyone.		

What is Inergen?		
Inergen is a breathable fire extinguishing agent.
label: Refuted

claim: the United States ranks third in murders throughout the world
evi:
Does the United States rank third in murders throughout the world and would removing the cities of Chicago, Detroit, Washington D.C., St. Louis, and New Orleans from the total make the U.S. 189th out of 193 countries in the world in homicides?		
No, that's not true: The U.S.has the second highest number of homicides -- behind Brazil -- but the nation's murder rate (the number of homicides for every 100,000 population) is way down the chart globally. Those five cities account for just 8 percent of total number of homicides in the U.S. annually. Removing them would not significantly change the U.S. murder rate ranking and it would still be number two in total homicides.
label: Refuted

claim: California wildfire is as a result of poor forest management.
evi:
Did anyone from the fire services comment on the claim?		
Scott Austin, president of the Pasadena Firefighters Association said in a tweet: 
Mr. President, with all due respect, you are wrong.  The fires in So. Cal are urban interface fires and have NOTHING to do with forest management.  Come to SoCal and learn the facts & help the victims.   Scott Austin, Pres IAFF 809		

Did anyone from the fire services comment on the claim?		
Brain Rice - President of the Californias professional firefighters-
 It was ill timed. And it’s ignorant. It’s a statement of an ignorant man. … I love my country. I am proud to be an American. But I am disgusted with my president.
label: Refuted

claim: Removing the cities of Chicago, Detroit, Washington D.C., St. Louis, and New Orleans from the total would lower the ranking of the U.S. to 189th out of 193 countries in the world in homicides.
evi:
What are the highest murderous cities in the United states		
St. Louis, Atlanta, Orlando, Detroit, etc		

What is the ranking of the United states in world murder		
No answer could be found.		

What percentage of total US homicides do Chicago, Detroit, Washington D.C , St Louis and New Orleans account for?		
Those five cities account for just 8 percent of total number of homicides in the U.S. annually		

Would removing those five cities from the figures, change America's position in the world chart?		
No. Not counting those five cities, the number is still the second highest in the world.
label: Refuted

claim: Brian Kemp closed 214 polling places.
evi:
Were 214 polling stations closed while Brian Kemp was in office?		
214 

"Georgia, a state where 31 percent of the population is African American and 9 percent is Latino, has 214 fewer polling places. Georgia stands out because its counties have closed higher percentages of voting locations than any other state in our study."
label: Supported

claim: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp put 53,000 registration voters on hold, 70% of whom were Black.
evi:
How many registration voters did Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp put on hold?		
At least 53,000 voter registration applications		

How many registration votes by African Americans were put on hold?		
70% of votes by African Americans were put on hold.		

Why were 53,000 voter registrations on hold?		
Kemp’s office is holding the applications because they were flagged in the state’s “exact match” process. Under this system, information on a voter application must exactly match data on file with the state’s Department of Driver Services or the Social Security Administration. If the information does not match — often due to things like a misspelled name, a middle name not being fully written out, or a missing hyphen — an application is held for additional screening and the applicant is notified and given a period to correct their information.		

Would voters whose vote registers were held still be able to vote in person?		
Yes, Kemp’s office has repeatedly argued that voters flagged in the system will still be able to vote on Election Day if they present identification.
label: Supported

claim: Samora Machel once said, if you are applauded by white people then you must know that there is something wrong with you.
evi:
Who is Samora Machel?		
He is former president of South Africa’s neighbour Mozambique and leader of anti-colonial armed group Frelimo		

Is there any evidence that he said this?		
Shivambu, the deputy president and parliamentary chief whip of the Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) claimed that Machel used to say this, and Shivambu posted this on his twitter without sources.		

Is this in character with Machel?		
No, It was well documented that Machel was a lifelong anti-racist and welcomed white people born in Mozambique to join in Frelimo's struggle.  He also appointed white people in his government.
label: Refuted

claim: Irregular expenditure by the government of South Africa’s Western Cape province rose from R23 million in the 2016/17 financial year to R44 million in 2017/18 – an increase of R21 million.
evi:
What is irregular expenditure?		
Irregular expenditure is expenditure that was not incurred in the manner prescribed by legislation; in other words, somewhere in the process that led to the expenditure, the auditee did not comply with the applicable legislation.
Such expenditure does not necessarily mean that money had been wasted or that fraud had been committed. It is an indicator of non-compliance in the process that needs to be investigated by management to determine whether it was an unintended error, negligence or done with the intention to work against the requirements of legislation (which, for example, require that procurement should be fair, equitable, transparent, competitive and cost-effective).		

What was South Africa's Western Cape provinces irregular expenditure in 2016/17?		
R423 Billion.		

What was South Africa's Western Cape provinces irregular expenditure in 2017/18?		
R44 Million.
label: Supported

claim: Applying toothpaste on acne spots can help reduce its size.
evi:
Are there ingredients in toothpaste that help reduce acne spots better than conventional treatments		
"Toothpaste contains certain ingredients -- baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, alcohol, menthol, essential oils, triclosan -- that cause pimples to dry out,"  However, "there are no ingredients in toothpaste that make this method more effective than conventional treatments.		

Are there ingredients in toothpaste that help reduce acne spots better than conventional treatments		
Some toothpastes contain Triclosan, a bacteria-fighting agent that was more commonly found in soaps and body washes (and recently banned from most of those soap products), is the very ingredient in toothpaste that is frequently touted for its ability to dry out blemishes—but, it’s also been shown to cause hormone disruption,		

What does toothpaste do to acne		
Toothpaste irritates the skin, so some may believe that it dries out pimples, but what it really does is irritate and cause redness and peeling		

Can toothpaste be used to treat pimples?		
An internet search turns up many quick-fixes for pimples. Here’s Dr. Khetarpal’s take on some of the most common ones.

Toothpaste. Many toothpastes contain ingredients like alcohol or baking soda that may help dry out a pimple. But, toothpaste also contains other ingredients that aren’t intended to be put directly on your face. She cautions that using toothpaste to treat a pimple could possibly irritate your skin.		

What are the cons of using toothpaste on acne spots?		
Skin irritation

Applying the paste on acne is one of the most tried and tested home remedies. The ingredient triclosan kills the bacteria causing acne on the skin. This ingredient immediately acts on the pimple and gives you fast results and sounds very promising. But, this hack also comes with a lot of skin irritation. The paste is made for teeth, which means the concentration is higher and harsher, hence the itching and the burning sensation is caused.

Dryness

When it comes to those big hideous pimples, toothpaste can immediately decrease the size. You may banish the pimple size, but this will also make your skin extremely dry. If you have acne-prone skin, then you can even witness more zits with the skin irritation and dryness.

Scars

At worst situations, applying the paste on acne can also lead to scars. For those angry red zits, toothpaste will cause a lot of burning sensation, which will eventually dry out the pimple. But with such harsh reaction, sometimes you can also be left with an ugly acne scar.		

What are the cons of using toothpaste on acne spots?		
According to Dr Sharkar, "Although toothpaste will dry out your pimple, it may also leave you with dry, irritated, flaky, and peeling red skin." It's important to know that most generic toothpastes contain ingredients such as baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, alcohol, menthol, and calcium carbonate, which will irritate your skin and might even burn it, depending on how long you leave the toothpaste on. Besides, as she rightly pointed out to me, many people are already seeking out more natural or gentle alternatives to commercial toothpaste, and "if it's not good enough for brushing our teeth, why would it be good enough for treating our spots?"		

Does toothpaste help reduce acne?		
The reason why toothpaste is said to help reduce acne is an ingredient called triclosan, which is antibacterial and assists in killing the acne causing bacteria. However, triclosan is a controversial ingredient which has been liked to hormone disruption, so many companies are ditching the component altogether. So, if the toothpaste does not contain triclosan, you might not get any acne healing results.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: George Stinney Jr was 14 years old when he was convicted of murder and executed by the US state of South Carolina in 1944.
evi:
How old was George Stinney when he was convicted of murder and electrocuted		
South Carolina electrocuted 14-year-old George Stinney, the youngest person to be executed by an American state since the 1800s
label: Supported

claim: Women have to be 25 years old, married, have at least one son and one daughter, and have her husband's consent to get a tubal ligation.
evi:
What is the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists recommendations to physicians about tubal ligation?		
The Committee on Practice Bulletins-Gynecology of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) has released a practice bulletin on sterilization. “ACOG Practice Bulletin No. 46: Benefits and Risks of Sterilization” appears in the September 2003 issue of Obstetrics and Gynecology.

According to ACOG, tubal sterilization may be recommended as a safe and effective method for women who desire permanent contraception. Women should be counseled that tubal ligation is not intended to be reversible; therefore, those who do not want permanent contraception should be counseled to consider other methods of contraception.

To reduce future regret, the patient and her partner, when appropriate, should be counseled.
label: Refuted

claim: Mayonnaise containing starch is harmful.
evi:
Are foods containing starch harmful?		
No, Starchy foods are our main source of carbohydrate and have an important role in a healthy diet.		

Does mayonnaise contain starch?		
Generally yes although starch free mayonnaise has been developed.
label: Refuted

claim: Shops buy apples that are coated with wax.
evi:
Do apples naturally have a coat of wax?		
Yes, Pick an apple off a tree, buff it a little and it will shine! That’s because the fruit is coated with a layer of natural wax that protects it from drying out and helps to prevent fungi from getting a foothold.		

What is an apple's natural wax made of?		
The wax is a mixture of up to fifty different compounds, most of which fall into the chemical category known as esters. There are also alcohols like heptacosanol and malol as well as hydrocarbons such as triacontane, C30H62. This compound can also be isolated from petroleum and is sometimes applied to fruit to supplement its natural wax. In that case chemophobes kick and scream about a petroleum derivative being applied to their fruit but there is no difference between triacontane produced by an apple isolated from petroleum.		

Do shop bought apples still have their natural wax?		
No, After apples are picked they are washed before they appear in the supermarket to remove dirt and chemical residues. This process also removes the wax. Since the waxy layer prevents moisture in the apple from escaping, its loss shortens the storage time for the fruit.		

Do apple producers spray them with wax?		
Yes, Producers therefore spray the fruit with a thin layer of wax to prevent such moisture loss as well as to make the apple look more appealing. The applied layer is very thin, only about 3 mg of wax coat an apple.
label: Supported

claim: A video claiming to show “shocking secrets of the food industry” said You can check whether honey has been diluted with sugar syrup by washing it in water to reveal a honeycomb pattern and the honey’s genetic memory.
evi:
Why does a honeycomb-like pattern sometimes appear when you mix honey in water?		
University of the Sunshine Coast's Dr Peter Brooks, a chemist with extensive knowledge of the chemical composition of honey, said he would not trust results to come out of DIY tests found on the internet. "We see a lot of honeys coming through our lab … they can be anything from thin, depending on the species of tree it comes from, or it can be very thick," Dr Brooks said. "I imagine honeys we test in our labs, half of them would pass these tests and half would fail, almost randomly. "And if you get a good fake honey, one that simulates honey fairly well, you can't tell the difference by the tests they're proposing between a good fake honey and a normal honey. "Good fake honeys are made to mimic a real honey, and they're very hard to tell the difference between them sometimes. I don't think you can tell the difference on these simple tests."		

Does honey have a genetic memory?		
No, Honey is made up of carbohydrates, proteins, amino acids, vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and other compounds. It contains no genetic material, therefore does not have 'genetic memory'.
label: Refuted

claim: IF any Nigerian Bank fails to return your money within 24 hours of a failed online transfer, they will be fined 10,000 naira. The money goes to YOU! All you need to do is report the issue to Central Bank (cpd@cbn.gov.ng) and they will surely take it up.
evi:
As of the date of the claim, was there a regulation in place stipulating how Nigerian financial institutions should react to failed payments?		
A circular to all financial institutions in September 2018, directing them to reverse failed payments -- official name being Nigeria Inter-Bank Settlement System (NIBSS) Instant Payment (NIP) -- into customers’ accounts within a day, or pay a  10,000 naira ($28) fine for each item “based on complaints of sender and/ or beneficiary.		

Does official documentation state  affected customers stand in line to recieve the 10,000 naira fine for a failed online transfer?		
No, The regulation is completely silent on where each 10,000 naira fine goes.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Sen. Ted Cruz's 2018 campaign tried to trick elderly Texans with suspicious mailers
evi:
Was there anything controversial about any campaign letters sent out by Senator Ted Cruz in 2018?		
Ted Cruz’s Senate re-election campaign has been sending voters in Texas a fund-raising letter in an envelope labeled “summons enclosed,” drawing criticism from some who called it misleading and raising questions about whether such a practice was legal.

Confusion arises not just from the letter itself but from the envelope it arrives in.

The fund-raising appeal comes in an envelope with the words “SUMMONS ENCLOSED — OPEN IMMEDIATELY” written across it in large capital letters. In the upper left-hand corner are three lines of text: “Official Travis County Summons, Voter Enrollment Campaign Division, Ted Cruz for Senate 2018.”		

Were the 2018 campaign letters sent out by Ted Cruz in envelopes labelled “summons enclosed”, directly targeting elderly Texans?		
No, However the concern that elderly voters could be tricked was raised when a photo of one of the letters was posted to Twitter on Sunday by Sean Owen, a data scientist who said it arrived at his home in Austin, Tex., and was addressed to his grandmother, who lived there until she died in April.

“My grandmother was facing cognitive decline at the end of her life and I think if she’d read this she might have been deceived by it,” he said in a phone interview. “It feels shady.”		

Were the 2018 campaign letters sent out by Ted Cruz in envelopes labelled “summons enclosed”, illegal?		
No, The practice is legal according to Myles Martin, a spokesman for the Federal Election Commission, who said the salient question was whether a mailing contains a disclaimer saying that it came from a political campaign. And this one did.

Aside from that, he said in an email, “the F.E.C.’s regulations don’t speak to how candidates may choose to word particular solicitations to potential contributors.”

The letter inside the envelope is more clearly part of a fund-raising effort. The Cruz campaign logo appears at the top of the letter and recipients are given the option to donate a preselected amount of money or to write in their own denominations.

The letter echoes its envelope, though, in its use of language — like “campaign summons” and “conservative affirmation” — that sounds more legal than colloquial.		

Did the 2018 campaign letters sent out by Ted Cruz in envelopes labelled “summons enclosed” raise any ethical concerns?		
Yes, The San-Antonio Express News wrote an editorial headlined: Cruz should rethink his "summons" mailer.
The editorial said:
“.. the problem is the Cruz campaign has made the envelope look much like a legal summons, which can be pretty serious. A summons occurs when a person is sued or ordered to appear in court. Most people are probably not thrilled about getting such a summons.

A reader brought this mailer to our attention because she viewed it as misleading and intimidating. 

… we think the Cruz campaign could do without the legal summons language on the envelope. It’s just too official looking…. It’s understandable he would want to summon conservative support. But certainly his campaign can do that without making it look like a legal threat, right?”
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Consuming a wax-coated apple can kill you.
evi:
What is the wax covering apples?		
It’s not artificial, but a natural wax that we call “Abura-agari” in Japanese.		

Why are apples covered in wax?		
Fruits like plums, apples, pears etc. have natural wax covering for the retainment of moisture and firmness, and slow down of the natural degradation.

But it is not possible for the farmers and the storekeepers to keep the fruits fresh and juicy for several months at a stretch. Additional food grade wax is being used for increasing the fruit’s shelf-life.		

Is the wax on Apples toxic?		
No. It is not toxic. Apples grow with a natural wax. Pick an apple straight from the tree and it does not have that shiny supermarket lustre. However, rub a freshly picked apple with a cloth or on your thigh like a spin bowler and it will quickly shine up. Apples bound for the greengrocer and supermarket are generally washed, polished and coated in a food-grade glazing agent. Fifteen per cent of Australian apples are coated in carnauba wax made from the leaves of a tropical palm straight from the tree. Most of the other 85 per cent are coated in shellac which is made from the lac beetle. It is not made from the beetle itself but a secretion produced by the female lac beetle to protect her eggs. Another little thing vegans need to look out for. You'll find similar glazing agents on shiny confectionary. For people who are very sensitive to bitterness the wax can be perceived as a little bit bitter.		

Is the natural wax on apples safe for consumption?		
Since it is of natural origin, it is safe to eat the wax. The linoleic acid and the oleic acid are types of *unsaturated fatty acids and said to have a rich nutritional value.
(*Unsaturated fatty acid helps decrease bad cholesterol.)		

Is the artificial wax sometimes added onto apples toxic?		
The FDA has certified both the Shellac and Carnauba wax as risk-free for human consumption. Shellac, beewax, petroleum jelly and carnauba are edible waxes. Shellac is used for apple and other fruits coating to make them look shinier. D. Manoharlal (Shellac) Pvt. Ltd., the most prominent Shellac manufacturer of India, has opined that it can be used in coating medicines, confectioneries, food, hats, wood, and cosmetics safely as replacement of Candelilla and Carnauba Wax.
label: Refuted

claim: Egyptian authorities are carrying atrocious acts which results in injustice
evi:
What kinds of recorded atrocities have there been in Egypt under President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi?		
Human Rights Watch wrote in its World 2020 report: “Under the guise of fighting terrorism, Egyptian authorities showed utter disregard for the rule of law. Since April 2017, President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi has maintained a nation-wide state of emergency that gives security forces unchecked powers. Security forces used torture and enforced disappearances systematically against dissidents from all backgrounds. Egypt’s use of mass trials and the death penalty has mounted, including death sentences against children and death sentences issued in military trials.”		

What kinds of recorded atrocities have there been in Egypt under President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi?		
The police and National Security Agency routinely carry out systematic enforced disappearances and torture with impunity. Torture practices have also affected well-known activists such as Alaa Abdel Fattah and Israa Abdel Fattah. Authorities keep thousands of prisoners in abysmal conditions, where overcrowding and insufficient medical care have been systematic and may have contributed to the deteriorating health and deaths of scores of detainees.		

What kinds of recorded atrocities have there been in Egypt under President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi?		
Egyptian security forces, mainly the army, as well as ISIS-affiliated militants, committed serious and widespread abuses in North Sinai, some of which amount to war crimes, since the conflict escalated in late 2013. Human Rights Watch documented several indiscriminate and possibly unlawful air and ground attacks by security forces. Human Rights Watch also documented 50 cases of arbitrary arrests, of whom 39 were likely forcibly disappeared; at least 14 have been missing for three or four years. Both sides carried out extrajudicial killings. Since 2014, Human Rights Watch has documented 20 extrajudicial killings of residents by government forces.

The army has  arrested and forcibly disappeared children as young as 12. An army spokesman acknowledged some child detentions, justifying them as part of the army’s counterterrorism operations.
label: Supported

claim: 80% of workers in Nike overseas factories are women
evi:
what percentage of the workforce in factories including NIKE are women?		
Workers on the factory floor are overwhelmingly women. In developing nations, women comprise 80% of the apparel workforce. These women do tedious work for long hours, often in unsafe conditions– far from home, and for minimal wages.		

Are there more women than men working in Nike's overseas factories?		
A CBC investigative report in October 1996 found that 25,000 workers, mostly young women, work in Vietnamese factories.		

Where are Nike's overseas factories based?		
75 percent of Nike’s front-line labor force is based in Vietnam, China and Indonesia, representing around 400,000 workers.		

What percentage of the workforce in overseas Nike factories is made up of women?		
Nike estimates that 80 percent of these workers are women aged 18 to 24
label: Supported

claim: Teenage white girl to be tried as 300-pound black man in the USA.
evi:
Who printed the story about the teenage white girl being tried as a black man?		
The Onion		

What sort of publication is the Onion?		
Satire - the satirical weekly has been publishing sardonic news parodies and goofy advice columns since 1988 (the off-kilter interviews didn’t come until the early ’90s)
label: Refuted

claim: Muslims were filmed while attacking a Hindu Temple in Uttar Pradesh in India.
evi:
What have reports said about the attack?		
Villagers who went to pray at the temple on Sunday morning found the gate shut and heard cries for help. Temple priest Vinod Sharma and sewadar Sultan were murdered in the attack.		

What has the police discovered about the incident?		
When the rural and Karnal police broke into the temple and entered inside the temple, priest Vinod Sharma of Badnara village of Nising and Sevadar Sultan, a resident of Saharanpur in UP, were found lying dead inside. He was stabbed to death with a sharp weapon, while priest Ravindra Sharma of Bhambrehari village of Assandh, priest Ajay Sharma of Sangoha village and servant Harjinder Singh were seriously injured. His hands and feet were tied with cloth and rope. Karnal SP Surendra Singh Bhauria, DSP Virendra Saini reached the spot along with the police force. The SP has given instructions to get the matter investigated on every aspect. there, Being adjacent to the border, the Jhinjhana police also gathered information about the case.		

Have the attackers been identified?		
Hindi news websites that reported the murders have not mentioned the identity of the suspects or even insinuated that they could be Muslims. The investigation in the case is ongoing.
label: Refuted

claim: The minimum wage should be £18 an hour, because in 1999 one hour’s pay at minimum wage could buy you 72 Freddos, but in 2017 it could only buy you 30 Freddos.
evi:
How much did Freddos cost in 1999?		
The Freddo – that frog-shaped lump of Cadbury’s chocolate much appreciated by those who don’t want a whole Dairy Milk but wouldn’t mind a little something-or-other now you mention it – originally hit Britain’s shelves in the mid-90s, when it was priced at 10 pence.		

What was the UK minimum wage in 1999?		
£3.60 - so you could get 36 freddos.		

How much did Freddos cost in 2017?		
30p.		

What was the UK minimum wage in 2017?		
£7.50 for those aged 25 and over, and £7.05 for those aged 21-14.
label: Refuted

claim: Cyril Ramaphosa retorted to Donald Trump’s  2018 comments on land reform in South Africa on Twitter
evi:
What was Donald Trump's original tweet in this claim?		
"I have asked Secretary of State
@SecPompeo
to closely study the South Africa land and farm seizures and expropriations and the large scale killing of farmers. “South African Government is now seizing land from white farmers"		

What was the supposed reply by President Cyril Ramaphosa?		
I have asked @GenBheki_Cele to closely study the USA mass shootings and large killings of unarmed civilians. "USA Government is now killing unarmed African Americans"		

Did this come from South Africa's president, Cyril Ramaphosa's official account?		
No, It does not appear on their offical account and it looks like the tweet in the screenshot was taken from someone posing as Ramaphosa online. Alternatively, it’s possible that they used an online generator to produce the post.
label: Refuted

claim: Research carried out by an American NGO has concluded that men are likely to die after being circumcised due to a medication that reacts after 10 years.
evi:
Is there an article from Deltas Clares (The study researchers) on wikileaks		
There is no evidence of them having published a paper concerning the claim on wikileaks		

Is there a particular drug used for circumcision		
No answer could be found.
label: Refuted

claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free transport as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.
evi:
Can MP's Claim travel expenses?		
9.1 Travel and Subsistence claims may be made for the costs of travel, and travel-related
subsistence incurred by MP or others, which are in support of the MP's parliamentary
functions.		

What types of travel expenses can be claimed by MP's?		
9.2 MPs may claim for travel by public transport, private transport, taxis and hire cars.		

Is there a limit on what MP's can claim for Public transport travel costs?		
9.13 For journeys by public transport, MPs may buy a ticket of any class but (except where
paragraph 9.14 applies) reimbursement will be limited to the rate of an economy class ticket
available at the time of booking. In the case of air travel, ‘economy’ includes ‘flexible
economy’.

9.14 For journeys made by rail, reimbursement will be limited to the rate of an ‘anytime standard
open’ ticket for the journey prevalent at the time of the claim.

9.15 MPs travelling on sleeper train services are additionally entitled to claim for a sleeper
supplement for a single occupancy berth.

9.16 Where an MP obtains a railcard or season ticket which allows savings to be made on future
purchases of rail tickets, reimbursement of the cost of the railcard may be claimed.		

Is there a limit on what MP's can claim for Private transport travel costs?		
9.17 Private cars, motorcycles or bicycles may be used as an alternative to public transport. An MP
undertaking a journey by private transport will be reimbursed in accordance with the rates set
by Parliament and administered by HMRC. If the rates change during the year, IPSA will
reimburse claims according to the new rates from the date at which they take effect.

9.18 MPs using private transport may claim reimbursement of the costs of parking charges,
congestion and ultra-low emission zone charging and road tolls. Penalty charges or additional
charges for late payment, or civil charges for traffic, parking or other violations, will not be
reimbursed.		

Is there a limit on what MP's can claim for Taxi travel costs?		
9.19 Taxi fares will only be reimbursed when a journey by taxi is necessary because:
a. no other reasonable method of transport is available for all or part of the journey; or
b. alternative methods of transport are impracticable due to pregnancy, disability, illness
or injury of the MP or staff member; or
c. MPs have been working on parliamentary business after 10pm, as set out in paragraph
9.33.

9.20 When submitting claims for taxi journeys MPs must include a note on the reasons for taking a
taxi rather than using public transport.		

Is there a limit on what MP's can claim for Hire car travel costs?		
9.21 Hire cars may be used where there is no reasonable alternative. MPs may claim for the cost of
hiring the vehicle, of any fuel used, and insurance purchased.
label: Supported

claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free use of a gym as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.
evi:
Is there a parliamentary gym?		
Yes, The Westminster Gym.		

Is the Westminster Gym free to use for MP's?		
No the monthly Cost is £25 - £35 a month depending on hours of use.
label: Refuted

claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free stationery as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.
label: Supported

claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free mobile phone calls as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.
evi:
Are MPs allowed to claim expenses for running constituency offices such as telephone costs		
Yes, They are permitted to		

Did MP Iain Duncan Smith make claims for the telephone costs		
Yes, He did for the years he was an MP

claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free accommodation as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons
evi:
What is Iain Duncan Smith's constituency?		
Chingford and Woodford Green		

Where is Chingford and Woodford Green?		
London		

Do MP's get free accommodation?		
Ministerial or official residences are properties assigned to ministers by
the Prime Minister either on the grounds of security or to allow them to
better perform their official duties, including official hospitality.
Official residences available to government ministers include:
• Flats above 10 and 11 Downing Street, which are available for the
Prime Minister and Chancellor of the Exchequer;
• 1 Carlton Gardens, leased from the Crown Estate, which has been
used as the official residence for the Foreign Secretary;1
• Flats in Admiralty House;
• Hillsborough Castle and Stormont, which are available for
ministers in the Northern Ireland Office while on duty in Northern
Ireland.
In addition, three stately homes – Chequers, Dorneywood and
Chevening – are available to ministers for both official and private use.
None of these properties are owned by the Government.		

Do MP's get free accommodation?		
The accommodation costs budget is designed to meet costs incurred by MPs as a result of
working from two permanent locations.
Eligibility
4.2 Accommodation costs are not payable to MPs who:
a. are London Area MPs; or
b. by virtue of any particular office held, occupy 'grace and favour' accommodation in
London		

Can MP's claim for a second residence if they live in London?		
Second, the availability of additional
accommodation should be withdrawn from a number of MPs whose constituency homes are within
reasonable commuting distance of Westminster. Third, the London cost allowance, analogous to London
weighting and paid to MPs not entitled to secondary accommodation
label: Refuted

claim: Sarah Jeong the former New York Times writer says that "we need a castration lottery for white men".
evi:
Is there any evidence that Jeong made this statement?		
No, There is no evidence Jeong made the statement, and the misattributed quote appears to come from a series of fake quotes that emerged on social media after she joined The New York Times in August 2018 as an editorial board staff writer. There is, however, no record of Jeong making the statement. A search of her verified Twitter account, as well as her Facebook page, didn’t turn up any matches. An archived version of her Twitter timeline from early August 2018 shows no such tweet on July 31 of that year, and Check Your Fact also didn’t find any credible media outlets attributing the quote to her. (RELATED: Did The NYT Publish An Op-Ed Comparing Kim Yo Jong To Elizabeth Warren?)		

Where did this claim first appear?		
The quote about a “castration lottery” for white people was first shared on the online message board 4chan in August 2018, around the same time a number of other fake quotes misattributed to Jeong were shared on the website, according to Snopes. One user in that 4chan thread posted a fabricated tweet that Jeong supposedly sent July 31, 2018.		

What type of website is 4Chan		
To the uninitiated, 4chan can best be described as a bulging cyst on the ass of the internet
label: Refuted

claim: One of the conflicts of interest that special counsel Robert Mueller had that prevented him from conducting an impartial investigation, was that President Donald Trump interviewed Mueller to be FBI director but turned him down.
evi:
Was special counsel Robert Mueller interviewed by President  Donald Trump in 2017 for the post of the director of the FBI?		
President Donald Trump interviewed Robert Mueller as a potential replacement for fired FBI Director James Comey the day before he was named special counsel, a White House official said Tuesday.		

What date did special council Robert Mueller interview for the role of FBI director with President Donald Trump?		
May 16 2017.
label: Supported

claim: Flu shots are killing elderly citizens in record numbers.
evi:
What study is the claim linked to?		
The 2005 JAMA study		

Did the study report an increased amount of deaths in the elderly from having the flu shot?		
The 2005 JAMA study did not report an increased number of deaths from the flu shot in the elderly - it simply found that previous studies had overestimated the number of deaths prevented by flu shots.
label: Refuted

claim: Unemployment in the united states is only low because everyone has two jobs.
evi:
What is the statistics for 2017 of Americans holding more than one job		
4.9 percent of workers held more than one job at the same time in 2017		

What has been the trend in the number of people holding more than one job since before 2017		
After reaching a peak of 6.2 percent during 1995–96, the multiple jobholding rate began to recede. By the mid-2000s, the rate had declined to 5.2 percent and remained close to that level from 2006 to 2009. In 2010, the multiple jobholding rate decreased to 4.9 percent and has remained at 4.9 percent or 5.0 percent from 2010 to 2017.		

What is the relationship between the number of people working more than one job and the rate of unemployment		
The unemployment rate is not directly tied to the number of people working more than one job
label: Refuted

claim: Alison Buttligieg developed depression after witnessing the scene of a deer who sacrificed her life.

A photographer.		

Did Buttigieg claim to have depression after taking a photo of a deer sacrificing its life?		
No, She wrote on her social media that ... implications I fell into depression after I took the photo are  complete fiction

evi:
How many US Congress members have Israeli dual citizenship		
None, as far as I know. You can find lists online, that claim that all Jewish members of the US Senate and House of Representatives have Israeli citizenship. But when you look into these claims yourself, you can’t seem to find evidence that these people actually have Israeli citizenship.

We have acted in close co-operation.” He further talked about his relationship with Prime Minister Modi and said, “Surely there have been divergences of views but we have been able to keep divergences only to ourselves, they didn’t affect relations between President and Prime Minister.”

Every convocation ceremony in Nigeria, there is a best graduating student but no one ever talks about them except in really rare cases but that’s not same with India, as you have seen clearly.

claim: The MMR vaccination weakens children's brains ultimately leading to autism.
evi:
What's the medical publication correlating between MMR vaccination and Autism in children?		
That paper was published in the Lancet on 28 February 1998. It was retracted on 2 February 2010.2 Authored by Andrew Wakefield, John Walker-Smith, and 11 others from the Royal Free medical school, London, it reported on 12 developmentally challenged children,3 and triggered a decade long public health scare.		

Was this paper later on proven to be a fraud?		
Yes, As the ensuing vaccine scare took off, critics quickly pointed out that the paper was a small case series with no controls, linked three common conditions, and relied on parental recall and beliefs.4 Over the following decade, epidemiological studies consistently found no evidence of a link between the MMR vaccine and autism.5 6 7 8 By the time the paper was finally retracted 12 years later,9 after forensic dissection at the General Medical Council’s (GMC) longest ever fitness to practise hearing,10 few people could deny that it was fatally flawed both scientifically and ethically.
label: Refuted

claim: Condoleezza Rice summed up the Democratic Party in 75 words.
evi:
What were the 75 words?		
f you are taught bitterness and anger, then you will believe you are a victim. You will feel aggrieved and the twin brother of aggrievement is entitlement. So now you think you are owed something and you don’t have to work for it and now you’re on a really bad road to nowhere because there are people who will play to that sense of victimhood, aggrievement and entitlement, and you still won’t have a job.”		

Did Condoleezza Rice  say these words?		
No, Similar words were said, "My fellow Americans, ours has never been a narrative of grievance and entitlement. We have never believed that I am doing poorly because you are doing well. We have never been jealous of one another and never envious of each other’s successes. No, no, ours has been a belief of opportunity. And it has been a constant struggle, long and hard, up and down, to try to extend the benefits of the American dream to all."		

were those words aimed at democratic party		
No, it is clear that she was advocating for Republican candidates in both speeches.
label: Refuted

claim: There is a new initiative under the National program for Bovine Breeding and Dairy development with an allocation of 500 crore rupees
evi:
What is the name of the new initiative under the national program for Bovine Breeding and Dairy Development?		
The new scheme is called the “Rashtriya Goukul Mission”		

What is the total allocation for the Rashtriya Goukul Mission in Crore Rupees?		
The total allocation is Rs. 190 Crores for 2017-2018 and Rs. 301.50 crores for 2018-2019 giving a total of Rs. 491.50 Crores.

claim: 20 Gokul Grams are being established and 41 Bull Mother farms will be modernized.
evi:
How many Gokul Grams are being established?		
No answer could be found.		

How many Bull mother farms are being modernized?		
No answer could be found.		

What are Gokul Grams?		
The Rashtriya Gokul Mission aims to conserve and develop indigenous breeds in a focused and scientific manner.		

What are Gokul Grams?		
Integrated Indigenous Cattle Centres also known as Gokul Grams, Gokul Gram will act as Centres for development of Indigenous Breeds and a dependable source for supply of high genetic breeding stock to the farmers in the breeding tract. The Gokul Gram will be self sustaining and will generate economic resources from sale of A2 milk, organic manure, vermi-composting, urine distillates, and production of electricity from bio gas for in house consumption and sale of animal products. The Gokul Gram will also function as state of the art in situ training centre for Farmers, Breeders and MAITRI’s.

claim: Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA) was ‘launched to ensure good health of mother and child’.
evi:

According to the official website, ‘the PMSMA has been launched by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW), Government of India. The program aims to provide assured, comprehensive and quality antenatal care, free of cost, universally to all pregnant women on the 9th of every month. PMSMA guarantees a minimum package of antenatal care services to women in their 2nd/3rd trimesters of pregnancy at designated government health facilities’.

As per the official website, the PMSMA envisages improvement in the quality and coverage of Antenatal Care (ANC) including diagnostics and counselling services as part of the Reproductive Maternal Neonatal Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCH+A) Strategy

claim: There has been a reduction in the MRP (Material requirements planning) of DAP, MOP, and complex fertilizers
evi:
Did the prices od DAP and MOP reduce in the years prior to this claim?		
It is true that the prices of DAP, MOP and other complex fertilizers reduced in the year 2016 as prices had come down in the international market and this reduction was purely because of market dynamics.		

Was this reduction to the government or it's policies?		
No, The government or its policies had very little to do with this reduction. In fact, the prices of DAP & MOP have again increased by more than 25% and 50% respectively between December 2017 & October 2018. The increase was again because of market dynamics.
label: Refuted

evi:

As is the case of the previous claim, there is no other data available in the public domain to verify the increase in crop yield or nitrogen use efficiency.

claim: The Indian Government (BJP) claimed that the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) provided a cash incentive of 6000 rupees to the pregnant/lactating women.

how much is the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) giving pregnant women		
According to an answer in Lok Sabha ‘the maternity benefit under PMMVY is available to the eligible beneficiaries for first living child of family. Normally, the first pregnancy of a woman exposes her to new kinds of challenges and stress factors. Hence, the scheme provides support to the mother for the safe delivery and immunization of her first child. Under the scheme Rs. 5,000  is provided to the eligible beneficiary in three installments. The eligible beneficiary also receives the remaining cash incentive as per approved norms towards maternity benefit under Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) after institutional delivery so that on an average, a woman gets Rs.6,000’.

yes both were 4 Lakh, or very close.

claim: Overall inflation in India is falling: 8.48% (2014) to 4.87% (2015) to 5.47% (2016) to 2.99% (2017) to 4.58% (2018).
evi:
Is the economy in India grew at a robust rate, with 7.4% GDP growth forecast for FY 2018-19 ?		
As per the first advance estimates of National Income, growth in GDP during 2018-19 is estimated at 7.2%.  As per the second advance estimates of National Income, growth in GDP during 2018-19 is estimated at 7%, down from the 7.2% estimated during the first advance estimates. Hence the claim is FALSE.		

Did the inflation drop in India from 8.48% in 2014 to  4.58% in 2018 ?		
The Year on Year (YoY) inflation in the country has been gradually decreasing (except for an abrupt rise in 2016). It reached a lowest of 1.46% in June 2017, but has been increasing ever since. Hence, the claim is TRUE. However, it is important to also keep in mind the international trends.		

Did the food inflation drop down in India from 9.19% in 2014 to 3% in 2018 ?		
While the absolute numbers are slightly off the mark, the trend in the fall in food inflation is TRUE.
label: Supported

claim: The Indian Government (BJP) claimed that the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) benefited more than 50 lakh women every year.

As on 31.10.2018:

No. of Beneficiaries enrolled: 56,29,662

No. of beneficiaries paid: 46,54,956



Total maternity benefits paid		

According to the statement by Government of India Ministry of Women and Child Development, Lok Sabha, how many women were paid maternity benefits by the scheme in 2018.		
As on 31.10.2018:

No. of beneficiaries paid: 46,54,956		

What is the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)?		
Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) Scheme enables beneficiaries to receive the scheme benefits through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) in furtherance of the objectives of encouraging improved health seeking behavior among Pregnant Women and Lactating Mothers (PW&LM).		

How many beneficiaries are covered annually by the PMMVY programme?		
About 51.70 lakh beneficiaries are covered annually under PMMVY.
label: Supported

claim: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) provides economic support to pregnant women and lactating mothers.
evi:
Does the PMMVY provide economic support to Pregnant women and lactating mothers?		
Yes, The Ministry of Women and Child Development is implementing Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) with the objectives of (i) providing partial compensation for the wage loss in terms of cash incentive so that the woman can take adequate rest before and after delivery of the first child; and (ii) the cash incentive provided to improve health seeking behavior amongst the Pregnant Women & Lactating Mothers (PW&LM).		

Does the PMMVY offer economic support to all pregnant women and lactating mothers?		
No, The maternity benefit, are available to a woman for the first living child of family subject to fulfillment of conditionalities. All the pregnant women and lactating mothers in regular employment with Central Government or State Governments or Public Sector Undertakings or those who are in receipt of similar benefits under any law for the time being in force, are excluded.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

The report does not back up this claim with research.		

What are the advantages of the 100% Neem coating?		
No answer could be found.		

What have reports found regarding 100% Neem Coating?		
A annual (2017-18) report of the Department of Fertilizers found that " The Neem Coated Urea has received high
acceptance among the farmers considering its benefits on soil
fertility/conservation, higher yield pest
control."

The table in the same report shows that India's growth is the highest when compared to any other country’s economy and also highest among the Emerging Market & Developing Economies (EMDEs) for 2018-19.		

What was India's percentage change of real GDP  at the year before that of the claim in 2019?		
India’s growth accelerated to an estimated 7.3% in FY2018/19 (April to March)

was India's economy still the fastest growing large economy at the time of the claim?

The Lagos State governor-elect, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, has said he will end the protracted gridlock in Apapa area of the state within the first 60 days of his administration.

claim: Bloodletting can save a stroke victim.
evi:
What is a stroke		
A stroke is a medical emergency that happens when the blood flow to your brain is interrupted. Without blood, your brain cells start to die. This can cause serious symptoms, lasting disability, and even death.		

Can blood letting be used to save a stroke victim		
No, Bloodletting or therapeutic phlebotomy is used in blood disorders in which the removal of RBCs or serum iron is the most efficient method for managing the symptoms and complications
label: Refuted

claim: Slaked lime can cure over 70 diseases.
evi:
What is slaked lime?		
another name for calcium hydroxide, esp when made by adding water to calcium oxide		

Does slaked lime have medicinal uses?		
It has a strong base pH and is used for many purposes, often under its more common name, slaked lime. The National Institutes of Health warns that calcium hydroxide is also toxic and can introduce serious health problems as a result of various types of exposure.		

Is it dangerous to take slaked lime internally?		
Yes, Accidental ingestion of calcium hydroxide can cause severe throat pain, a burning sensation in the mouth, abdominal pain, vomiting, bloody stool or vomit, rapidly falling blood pressure and collapse, according to the National Institutes of Health.
label: Refuted

claim: Nearly 1.5 crore doses of Rotavirus vaccine launched in India in March 2016 have been administered to India's children.
evi:
What is the Rotavirus?		
Rotavirus is a virus that causes severe diarrhea and vomiting. It affects mostly babies and young children. Diarrhea and vomiting can lead to serious dehydration (loss of body fluid). If dehydration is not treated, it can be deadly.		

When did the Indian government begin the Rotavirus vaccination roll-out?		
26th March 2016		

How many doses of Rotavirus vaccinations have been administered to India's children?		
Rotavirus vaccine has been administered to about 1.41 crores children across these nine states (as on February 2018).		

Where has the Rotavirus vaccination been introduced in India so far?		
Rotavirus vaccine has been introduced in 9 states namely Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh. Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Assam, Tripura and Tamil Nadu.		

How many states are there in India?		
28		

How many children does the Indian government aim to immunise against Rotavirus through vaccination?		
The nationwide rotavirus vaccine programme aims to immunise 27 million children across the country.
label: Supported

claim: Around 8 crore of India's children have been given the Measles Rubella (MR) vaccination, which was launched in India in February 2017.
evi:
When was the Measles Rubella (MR) vaccination, launched in India?		
from August 2017 with the aim to eliminate measles and control rubella/congenital rubella syndrome (CRS) by 2020.		

When was the claim about administered vaccine doses made?		
01/05/2018		

How many doses of the vaccine in the claim had been given by 2018?		
The Measles-Rubella campaign started from February 2017 and has been rolled out in 21 states/UTs by July, 2018, covering nearly 9.2 crore children		

How many doses of the Measles-Rubella vaccine # had been given by 2018?		
nearly 9.2 crore (More than mentioned in the claim but the claim does say "Around"

claim: Colon cancer is the third biggest cause of death around the world.
evi:
How common is colon cancer?		
1 in 15 men and 1 in 18 women will be diagnosed with bowel cancer during their lifetime, the fourth most common cancer		

Is colon cancer a leading cause of cancer death?		
Yes, it is the second biggest cancer killer.		

Is it a leading cause of death around the world?		
No, It is not among the top 10 global causes of death according the the 2018 WHO report.		

Is it a leading cause of death around the world?		
Yes, For high income countries, colon and rectum cancers is in the top 10 leading causes of death, globally.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: colon cancer begins in the intestine then spreads to other parts of the body
evi:
Where does colon cancer initially start?		
Colon cancer usually first develops inside clumps of cells called polyps on the inner lining of the bowel.		

Does colon cancer spread to other parts of the body?		
Advanced colon cancer can spread to other parts of the body, this is called metastasis.
label: Supported

claim: Coconut oil decreases the side effects of chemotherapy
evi:
Have any studies been done to prove this?		
Yes, A 2014 study in Malalysia found that Virgin coconut oil reduced the symptoms related to side effects of chemotherapy.		

Was it just normal coconut oil that was used in the study?		
No, It was Virgin coconut oil, not just any coconut oil.

Virgin coconut oil uses fresh coconut meat, while regular coconut oil uses copra, or coconut meat that has already been dried.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Coconut oil removes 93% of colon cancer cells
evi:
Which study was the claim based off of		
A University of Adelaide research that looked into the potential of lauric acid in inducing apoptosis or cell death of colon cancer cells		

Was there a mention of coconut oil and linking it to the cure of colon cancer		
No, Coconut oil was not mentioned

claim: Lauric acid killed more than 93% of colon cancer cells within 2 days of treatment.
evi:
What effect does lauric acid have on cancer cells?		
Lauric acid induces apoptosis (cell death) in colon cancer cells.		

Were 93% of the colon cancer cells dead within two days?		
No answer could be found.
