claim: Posting on social media such as Instagram for Blackout Tuesday dilutes feeds and erases protesters’ posts burying the voices it's meant to amplify.
evi:
Were people advised to not post on social media for blackout Tuesday?		
Note that the use of the hashtags #BlackLivesMatter or #BLM is not recommended in this case as it is reportedly overwhelming important images in the main Black Lives Matter feed and making it difficult to find other Black Lives Matter content.		

Did Instagram merge #BlackOutTuesday and #BlackLivesMatter posts?		
No answer could be found.		

Does posting for Blackouttuesday make other protests on Instagram for BLM harder to see?		
No, “If you edit your post to remove a hashtag, your post will no longer be shown on that hashtag page,” she said. “In some cases, it may take up to 10 minutes for the post to be removed once you edit it. If someone uses #blacklivesmatter and #blackouttuesday in their caption, the post will appear on both hashtag pages – we are not merging the pages.”
label: Refuted

claim: A picture post has surfaced on the internet in which Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has been quoted praising interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi and former President Rahul Gandhi.
evi:
Did Nitin Gadkari say Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji awere very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?		
No, Fact checker websites have stated this is false.		

Did Nitin Gadkari say Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji were very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?		
No, Fact checker websites have stated this is false.		

Does Nitin Gadkari's official social media profile on Facebook or Twitter mention that Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji were very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?		
The comment is not found on Nitin Gadkari's Facebook page.		

Does Nitin Gadkari's official social media profile on Facebook or Twitter mention that Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji were very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?		
The comment is not found on Nitin Gadkari's Twitter page.		

Is there any evidence to confirm that Gadkari made the statement?		
There is no trace of this being said on any websites or social media pages.
label: Refuted

claim: Despite pledging to meet net zero emissions by 2050, on current track the UK government will only meet their target by 2099.
evi:
What does 'net zero' mean?		
Net zero means huge declines in the use of coal, oil and gas.

This requires steps such as halting sales of new internal combustion engine passenger cars, and phasing out all unabated coal and oil power plants.		

Has the UK government pledged to become net zero?		
Yes, The UK prime minister laid out this plan to go net zero,...
historic transitions to remove carbon from 
power, retire the internal combustion engine
from vehicles and start to phase out gas
boilers in homes. But it also that it will be done fairly by making carbon free alternatives cheaper		

When does the UK plan to be net zero by?		
The UK government has a binding target to reach net zero
emissions by 2050.		

Has the UK made much progress on  becoming net zero?		
Emission reduction has slowed to a crawl in recent years, with the amount of carbon released falling only 1.5 per cent in 2018 – less than half the fall of 3.2 per cent in 2017.		

Is the Uk likely to achieve its 2050 target?		
just one of 25 vital emissions-cutting policies has been delivered.		

Are the UK's emissions lower now than they were in the past		
emissions in 2018 are estimated to be 43.1% lower than they were in 1990.
label: Not Enough Evidence

claim: Dogs can smell COVID-19 on humans.
evi:
Can sniffer dogs be used to detect Covid-19?		
Yes, Around the world, canines are being trained to detect the whiff of COVID-19 infections.		

Where have Covid 19 sniffer dogs been trialled?		
Helsinki, Finland		

Where have Covid 19 sniffer dogs been trialled?		
Italy.		

Are sniffer dogs being used to detect Covid-19?		
There is variation in how well individual dogs perform, trial groups need to boost their sample sizes before the wider scientific community can evaluate how useful the dogs might be.		

What have studies found about sniffer dogs detecting COVID-19?		
A group in France, led by veterinary scientist Dominique Grandjean at the National Veterinary School of Alfort near Paris, posted its work3 on the preprint server bioRxiv in June. The researchers, who included Sarkis, trained 8 dogs to detect COVID-19 in 198 sweat samples, around half of which were from people with the disease. When these were hidden in a row of negative samples, the dogs identified the positive samples 83–100% of the time. The paper does not say how well the dogs identified negative test results. The research is now under review at a journal, but Grandjean says the process has not been easy. “To publish papers on detection dogs is very difficult because most reviewers do not know anything about working dogs,” he says.

The data in that study look promising, says Fyodor Urnov, a gene-editing scientist who is working on COVID testing at the University of California, Berkeley. But he would like to see larger data sets on how well dogs identify positive and negative samples. He also notes that there is variation in how well individual dogs perform. In Grandjean’s study, for example, 2 dogs identified 68 out of 68 positive samples, whereas one missed 10 out of 57 cases.		

Do the studies find that using sniffer dogs to detect COVID-19 is useful?		
Groups need to boost their sample sizes before the wider scientific community can evaluate how useful the dogs might be, agrees James Logan, an infectious-disease researcher at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine who is training and studying COVID-19 dogs, including Storm, Maple and Asher. “It’s important not to go out too early with grand claims and small data sets,” he says.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Ewedu can cure cancer.
evi:
What is ewedu?		
Ewedu leaf (Jute Leaf) is a  green, leafy vegetable		

What health benefits does ewedu have?		
Polyphenolic compounds found with anti-tumour potential from ewodu		

Do polyphenolic compounds kill cancer?		
Polyphenols may prevent carcinogenesis by affecting the molecular events in the initiation, promotion, and progression stages		

Can Ewedu cure cancer ?		
No, it is not a cure but a preventive mechanism. Presence of Vitamin B9 and phenolic compounds in the chemical reactions of DNA is beneficial. These mechanisms though preventative to carcinogenesis, do not pose as a definitive cure.
label: Refuted

claim: A no deal Brexit means we would have free trade with the world.
evi:
What does free trade mean?		
Free trade is a trade policy that does not restrict imports or exports. It can also be understood as the free market idea applied to international trade.		

How would a no deal Brexit affect the UK's trade agreements?		
Trade agreements that the UK is part of as an EU member state will no longer apply if there’s a no-deal Brexit.

The UK government is working on new agreements to replace EU trade agreements after Brexit.		

How much would the UK have to pay if there was a no deal Brexit?		
With no deal, it’s uncertain how much of that we’d have to pay, if anything.		

Would a no deal brexit mean we would have free trade with the world?		
The UK could import goods and services freely following a no-deal Brexit. But its exports would still be subject to other countries’ import regulations.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: A Facebook post claims that a no deal Brexit would mean no more uncontrolled immigration.
evi:
In what way would the UK have control over immigration if it left the EU with a no deal?		
As a non member of the European Union, the UK would no longer be obliged to follow EU rules on freedom of movement within the member states.		

What control would the UK have over EU immigration if a withdrawal agreement is passed?		
If UK Prime Minister Theresa May's draft withdrawal agreement was passed the government would end the free movement of people between the UK and EU after the end of the transition period.		

What would the main difference be from a United Kingdom border that was no longer part of the European Union?		
As a non member of the European Union, the UK would no longer be obliged to follow EU rules on freedom of movement within the member states.		

What does 'freedom of movement' mean in relation to the European Union?		
Freedom of movement and residence for persons in the European Union is the cornerstone of EU citizenship, established by the Treaty of Maastricht in 1992. The gradual phasing-out of internal borders under the Schengen agreements was followed by the adoption of Directive 2004/38/EC on the right of EU citizens and their family members to move and reside freely within the EU.		

How would the United Kingdom control immigration upon leaving the EU?		
There will no longer be one immigration system for non-Europeans, and another for EU citizens . The future
system will apply in the same way to all nationalities – EU and non-EU citizens alike – except where there are objective grounds to differentiate. 

Following the advice of the Migration Advisory Committee (MAC), we will prioritise skilled migrants. A skilled-based migration policy will ensure the UK remains a hub for international talent from the EU and the rest of the world, which attracts people to work in our vibrant and diverse communities in jobs that drive up productivity and wages, and deliver essential services.		

Did the United Kingdom already have powers to control EU immigration pre-Brexit?		
The UK is not part of the Schengen passport-free area because it hasn’t signed the Schengen agreement.

Part of the Schengen agreement means the 26 signatories agree to not carry out border checks between each other. For example, you can drive from France to Belgium with no checks, because the assumption is that Belgium is happy to let in anyone that France was also happy to let in.

That’s not the case with the UK. If you travel from France to the UK or vice-versa, your passport will be checked.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: As Mayor, Sadiq Khan produced a report to say that the Fire Services did not need further funding.
evi:
Did Mayor Sadiq Khan carry out a review of the London Fire Brigade?		
Yes, In August 2016 Sadiq appointed Anthony Mayer to carry out a full and independent review of the London Fire Brigade		

What did Anthony Mayer's 2016 report on the London Fire Brigade conclude about funding?		
The report recommended that the budget should not be increased, but that there should be no further reduction either.		

So did Sadiq Khan recommend that the fire brigades budget in London is not increased?		
Yes, This is correct. The published report said the London fire brigade "coped well" with the funding reductions. and that the budget should not be increased.
label: Supported

claim: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison stands alone during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France
evi:
Which social media sites had photo posted of Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison purporting to show him standing isolated during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France.		
The post was shared on Facebook and Twitter on August 26, 2019.		

Which social media sites had photo posted of Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison purporting to show him standing isolated during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France.		
The Chaser published it on their Twitter account on August 26, 2019 with the tweet:

Glad to report that a good chunk of the Australian media's time today has been wasted debunking this photo.		

Who is Australian's The Chaser?		
The Chaser was founded in 1999 as a fortnightly satirical newspaper		

What was the source of the original photograph?		
The image appears to have been taken from video when Morisson and other world leaders stood together for a photo at the G7 summit on August 25, 2019.		

Did the Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison stand all alone during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France ?		
The image has been photoshopped; it originated as a satirical post but has been shared out of context.
The group confirmed in an August 27 email to AFP that they had photoshopped the image.
label: Refuted

claim: Kenyans working at Mara North private wildlife park have been made to carry white tourists in sedan chairs depicting modern 'slavery'
evi:
Was the image in question shot at the Mara North Conservancy in Kenya?		
No, It was taken at Bwindi Impenetrable National Park in Uganda where this has been offered to frail or disabled tourists .		

Are the porters paid for their work?		
The porters were paid $300 (£194.31). This was a good fee for the porters and I could tell they they were pleased with the fee as they don’t usually earn that sort of money.

Tourists do not take up Porter Services for the sake of it as the service is expensive and the walking makes the gorilla experience more enjoyable.		

Who is likely to take up this porter service?		
The porter service is more likely to be taken up by tourists with disabilities whose life dream is to see the gorillas or the very elderly most especially the baby boomers with deep pockets  and the ability to pay $600 (£388.61) for a day’s gorilla trekking experience.
label: Refuted

claim: Suicide is the cause of death for around 3,000 people per day.
evi:
How many people die by suicide each year?		
More than 700 000 people die due to suicide every year.		

What is 700,000 divided by 365?		
1,917
label: Refuted

claim: Using the air conditioning (AC) in a vehicle consumes more fuel.
evi:
How can the use of air conditioning (AC) in a vehicle reduce fuel consumption?		
Running your car's air conditioning is the main contributor to reduced fuel economy in hot weather. Its effect depends on a number of factors, such as the outside temperature, humidity, and intensity of the sun. Under very hot conditions, AC use can reduce a conventional vehicle's fuel economy by more than 25%, particularly on short trips.1,2,3 The AC's effect on hybrids, plug-in hybrids, and electric vehicles (EVs) can be even larger on a percentage basis.2		

How does vehicle air conditioning (AC) work?		
... the air conditioning system uses the following parts:

Compressor — compresses the refrigerant into a fluid, so the liquid refrigerant flows through a line to the condenser.
Condenser — removes the heat from the refrigerant and pushes it along to the expansion valve or orifice tube.
Expansion valve or orifice tube — returns the refrigerant to its original gaseous state and moves it to the receiver/drier or accumulator.
Receiver/drier or accumulator — removes moisture from the refrigerant and transfers it to the evaporator.
Evaporator — pulls heat from the air passing through its core and transfers it into the refrigerant, resulting in cold air flowing beyond the evaporator.		

Can using a vehicle's air conditioning (AC) be fuel-efficient?		
Yes, According to the EPA, using your car’s AC can be more efficient while driving at highway speeds than having the windows open. Open windows elevate aerodynamic drag, causing the engine to work harder and burn more fuel.		

Does a vehicle's air conditioning (AC) waste less gas while driving at highway speeds?		
Yes, As long as the AC is used while driving at highway speeds, the AC won't waste gas.		

Does using your car's AC consume more fuel		
Using the AC in your car does lower your car’s fuel efficiency by an average of 3 miles per gallon depending on the age and size of your car. AC lowers your fuel efficiency because it is diverting energy from the engine to power the car. The fuel to power the AC has to come from somewhere, and the engine is the most efficient way for the AC to get its energy.

If you’re driving at high speeds, leaving your windows down can actually lower your fuel efficiency more than using your AC would. Lowering your windows can lower your fuel efficiency because the wind entering your car creates a drag that forces your car to work harder to get to the same speed if the windows were rolled up.
label: Supported

claim: The BMA advises that without immigrants “many NHS services would struggle to provide effective care”.
evi:
Where did the British Medical Association say this?		
This quote was reported by the Guardian in 2014		

Where did the British Medical Association say this?		
This quote was reported by the Guardian in 2014		

Where did the British Medical Association say this?		
The proportion of foreign nationals increases for professionally qualified clinical staff (14%) and even more so for doctors (26%), prompting the British Medical Association (BMA) to observe that without the contribution of non-British staff, "many NHS services would struggle to provide effective care to their patients".		

Has the BMA made more recent comments about this?		
Yes, December 2018
“Freedom of movement has allowed the thousands of staff from Europe – from doctors, nurses and care workers to hospital porters and cleaners – to come to the UK and provide valuable service in our NHS, and today’s plans to restrict immigration could be potentially devastating to patient care and the wider health and social care sector."
label: Supported

claim: The Wuhan coronavirus is a more virulent version of the normal cold.
evi:
Is Coronavirus the same as a common cold?		
Coronaviruses form a large family of viruses that can cause a range of illnesses. They include the common cold as well as more serious diseases such as SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome), MERS (Middle East respiratory syndrome) and, more recently, COVID-19.		

What is the Wuhan Coronavirus?		
Covid-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the strain of coronavirus that first emerged in December 2019 in Wuhan, China. This strain of coronavirus hadn’t been seen in humans before.		

What is the common cold?		
Colds are caused by many different viruses, but most commonly a rhinovirus or a coronavirus. A cold only affects your upper respiratory tract (your nose and throat), not your lungs. Because of this a cold is often referred to as a "head cold". Colds usually aren't serious.		

Is the Wuhan coronavirus more contageous than the common cold?		
Yes, It is more contagious than the cold, as it had a longer incubation time and the antibodies do not work well against in
label: Supported

claim: In the UK in 2020 there were 48,000 illegal immigrants staying in 4/5 star hotels.
evi:
How many asylum seekers were in  the UK in 2020?		
A National Audit Office (NAO) report in July found that 48,000 asylum seekers were being provided with accommodation by the government in March 2020.		

How many asylum seekers in the UK in 2020 were housed in 4 or 5 star hotels?		
In July 2020 an average of 2,800 asylum seekers were housed in temporary initial accommodation which included hotels. The NAO report does not describe the quality of the hotels being used.		

How many asylum seekers in the UK in 2020 were housed in 4 or 5 star hotels?		
In July 2020 an average of 2,800 asylum seekers were housed in temporary initial accommodation which included hotels. Of the 2,800 in initial accommodation, “more than 1,000” were in contingency accommodation, which includes hotels. The NAO report does not describe the quality of the hotels being used.
label: Refuted

claim: 5G wrecks immune systems and that is why people in Wuhan are suffering with this illness.
evi:
Is there any evidence that 5g is harmful to humans?		
there is no evidence that 5G is harmful to humans. 5G is the next generation of wireless network technology, following on from 4G. Like 4G, 3G and 2G before it, 5G mobile data is transmitted over radio waves—a small part of the whole electromagnetic spectrum (which includes microwaves, visible light and X-rays).		

Are the radio waves transmitted by 5g damaging to the body?		
These radio waves are non-ionising, meaning they don’t damage the DNA inside cells, as X-rays, gamma rays and UV rays are able to do. 5G, although at slightly higher frequencies than previous networks, is still in this radio part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

Public Health England has said that there’s no “convincing evidence” that exposure below International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation guidelines can cause adverse health effects. These guidelines go up to 300GHz, whereas the maximum for 5G will probably only be in the tens of GHz.

There is no evidence that 5G can damage the immune system.		

Are the radio waves transmitted by 5g damaging to the body?		
These radio waves are non-ionising, meaning they don’t damage the DNA inside cells, as X-rays, gamma rays and UV rays are able to do. 5G, although at slightly higher frequencies than previous networks, is still in this radio part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

Public Health England has said that there’s no “convincing evidence” that exposure below International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation guidelines can cause adverse health effects. These guidelines go up to 300GHz, whereas the maximum for 5G will probably only be in the tens of GHz.		

Is there evidence, that 5G damages the human system?		
There is no evidence that 5G can damage the immune system.
label: Refuted

claim: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan has slammed the Modi-government for not paying enough attention to Rohingya Muslims.
evi:
What was the website url that the claim appeared on?		
orientaltimes.in		

Does that website url load?		
No. The website does not exist.		

Has Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan slammed the Modi-government for not paying enough attention to Rohingya Muslims?		
No answer could be found.		

Have any other news outlets covered the story?		
No the story is fake/fabricated.
label: Refuted

claim: Drinking one glass of water before bed prevents heart attacks.
evi:
is there any data that drinking water before bed is better than drinking it at any other time?		
No, Dr. Marc Gilinov, a cardiovascular surgeon at the Cleveland Clinic, a hospital in the US state of Ohio, examined the claim that drinking water a specific times of the day has particular health benefits. He wrote in this debunk, “There is no data to suggest that ‘when’ you drink matters.” He advised choosing water over soda, and cautioned, “Don’t schedule your drinking according to a fictitious claim that the time you drink it matters.”		

is there any data that drinking water before bed is better than drinking it at any other time?		
A glass of water before sleeping can help to reduce the risk of a heart attack or stroke.		

Is there evidence that drinking a high water intake will reduce the risk of heart attacks?		
Yes, This large study of Californians published in 2002 found that high daily water intake (5 or more glasses) resulted in lower risk for fatal coronary heart disease than for people who had low daily water intake (2 or fewer glasses). The study did not record what time of day people were drinking the water.		

Is drinking water generally good for heart health?		
Yes, A study in the American Journal of Medical Epidemiology found that participants who drink five or more glasses of plain water per day have a lower risk for fatal coronary heart disease,
label: Supported

claim: A no deal Brexit means no more ECJ or ECHR.
evi:
Would a no deal Brexit remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice?		
Yes, The European Communities Act 1972 was the piece of legislation that brought the UK into the Europe Union: it gives EU law supremacy over UK national law.

A large amount of EU law effective in the UK currently relies on the 1972 Act.

The Act is repealed by the EU Withdrawal Act 2018		

What is the European Court of Human Rights?		
The European Court of Human Rights, judicial organ of the Council of Europe,
examines applications from individuals, but also inter-State applications, lodged by
a State against another State party to the Convention. Currently 47 countries have
undertaken to secure fundamental rights and freedoms, not only to their nationals
but to everyone, even non-Europeans, within their jurisdiction.		

What is the Council of Europe?		
The Council of Europe (CoE) is a pan-European organisation of 46 member states, including all 27 member states of the European Union. The United Kingdom was one of the founding members. Set up shortly after the end of the Second World War, the CoE’s core mission is to promote human rights, democracy and the rule of law across the continent.		

Would a no-deal Brexit remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Human Rights?		
The UK will continue to be a member of the European Court of Human Rights after Brexit because its jurisdiction has nothing to do with the EU		

Would a no-deal Brexit remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Human Rights?		
No, Even if the UK leaves the European Union, it is still a participant in the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR).
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: Matt Hancock owns the company responsible for supplying the NHS.
evi:
Who manages the NHS supply chain?		
Supply Chain Coordination Limited (SCCL) is a company Registered in England and Wales, with company number 10881715, to act as the management function of the NHS Supply Chain.		

Who owns SCCL?		
The company is wholly owned by the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care who provides direction to the Company through his appointed director on the Board and by a letter of entrustment.		

When was this claim made?		
21/04/2020		

Who was Secretary of State for Health in April 2020?		
Matt Hancock.		

Is SCCL owned by a particular individual		
The company is wholly owned by the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care who provides direction to the Company through his appointed director on the Board and by a letter of entrustment a copy of which can be found here.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

claim: £1 billion was given to 13 companies for PPE but no PPE has been supplied.
evi:
How much was given by the UK government to companies for the purchase of PPEs		
£1 billion		

How much was given by the UK government to companies for the purchase of PPEs		
The total value of PPE contracts awarded by government departments
between January and July 2020 was £12.3 billion		

Where any of the contracts delivered		
Chief Operating Officer of Ayanda Capitol Ltd said that their contract was successfully fulfilled.		

Where any of the contracts delivered		
Uniserve Ltd website shows it's deliveries were supplied		

Which country does the claim refer to?		
United Kingdom.		

What Companies doe s the claim say did not deliver the PPE paid for?		
- Uniserve Ltd of Essex,
- Ayanda Capital

Were there any problems with PPE?

claim: Mixing one tablespoon of 2% iodine and one cup of baby oil will create a substance that removes body hair.
evi:
Does baby oil and iodine have effect on body hair		
It has no effect on it		

Can you use baby oil and iodine to remove body hair?		
Blogger tried it and it didn't work.		

Can you use baby oil and iodine to remove body hair?		
Which leads me into why I don't believe this is even remotely plausible as a pin. You see, it's common for surgeons to scrub an area before surgery with iodine. If iodine was such a remarkable hair remover, why would they bother doing pre-op shaving? Anyone who has had surgery on an area with hair growth can tell you that the area is shaved before hand. Wouldn't doctors, of all people, look for time-saving methods and skip the shaving if iodine could double as an antiseptic AND hair remover?
label: Refuted
